name: WalletHub
review: The Nordstrom Store Credit Card is available to people with fair/limited credit and does not charge an annual fee. As such, it’s a great way to invest in your credit standing. This card also offers a decent initial bonus and solid ongoing rewards, at least in percentage terms, giving you a $20 rebate on a purchase of at least $100 the day of account opening and then the points equivalent of 2% back on Nordstrom purchases. Plus, you’ll benefit from free alterations, “triple-points days” and other Nordstrom deals.  But it’s important to note that most of that package is easily replaceable by another credit card. So you shouldn’t lose any sleep if you choose to let this offer slip by. And if you’re on the fence about whether to apply, you can learn more from our in-depth Nordstrom Credit Card review: https://wallethub.com/edu/nordstrom-credit-card-review/25965/.

name: WalletHub
review: TD Bank Personal Loan ReviewTD Bank offers inexpensive personal loans, with APRs starting at 6.99% and stopping at a maximum of 18.99%. That’s around half as high as the 36% maximum possible from many other major lenders. TD Bank is also unique in that it’s one of a handful of major lenders that offer not just unsecured personal loans but secured loans as well. TD’s unsecured loans don’t charge origination fees, but there’s a $50 fee on secured loans. One drawback to TD Bank is that they only operate in 15 states and D.C. However, people who do live in areas the bank services will be able to enjoy competitive terms on their loans. Customers can borrow up to $50,000 and can get up to 60 months to pay their loans off. TD also has a good reputation from the BBB and from their customers, which means consumers can borrow with confidence. TD Bank Personal Loan Review Highlights: •	APRs: 6.99% to 18.99%•	Loan sizes: $2,000 to $50,000•	Payoff periods: 12 to 60 months•	Credit score requirement: 750+ (660+ for TD customers)•	Origination fee: $0 for unsecured, $50 for secured •	Other fees: $5 late payment fee•	Reputation: Payoff scores an A+ with the Better Business Bureau and has a 3.8/5 user rating on WalletHub.•	Co-signers: AllowedAltogether, TD Bank personal loans are a great option for those fortunate enough to live in one of the states the bank services. Below, you can see how WalletHub rates TD Bank in our three major personal loan review categories: Terms, Requirements & Application, and Reviews & Transparency. TD Bank Ratings by Category:Terms 5 / 5Requirements & Application 3.5 / 5Reviews & Transparency 3.5 / 5Overall Score 4.4 / 5

name: WalletHub
review: The TD Bank Cash Visa Card is an average offer with a cherry on top for someone with the excellent credit needed for approval. That cherry comes in the form of a $100 initial bonus for spending just $500 within 90 days of account approval and the offer’s lack of an annual fee. The middling nature of the offer comes from its 1% cash-back base earning rate (supplemented by just 2% back only on dining); its unfavorable regular APR; and a 4% balance-transfer fee that ruins the availability of 0% financing on balance transfers for the first 12 months.All things considered, this isn’t a bad card to have in your wallet if you’re a relatively light spender who has excellent credit, pays with credit primarily when dining out and never carries a balance from month to month. In such a scenario, it won’t cost you a thing and will provide a decent rewards yield without requiring much thought. But if you want to get the best credit card possible, this isn’t the offer for you. The excellent-credit corner of the market is quite competitive, and there are better deals to be had whether you’re in the market for rewards or low-cost financing. For more information about how we came to this conclusion and some alternative offers to consider, check out our full-length TD Bank Credit Card review: http://wallethub.com/edu/td-bank-credit-card-review/25997/ .

It’s been 5 months I never got it, called them, they say they’ll check, never returned to me, called them again about a month after and they claim I’m lying since I got this in an email and not a direct mail I’m not entitled. I asked why no one called me back or send me a mail to let me know, the rep say that they’re not supposed to. The fiasco continued when they continuously charged me for a maintenance fee for two months on a triple charge that happened in one day and conveniently this day is the end of what they call cycle so you’re charged twice for each cycle. The customer service rep did try to help but their protocols are so horrible that they manage to alienate me as a client even further. THIS IS NOT CONVENIENCE BANKING. I WOULD RECOMMEND TO STAY AWAY.

review: This is what TD Canada Trust is doing to a 17 year old kid with developmental delays. Someone was able to mobile deposit a fraudulent BC Hydro cheque to his bank account for $2,000.00. They refuse to disclose the email address the money was transferred to. This is a youth account that has a few hundred dollars PER YEAR go through it and mobile deposit has never been used, he wouldn't even know how. Now they have a collection agency harassing a 17 year old kid with disabilities!!Further to this, we've learned that TD is now taking every penny from his first job directly from his bank account.They've ignored us, treated my son very poorly and are now stealing from a 17 year old Autistic minor.WHAT A DISGUSTING BANK!!!!!

name: jordanbutt
review: I have had possibly the worst customer service experience with this TD Bank card.I recently moved from Philadelphia to Rochester and transferred my address. TD Credit card responded by freezing my card until I could verify my identity. They did not notify me of this; my card was simply declined 7 days after I had moved.I called TD credit card customer service, who provided me with an actual address for a TD bank location in Rochester... which closed five years ago. I then called back, and was told I had to verify my identity with 2 forms of ID. I was told to fax them over to a number (the supervisor, Preston, was unsure which ID would fit that requirement, however) I then called in 3 days later, asking if my identity had been verified so I could use my card. I was then told that the fax number provided was incorrect. I then refaxed everything (paying out of pocket; I do not have a fax) and was told it was received 2 days afterwards. However, I was informed it was pending review, and was told to call again in 3 days. I called again in 3 days, however, I was then told I also needed to provide a copy of my utility bill. This had not been mentioned to me. I was then told to fax my 5 page utility bill (keep in mind faxing is $2.19 per page near me)I have asked to cancel this card numerous times, only to be sent to a customer service rep who then sends me back to the TD line I was on. Everyone on the phone is super unhelpful and simply wants you to hang up. I urge anyone to stay away from TD bank as much as you can. I have been a loyal TD bank user for over a decade and this is how I was rewarded. Go to a better company who will treat you better and not make you call numerous times.

name: aaron aaron
review: TD Bank apparently outsources their credit disputes to a third party company called 'Total Systems'. Their investigative department is, apparently, just another money making scheme for TD Bank. Despite each customer agent I get on the phone telling me that I, a single male with no children, shouldn't have to pay for the fraudulent purchase of over 1000 dollars of electronic lactation pumps, the investigative department refuses to re-open my case. There is no path to resolution of this dispute, as the same investigator keeps denying the claim they spent less than one day investigating, and no one in Total Systems is able to talk to an investigator. Even supervisors aren't allowed to communicate with them. A credit card is supposed to protect you from fraudulent charges, but it is clear that TD bank has outsourced its dispute department to a company that does not care about customers.TLDR; Stay away from TD bank. They do NOT protect their customers, and they outsource disputes to a shady third party company called "Total Systems"

review: These people are crooks with the way they do business and their ridiculous fee schedule when it is unwarranted. It is sneaky how they do it based on their end of month. Shady. Crooks. Never banking here again and neither should you. Reporting to the BBB.

name: eefron1234
review: DO NOT USE TD BANK! I have never left a negative review in my life, but I really feel the need to warn people. From the beginning I was met with poor communication and incompetence, even from the supervisors. I had over 32 unanswered emails and phone calls from them, which almost cost me to lose the house because of the amount of delays they forced. I thought once in the house, the nightmare would end but it's only gotten worse - I've had a problem every month. Credit score affected by their incompetence, first when they had to run it multiple times when they passed me through 4 different loan processors, and now because each time they tell me a payment is made via phone or walking into my local branch, there is an error. For example, this month instead of issuing the payment as a payment, they added to my account as an "unapplied fund," which did not count as a payment and then they issued me a late fee, so the unapplied funds were now less than my payment by $13 so they weren't applied again, therefore another late fee. I take personal accountability where it is due, but please just be warned. TD Bank is not the right choice and I wish someone told me this.

name: khue_nguyen18
review: My dad's bank account got hacked, he doesn't speak English, he's partially deaf. I tried calling their online call center to report fraud transactions. They refused to speak to me except through a translator, even though my dad was there and authorized me to help him with his banking. They refused to refund the fraudulent transactions, saying that they had to conduct an "an investigation" first.  They closed his debit card, and will send him a new card. But what is the point of having a bank if they are so useless against fraud? There was all this red tape they made us jump through just to talk to someone about my dad's account. He can barely hear, and he couldn't hear the translator well.

name: Angela France
review: I was simply totally disappointed with this bank. End of story. They treated me like a second class citizen with little compassion or concern about my customer experience or satisfaction. Long hold times with no follow through on their problem solving. Definitely not characteristics of a financial institution I would want to be part of!!

name: Joel ledgister
review: Worst bank to use when opening a small business. Just started my own little business. I get cheques from the same companies every week but it still takes over a week before the cheques are cleared. I thought we lived in the 21st century where everything is done instantaneously. I have 2 cheques on hold currently 1 cheque over a week and the other is recent. Definitely joining a different bank after this holiday weekend. My business is on pause because of this bank. Again I just started my own business and now it is on pause because of a bank. Very frustrating.

name: Dema
review: Someone charged to my account and can’t get any help from target my balance should only be $175 This is effectively my score I totally disagree with the charges and the balance

name: Tanisha
review: Love the cash back when the holidays come around. It’s always handy when I need it most. This card is used for the whole house. Just need a higher limit

name: milliemallofservices
review: Goodness Gracious I need this pandemic to up & disappear! I promise you that is the absolute only reason I'm stuck with this absurd bank. I have had my checking account blocked twice for no reason when I needed my card the most and thanks to them I've experienced hunger on a whole new level. One of the Worst feelings in the world is to know you have money but have no access to it because someone else decided to block card access until they feel there's no fraudulent activity. The funniest part is that when there was actual fraudulent activity due to a site stealing my card info, they let it go thru and refused to reimburse me. I explained I never authorized such an order and was told in 100 ways that there was nothing they could do. Oh let me add that when I called to have this hold/block on my account lifted, they told me that I had to contact a completely different department. If you have your account linked to PayPal and transfer funds but while transferring PayPal gives an error msg that caused you to make another attempt at the same transfer, then realize the error msg didn't matter because the first transfer did in fact go thru so you contact them to cancel the second Transfer, they will tell you that you missed the 24 hr deadline. So it's my fault that you ppl had me on hold 2 hrs and 57 mins to then disconnect and make me start over all day until there was no option left but to wait? Absolutely absurd and good luck if you plan to open a Savings account in hopes of making your money grow....lol might as well consider yourself BROKE FOREVER? Worst INCONVENIENT Bank in the world. They need to change their disrespectful ads as well because they don't believe in low or middle-class folks deserving any perks. They offer a $200 bonus for new Customers that open an account and deposit 20k into their account within an extremely sad amount of time so needless to say that if you make minimum wage or your income is SSI/SSD then u just won't get that little 200 bucks. The average person doesn't even make 20k in a year let alone in a couple months. Seriously stop with the BS ads. They should say "ARE YOU WEALTHY AND WANT TO BE JUST A LITTLE WEALTHIER, THEN OPEN AN ACCOUNT WITH US." Can't wait to leave this pathetic bank that does nothing but take from us. Notice this was the only bank still taking maintenance fees during beginning stages of pandemic while all other banks waived the fees and did some other pretty cool things for their clientele.

name: mfletcher20
review: Do not use this bank if you have any intentions of actually using your money. They will overdraft their own overdraft fees and drive you HUNDREDS in the negative, then in 2 weeks sell your debt to collections. I was a customer for 15 years since I was in high school when it was Commerce and STD bank came and bought it out. Since that day it's been a nightmare. I tried speaking to customer service on the phone and in-branch and no help. A 3 dollar charge at Walmart and 15 at Wawa somehow can cause 8 overdraft fees from only the 2 and they refused any assistance. They've sent it to 3 collection agencies now trying to now extort me for 3 times the amount. This bank is the worst and you'd be an absolute fool to ever think they're going to help you at all.

name: Pete Doragh
review: It is a busy time in real estate. Stay away from TD Bank as they are too busy to close on time, tell the truth about what to expect, fix any problem when it arises, or communicate the status of their own piece of the closing. My daughter and son-in-law are buying their first home. Should be a great time, but stressful of course. The closing date was in the original contract signed weeks ago and the bank has had all the information they needed. In fact the kids were pre-approved so only the property needed to be analyzed. Well the day before closing the bank "could not complete processing. Set the deal back a week. In that week the bank has done nothing and now has gone radio silent despite several promises of an update. So whether closing will happen tomorrow on the date the bank set remains a mystery. Do yourself a favor and go with another bank that can at least manage its own business and keep its promises.

name: Brett
review: I like the card it has helped me very much I give it a 4 out of five...

name: manda_blake
review: They are called “America’s most convenient bank” for a reason! Their customer service is outstanding, they are able to give you a new debit card in the bank immediately if it is lost or stolen whereas most banks you have to wait for it in the mail. I will never change banks again.

name: Casimiro
review: Very good card I'm happy with this card and I will recommend it to anybody looking for a very good card for their personal and family use

name: Katrina Goins
review: Terrible underwriting department and not good communication skills from Mortgage Loan Officers. This Bank is not a good for people that need to utilize Down Payment Assistance; as they denied a very basic forgivable loan and would not help their customer with any other down payment assistance options. If you have 20% down - this bank is for you!

name: Paul
review: Decent if a Target Customer and spend a lot of your purchases with groceries and electronics.  Try to make sure you use the card at Starbucks within the store as well to earn 5%.

name: SEAN
review: This card is not worth getting. Had a $1700 credit line, and as soon as the pandemic hit, they decreased my limit to $1200, with no missed payments. This quickly hit my credit score as my usage went up. They just decreased my limit for the last time, as once again my credit score has been affected. NOT WORTH IT! TAKE your 5% and shove it..

name: Eric Renta
review: Td Bank is the worst bank in USA,  their customer service is the most incompetent in the industry. I have no idea how that they still around . I wouldn'trecommend this bank to my worst enemy.

name: Sharon
review: Closed on 4/29 per letter from Target, will be seen on statement of 5/26.  We returned items, which were to be credited for by receiving gift certificates to our account.  This was not done and had this $17.30 in suspense until disputed items were resolved.  Closing this account because I only buy one item at Target & should I decide to buy something else then decide to take it back the 5% Reward on the Card isn't worth the hassle... it has happened to us before with Target.

name: Marguerite M Allred-Crawford
review: Nordstrom was a favorite store when they were the only company to carry my favorite perfume. It is available for less now elsewhere, but I keep the card in case of wedding, etc.

name: Dana
review: I rarely use this card that refuses to give me an increase. I spend more than 300.00 limit when shopping and it is not worth using two cards

name: RAYMOND
review: Card reports to the credit bureaus timely, however, in spite of my impeccable pay history, I haven’t received a credit line increase in years. Also, its reward savings for using the card is very low.

name: Kimiko
review: The Target credit card is a good credit card to use because basically you save 5% off each and every purchase when you use your card at Target.

name: Moein Borghei
review: I was pre-approved and had a very good credit score, however, they gave me a $500 credit line!!!! There were so many better options instead of this totally worthless credit card! DO NOT GET FOOLED BY THEIR ADS!

name: Linda S
review: No enough help personnel to “help” or check; esp. on holidays. Don’t be even one day late on payment; hefty late fee. At times I’ve had to ask 2-3 Target people to locate an item

name: Mary
review: Great card! Don’t use often because of location, but plan to use more often when the COVID-19 pandemic winds down. But as far as the target card it saves you a lot.

name: Christine
review: Always convenient and friendly. Thank you for always being available I don’t know what to say anymore. Lol. Help!!!! Stay safe.

name: Shazia
review: It's good to me always helps me for maintaining my score I use it when I need I prefer to use money from direct deposit, not credit cards

name: Vincent
review: I love it it was a little hard to get at first but now that I did I use it whenever I go over to target they give you 5% on your purchase

name: Shelby
review: Excellent benefits for employee/family use. Very responsive, really handy for early sale access & to stock up on basics & reminders for yearly gift giving. Very solid Company: High rate of trust & personal service

name: brivers028017
review: I can't express how disappointed I am with this card and their Customer Service.  I have been a cardholder for 10 plus years.  Today my credit limit was randomly lowered to $300.00.  I have no late payments a very high credit score and low credit balances.  When I called they have zero info and just say they can't do anything.  This is such a bad policy and I can't believe this bank treats long-standing good customers.  I will never do anything with this bank again.  Frankly, I will not shop at Target anymore either so long as this POS bank runs their red card.  DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THIS CARD THEY ARE A TERRIBLE BANK WITH HORRIBLE PRACTICES AND CUSTOMER SERVICE.

name: Anthony
review: I have not used this card for a year, pandemic had us stay in, this is why it affected my credit score, NOT FAIR !!!! So I will shop somewhere else.

name: Napoleon
review: they put me in the late payment, they didn't realize that the items were returned , now my credit score went down, 1t's 32$ and they ruined my score, that sucks

name: Sharon
review: Not a difficult card to acquire however I've had the card nearly 3 years and have never paid the account late and pay off monthly and yet no credit line increase. They say they use the Experian Credit Report. My score fluxes between Excellent and Good and yet no increase in credit limit has been approved. The good news is there is no hard pull when you request a credit line increase.

name: Shari-Khadija L Zaidi
review: Great Products. I enjoy shopping at Target. I received 5% back on most purchases. It's a great place to shop. I love their products and some prices are low.

name: Michelle
review: This product is excellent! I’m hoping the information I submitted will be updated soon!  I look forward to reviewing this on a monthly basis.

name: Dustin
review: Amazing for purchases at Target, 5% off is beating anything else cash-back wise and is totally worth it if you shop at Target often. The MasterCard version of the card is great...but only if you only use it at Target. They send you the Target gift card *once per year* so that’s a long wait for 1-2% back.

name: Isabel Lynn Etkind
review: It is a basic credit card that only allows the cardholder to shop at Target. It provides 5% off of most purchases which is nice, but does not have any value outside of the Target Store.

name: Kenneth
review: Great card get lots of coupons specials and red card cash easy to use in store and online order online and pick up in a couple hours

name: Warren F Wiegert
review: TD's Visa has the worst customer service I've ever encountered.  When renewal cards did not reach me I made multiple phone calls to correct the situation.  Despite TD's assurances that new cards were on the way, I never received them and closed the account in disgust.

name: Sandra
review: My target card has been a great card for buying discounted Disney gift cards and saving my family money on all things Target! I always pay in full to help my credit score

name: coelhotecia
review: THE MOST INCONVENIENT bank for refinance The lack of underwriting expertise and loan officers is very disappointing. It’s been over 6 months that my refinance loan with no money down was approved. They still not have answered when my closing will be, I paid for the appraisal and everything, now I need to find another company because I LOST MONEY, TIME AND INTEREST TO MOVE FORWARD WITH REFINANCE

name: John Patel
review: Worst bank, I had opened account through online promotional offer, after opening account I asked please verify did I satisfied all requirements, they told you will get your promotional bonus once it’s due, I didn’t get. I called customer service they told you satisfied requirements you should be getting soon. I never did. After several attempts they came up rule that was not available that only for mailer offer, but I read all rules it’s not. It’s cheap scam run by these thugs to hold 25k in deposit and steal people's personal information.

name: Biancka
review: Card is perfectly fine! 5% discount on all orders and free shipping on all items that can ship on their own is great too! No issues as of 2 months!

name: Riva Bren
review: I just need to vent about how awful this bank is. I don't advise traveling with TDBank because your card will be declined a lot and you'll get stuck in situations that are scary. In fact don't even open an account with them. This is coming from someone who has a credit card and debit card with them. Even going to an ATM to have cash on hand, you will get blocked. There were so many close calls for me missing work, missing my flights, going hungry.When you call they insinuate that you're lying and that your card is "active and ready to use". Then when you go through these long drawn verification processes they still don't know why you're being blocked. They have to investigate and it takes days to do so. By far the worst bank I've ever had the displeasure of banking with. I'm happy to say that I'm closing all my accounts with TDBank today.Rant Over.

name: Christian
review: Save 5% on almost every purchase with this card when you use it online or at target.com. With that, I save anywhere for $200-$400 a year

name: Denise W
review: At start of covid instead of store payment I called to make. I was informed I must have my bank checking acct#, or she could not help me. Figured covid problem. In May target called me said she was wrong he can make a payment with my debit card. Said he would remove late mark but never did. I have one late on all my credit. Them. Not Good at all.

name: Alfredo
review: Love target . The best it's my favorite dept store . There is nothing that I want more that to go to targets and shop for hours . Ty.

name: Michael
review: Will not raise your limit. I called them and all they will say is have you updated your income and that’s the only response they will give you

name: Yuriy Buha
review: Limited features for online banking: Cannot view or download transactions older than 60 days. Poor customer support: I opened the account and should have received $300 promotion. I have not received it yet. Already called four times. The support states that they can only email promotion department and they are very busy. I have been trying to get that resolved since February 2021 (month and a half as of today)

name: brandi
review: Great rewards for a department store card. I earn Nordstrom rewards that can be spent in store with every purchase. The Nordy Club is great.

name: dcebc
review: $300 credit limit for two years, absolutely no increase, plus I have excellent credit.  Spend about $500 per month at Target. Have to make a payment twice per month in order to get the discount. Love Target, just not TD Bank that issues the card, and doesn’t allow you to ask for a CLI.

name: Tina
review: I’ve had the target card since 2008, I like that I get rewarded each time I use it, it gives me 5% of right at the checkout, 5% doesn’t sound like much, but that covers the sales tax each time.

name: Deborah
review: Love target! Good products. Purchased Casper king down pillows online with target. Free delivery. Have used their grocery delivery during the pandemic. Excellent service.

name: Bruce
review: TD Bank is great! They have the best service hours and their staff is wonderful.  The work space setting is well designed  . Their  tools and accessories are great ; especially the apps.

name: William Fairbrother
review: Absolutely worst experience of my life. One hand doesn’t know what the other hand is doing. It’s not my job, it’s somebody else’s job talk to them. Never got anything resolved it was just easier to pay the $2000 YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!!!!

name: Kristin
review: The rewards aren't really enough to make me excited to use it. Yes, they do have the free two day shipping but Target prices seem to be higher than other places so it's not really saving me much. They did start me out with a $1200 limit though, which helped lower my credit utilization but other than that.... worthless card pretty much.

name: fathia
review: target has wonderful savings and rewards programs. I love shopping there and saving money. no fees or anything like that. good card.

name: Nina
review: Poor business and customer policies. I haven't used the card in a while since my need for new clothes has been very limited due to the pandemic. They lowered my credit amount even though I have excellent credit and pay all my balances in full. I cancelled the card, very disappointed.

name: Paul
review: TD Bank has been good to me. They were one of the first to give me credit. Easy to deal with and great hours of opperation . I give them 5 stars!!

name: keith
review: Gives you a 5% Discount on Every Purchase - Sale, Clearance or Otherwise. Regular Review for Automatic Credit Line Increase and if you Purchase Online you get an additional 5% Discount as well as Contactless Pick Up in a Special Area of the Parking Lot.

name: randalls_49
review: a great card enjoy shopping at targetA great place to shopReturns not a problem Friendly service great hours operation Love it there

name: Eddie
review: I use the card for groceries and it does give 5 percent back on all purchases, 5 percent back makes the milk cheaper than Walmart, but that's a loss leader to get you in the store, most groceries are much higher than Walmart, waiting for 18 months with usage for the Visa Upgrade, then more usage.

name: Kliggs
review: Yes I would recommend Target store card for future purchases for emergency and family products. Always good to have little insurance on the side just in case for those hard times.

name: Joseph
review: If you don't use your credit card frequently, Target screws you and lowers your credit limit.  This is discrimination and unfair if you are not a frequent shopper.

name: Salvador
review: Amazing my g. Makes shopping simple and I couldn’t have done it without the ease of the target card and the target app. I’ve bought a heater, underwear, and toothpaste!

name: Zachery
review: My oldest line of credit at more than 14 years. the interest is low and ever so often I get a twenty-dollar note after spending a certain amount.

name: Charles
review: I will most likely cancel this card for the fact that I was never notified that there was or would be a decrease in my limit. They also gave me no reason for the decrease in my limit.

name: edmund
review: I’ve been with Target now eight years and I have never missed a payment and one of my first store cards they are my brothers door card that I have a bag in my credit back that was a little hairy but they took a shot with me and I get a proven myself because they give me increases every other year you’re awesome awesome card very very fortunate to have doing business with them I love it they work with you customer service is outstanding and I plan on being with them for a long time thank you Target

name: Donald Davis
review: If I could give less than 1 star I would. I requested an extension to my car loan back in November as I was unemployed, and they accepted it. They told me all I had to do was pay the interest fees. Great! Except... apparently there's paperwork that I had to fill out that I was neither informed of, nor sent in any way. I received a call after the first week of December of them telling me that I haven't paid my bill for November yet. Once I told them that I requested an extension, they told me I had to fill out and send back the paperwork they sent me. Well, I informed them that I never received said paperwork, and they promised to get it sent out to me. Well, they didn't, and I kept receiving phone calls that I had to pay, and that they would send the paperwork after the call. This went on for several weeks, until someone finally got it through to me through their secure message center. The following day, I got it printed, signed, and faxed over through Staples as I don't have a fax machine, and even paid to get it done.Fast forward to the following week, I call to make sure that they received it, and they said that they did but it had to take a couple days to process. I was patient, but it never finished processing, so I called back and they told me I sent them the wrong paperwork. I told them that I just sent what they sent me, but it turns out they sent me the wrong paperwork. So they send a new one and I send that one, paying for it again. However, while this was all happening, we got threats about my credit taking a hit if we didn't start paying soon, TD told me not to worry about it. Well, they never processed that paperwork and my credit indeed took a hit. I was livid, and called back. They told me AGAIN that I sent the wrong paperwork. It told them that I had sent them paperwork twice now, and I'm not sending them anymore. I finally got through to someone who knew what he was doing, and he said he would take care of it. I was also told that they would contact the credit agency themselves and get things straightened out. At first I thought we were finally set. My bill was back to normal, and my account showed no signs of having any late bills. However, this week I received a letter saying that my dispute was denied, and after investigating they found they did nothing wrong. How is it that TD contacted them themselves and they still denied it?? On top of that, I can't call or email them so I called TD back and they don't know what's going on either. I've had enough, this has been going on for months and I have every right to contact my lawyer and have this taken care of, because this is absolutely ridiculous. I tried so hard to be patient and understanding but all I did was get stepped on and abused by them. If you're considering using TD for your auto loan, DON'T. They will refuse to do any work that they're required to, and YOU'RE going to suffer because of it. If you care at all about your credit, stay far away from them.

name: emilio
review: Is a good card with good rewards, if that is your primary objective go ahead. Their only problem is their customer service. It takes several minutes on hold every time you call, after that their service is quite good.

name: Songaya
review: Very organized and easy to understand your credit on this particular app. I am amazed at how much information they are able to pull up just by your social security number. Thanks for developing this app to help people view their credit report information online.

name: donald
review: Thank you for all your efforts in trying to make sure i get the best deals they have on the market. I feel like i have a friend in the credit world

name: Christopher
review: ZERO STARS!The Target RedCard is one of the worst cards to have. Before I explain why this is one of the worst cards to have, I will disclose some information used to evaluate my creditworthiness. Over the past 24 months my credit score has been anywhere between 802 and 823. I make 160k+ per annum and never utilize more than a 3% of my overall credit. Upon opening my Target RedCard, I was only given a $2000 credit limit. After about a month I asked for an increase which was denied. Around 3 or 4-months later I asked again and was only granted a CL of $3500. This means that if I do not want this cards balance to adversely effect my credit score by keeping it under 10% of the balance I can only spend a max of $350 on any given month. A few months after the increase to $3500 I purchased a NetGear router, Air Pods and few other less expensive items totaling around $550. Durning this same billing cycle Target decided they should decrease my CL to $1000 without any written or verbal notice. The > 50% utilization caused my credit score to drop around 17 points. Furthermore, they were unwilling to increase my CL. Credit score declines from an increased utilization percent are temporary. Once you pay it off, your credit score should return to where it was previously (given there are no other changes in your credit). So no big deal, right? Wrong! Out of nowhere Target decides to close my RedCard. Targets decision to close my card is permanent and has several deleterious effects on my credit. 1. I have had this card for many years and it reduced my average age of credit history.2. Shows up as closed account for which no more payments can be made and it remains on credit report as closed for another 7 to 10 years.3. To get another Target RedCard I would need to reapply which results in a hard credit pull. As you know this also dings your credit score.4. It will most likely effect your overall credit card utilization rate. Not so much for me since the last CL on my RedCard was only $1000.In summary, this is one of the worst credit cards for new and long time credit card holders because of business practices employed by TD Bank. This card is not worth the 5% back even when you consider a signup bonus gift card of $25 or $50. DO NOT APPLY FOR THIS CARD. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

name: Joseph
review:
I agree.  There was not warning that this account was closing for inactivity - (6 months).  This was the card I had the longest and it has dropped my oldest credit rating. It does show as closed in good standing, but who reads the comments in the reports?
Target should be ashamed of themselves.  I hope they go out of business.  All you who are thinking that Target cards great need to understand the Target can do this to you at any time and lower your credit score.  
I didnt keep this card in my wallet - as I only used if for large purchases and other more often cards were those which warranted room in my wallet.
I will shop elsewhere now. Evidently Target doesn't need me - and I now don't need them.

name: Chris Herrick
review: Lowering credit limit when utilization is always under 5 percent. And credit score is 714. Always have paid blll in full every month. Card sucks

name: Kathleen
review: Convenient and you get 5% off on all purchases. Drive up pick up too. Negatives: They don’t accept requests for credit line increases.  Credit line increases come only when they decide to increase.

name: Rachel Bauer
review: It is a great card to shop with plus free shipping BUT IT IS INSANELY DIFFICULT to pay my bill. I cannot pay it through the app and the website?? I have had to change my passwords 3 times in the past 6 months when going to logon to pay because they are no longer recognized. I know they are correct bc I've created special ones just for their webpage and have written them down, so I know I am entering exactly right the new password. But it won't let me log on. I've reached out to Target several times about this, but they feign innocence. It is my belief that they time-out passwords on purpose so that, by the time you can get online to pay your bill (especially if you're not someone like me who sets it up at least a week in advance) because cut off payment is 5pm on the day it is due (what other credit card does not accept same-day payments on the day a bill is due? IT'S ALL ELECTRONIC, TARGET!!), you're then too late and they can charge you a late payment fee. SHAME ON YOU, TARGET!

name: jorgerodriguez_2
review: My experience with TD has been outstanding, I have two other banks but TD has stood out from the banking crowd in many aspects. This is why I have been with TD for 17 years and going !!! Go TD bank!!

name: Mitchell
review: Horrible customer service, I have a 787 Experian Score according to their own letter recently sent to me and yet after 2 years and heavy spend on it they have kept me at a meager $2,500 CL even though numerous other cards have limits of $7000-50k! I am not going to use this card much longer, switching to a all points major bank provider and keep my relationship with my Sales associate and encourage her to move to Saks!

name: Jonathan R
review: So I open an account with TD Bank, a ROTH IRA with TD Ameritrade and a Checking and Savings account with TD Bank... I get the card and my first 4 times I tried to use my card it got declined. I would call the number on the back of my card and they would tell me I have to go into a branch because they can't verify my phone number. I've explained this to people on customer support, I've explained it in the branch and nobody knows. Absolutely nobody at TD Bank can tell me what system is telling them my phone number is not eligible for verification. This company literally wants me to die... I have a chronic illness, there's a pandemic going on, I've explained I have a Verizon line and I have no problem using your app and verifying through that way. The woman hung up the damn phone in my ear. Time to find a new investment firm. PATHETIC!!!!

name: Jayson Michener
review: Super inconvenient for it being “America’s Most Convenient bank” anytime I call into support no one can help me and I’m left screwed. Just help your customers. Make life not so difficult. Then maybe you’re a convenient bank

name: Alexander
review: 93 point when down on my credit just for. 1 missing payment of $4  And I ready called u guys to see if the issue been fixed but still one point  in my record so please fixed 'cuz ur guys destroy my excellent credit s9core to poor credit

name: Dale
review: I started with the "secured" version card last year after my Chapter 13 discharge; and was graduated to the "unsecured" version almost literally to the day of my first charge.  As a secured card the holder earns a flat 1% on all purchases, once unsecured, the earnings bump to 3% for dining out, 2% for groceries, and 1% for everything else.In addition, TD Customer Service has been very good the four or five times I've called them since I opened my account.

name: Desiree
review: Excellent bank to do business with! I would highly recommend them to everyone! Never had any issues!!!

name: Jerome
review: It has been a great store card that is easy to manage with 5% discount on everything bought with it. Based on my average credit score I was only given a 300$ limit not the best, but I'm hopeful it will increase with my score going up.

name: Roslyn
review: I shop at Nordstrom. During the pandemic, I shop via its website. During “normal” times, I shop at its store. I believe Nordstrom has an excellent rewards program.

name: emilio
review: Downgraded my score because of a "late" payment because I never received their invoice and when I paid it it was past the past due date. I always pay in full every month.

name: swirick
review: Their online banking is the WORSE!!! I have been trying for days to get printouts of my monthly checking statements. It is easier dealing with the IRS. Worse online help ever! Useless, will close this account.

name: fastokie22
review: Customer service was always helpful the few times I needed them.  I like the 5% off for using the card although sometimes a few months no interest would have been better lol.

name: Lisa
review: Great membership perks, free shipping all the time even for in store purchases if size is not available. You can also earn reward notes to spend.

name: aderus_d_milan
review: Love my Nordstrom card. During sales cardholders receive double or triple points, and rebates include gifts with purchase and Nordstrom Notes. There’s no better retail card to have!

name: Dop Tse
review: TD Bank promised a signup bonus for checking with direct deposit with a minimum of 2500 dollars in deposit during the first 3 months and they never delivered. We have not seen it and they kept telling us that it will be there but we never received it and had to keep calling which was wasting our time.  Additionally, their customer support is not customer friendly like the chase, which provides exceptional customer service. I would not recommend anyone to join TD bank and don't fall for any of their offers.

name: Luke Brightblade
review: I wouldn't recommend. Over an hour on hold to speak to representative, slow and limited website. This bank is a headache to deal with. On top of that when I made a purchase on Samsung website these idiots opened a new account, hitting my credit score, regardless of me already having an account with the same name, address and SSN. It's like these people don't even know what they're doing. Forget it.

name: mimi miller
review: TD Bank REVIEW: Clueless and incompetent. I'd give less than 1 star if I could. I was sent a postcard advertising a special promotion for opening a savings account and transferring in $15,000 within a certain time frame I would get a $300 bonus after 90 days. I opened the account mid September and transferred money in right away. I am still waiting for the bonus money. I have called customer service 2 times. Each time I waited over an HOUR to speak to someone and was told, wait a few weeks the money will be in the account both times. Today I went into a branch and it was even worse, not one of the employees could explain what the issue was...and sent home to call Customer Service Again. PLEASE DON'T USE TD BANK.

name: Timothy
review: This card really has been so good to me every time I needed it! I really like its products. I think it is a really good card to hold and have!!!

name: pauldelsordo
review: Worst customer service. Been a customer since commerce Bank. High employee turnover, understaffed, branch hours change without notice. They are pushing you to atm for all transactions. No human contact soon! I'm closing 5 accounts.

name: Rey
review: Interest rate is lower than most other retail cards and offers 5% cashback. However, Target's everyday higher retail prices keeps my shopping limited to specials.

name: doris v
review: I love shopping at Target! Paid balance in full zero balance now! I keep my spending in a lowered amount! Wallet Hub super great

name: Hugh Jasole
review: If you're looking for an extra 7hrs of banking on the weekend, which doesn't post til Monday anyway, this is a bank for you.  If you want them to protect you and your money from fraud, run in another direction.  I reported 3 separate fraudulent withdrawals on a single day, the day they were posted.  This amounted to $1,000 and they've declined my claim twice over the course of the last 3 weeks, without even notifying me of the original declination.  During all of this, my $$$ was tied up for almost a full week, 4 business days and a weekend, while transferring funds to a new account with new passwords, cards, etc.  I'm closing all of my TD accounts and moving to a bank with not only better security, but more customer centric motives towards doing the right thing by their customers, especially when they've had money stolen from them.

name: Pop Pins
review: An old check book was in my glove compartment of my vehicle when someone ransacked my car in a two minute attempted-theft spree. Trying to do the right thing, I called TD to let them know that an old check book without identifying information or checks had been in my car but not seen or touched by the perpetrator. Without warning I was transferred to the fraud department and played an automated recording stating that my account would be locked and closed in 30 days. I asked to rescind my statement and for the representative to follow the logic - when you write someone a check more information is exposed than someone merely breaking into a car and not seeing any information on an old, information-less book. I was told this was impossible and what’s done, is done. I’ve been a customer my entire life but immediately moved to Ally. Today my tenant tried to send the rent using Zelle, as always, for on-time payment of my mortgage on Monday. TD also blocked my Zelle account and suggested (during a pandemic) I, “physically go to the bank and deposit cash.” I’ve never in my life felt this frustration; this is MY money, MY account and this bank is essentially holding it hostage. TD is THE worst bank in America.

name: james
review: love the store and the service, they deliver promptly and if issues they are great at communicating that and also fixing those issues

name: Nicole
review: I love Nordstrom Rack, Great store, good deals. I always enjoy shopping here when I can. It is great to find the awesome name brand deals for so much less money!

name: Mirlande Geffrard
review: If there is anything lower than 1 star I will use it it is the worst bank to deal with I got an issue with them since July and never resolved it they kept my money be aware of this bank

name: davidfriedmancomposer
review: For "America's most convenient bank", I can't imagine opening an account to be any more inconvenient. Every step of the way I hit roadblocks. I opened the account online, they didn't give me my account number and I couldn't get it on the phone, though I spoke to three different people. Then they wouldn't let me transfer more than $1000 from another bank, even though there was a minimum balance requirement of $20,000. They told me to call a branch. The branch told me to call the phone line. Finally, I went into a branch, which I hadn't wanted to do, and they said they knew nothing about the promotion, but finally allowed me to write a check. Then they sent me a Debit card and when I tried to get online to activate it, the online activation kept saying I was giving the wrong information, and when I called the message didn't give me the option of activating. Much more than $200 worth of time and aggravation to get the $200 bonus.

name: lactony
review: Horrible bank. I’ve used TD bank for over 2 years, and just recently today they decided to close my bank without any prior notice or any attempts to contact me whatsoever. I called to check and all the reps said the back office decided to close my account without providing a reason why. Doing so, made them send me a check home with my remaining balance leaving me unable to access my funds in case of emergencies. Stay away from TD.

name: Joseph
review: Very good company easy to talk to representatives if you need some advice well answers weather has $500,000 in your bank should have a credit limit above $4500 specially When my gross income was Over 2 1/2 million

name: chamakurt
review: TD Bank has a relationship with the car dealership I purchased a vehicle from recently. My guess is that this relationship is designed to make car shopping easier for the customer and is a common practice in the industry. Since I wanted to set up automatic payments I contacted the bank and withstood the poor customer service long enough to get them to send me the appropriate paperwork. Three months later auto payments have been implemented without issues. But TD Bank decided to send me the same auto payment paperwork to be completed....again. I called to see why this was needed. After talking with two associates I gave up. Both were very rude and seemed to take little interest in helping and more interested in making sure I understood that they were in charge. The problem with dealing with customers that have credit scores in the mid 800’s is we have options. If you have options I would recommend against getting into any type of relationship with TD Bank.

name: Stavros Vrakas
review: TD Bank systems between checking accounts, loans and credit cards do not update on another. If you go to a branch and change your home address, phone number etc, that will update only your checking and savings accounts and not the other products. This can result in a great impact to a customer since they can claim that they could not reach you. This was resulted in a great impact to my life and my work.

name: Mohamed
review: I paid off td bank balance, still showing i owe money ,I paid off the balance 5 weeks ago !!!! How come you're not updating my payment history

name: Joshua Carey
review: Card is ok, had it for over a year now and paid off my card in full, yet they will not raise my limit on this card.  I have other banks with 20x's the limit on this card and they still don't even bump me up $700 more in limit. They started me at $300 and will not increase me.  What a shame, guess my travel rewards visa card will get the business.

name: Kevin Nettler
review: I had the misfortune of having a bank account at TD bank for 8 years. Over that time they took advantage of me through excess charges on about anything you can imagine, ATM withdrawal, ATM BALANCE CHECK, maintenece fees, etc. Not once, even if it was an error, did they correct their mistake. They are worth billions because of the money they steal from the lower and middle class. Do yourself a favor and skip owning an account here. Go to a better bank like Chase or Capital One. I recently switched over to tthem and have had no issues

name: Michael Warner
review: One of only two secured credit cards with a cash back benefit.  And as the other option is Discover, this is the only one that is useful. ☺️

name: RICHARD
review: TD Bank is open with very convenient hours -- and there are numerous locations throughout my region (many states). Its gift cards are free, so I don't buy them in stores.

name: briandiorio908
review: TD Bank deserves No Stars! I was a customer for 6 years I never had any problems. I overdraft twice in 6 years. Since COVID-19 they stopped the 24 hour grace period if account goes negative. I’ve noticed I can’t keep track of purchases. Then all of a sudden it comes out of account. Then the monthly fee or some other purchase comes out putting my account negative. In the last year I overdraft 12 times!  Times are tough enough for the little guy. I don’t need a bank making life even more difficult by pulling fast ones!

name: nadezhda_irk
review: The Wire fees are just OUTRAGEOUS, (especially INCOMING wire fee)! Almost Three times more than at other banks! So many unexpected fees and charges. Customer service is not helpful at all. Closing my account with them.

name: Ernie
review: It’s the easiest way to build your credit when you're being turned down by credit card companies and you got your own money and you can do what you want and can afford and they don’t believe you take change with TD bank cash card and show them

name: Ali N
review: This bank is so stupid the card has $500 limit you don't have to sent the full amount to transunion. td bank is the bad bank in this world.

name: Khalid A
review: TD has the worst customer service and protection. They made a mistake and they rather blamed the customer just because they don’t want to cover the cost of their mistake. I strongly recommend not using TD if you want your money to be safe. I have canceled my mortgage application with them because of this experience plus I have withdrawn all my money from TD. Plus all my siblings are in process of taking out all their money and switching to another bank that cares and works for customer. They will all be canceling their Visa and MasterCards just like how I did and closing up the line of credit. So disappointed.

name: Olivia Darcangelo
review: I banked with TD for 6 years. The app is not user-friendly and the overdraft fees are crazy. There is only 1 bank in my city and it is located on the other side of town so I relied mostly on online banking. Which logged me out every 5 min so it was hard to get anything done. The customer service was average, it was just hard to get connected with a human and not a FAQ bot. Honestly, it was a hassle to do anything with TD. I opened a credit card with Capital One last year and saw that banking didn't have to be stressful. About a week ago I decided to switch my checking and savings account with Capital One and be done with TD. I had to call 3 times to close my accounts, was not impressed by the customer service I received they did not explain the process just told me I was wrong. And as a customer of 6 years with TD, not one time did any of these 3 people ask me why I wanted to close my accounts or offer me any reason to stay banking with them. No email saying "sorry to see you go" nothing. Which only leads me to believe that they do not care about their customers.

name: Ed Danson
review: I have a Target Red Card and have attempted to purchase a Disney gift card at Target.com using my Red Card.  I have done this on numerous occasions in the past with no issues.  After ordering the gift card, I received an email indicating the order was cancelled but did not give any specific reason.  I tried again with the same results. Since then, I have called both Target.com and Target Red Card (TD Bank)  3 times and was told the there was a glitch in their system and the issue would be resolved.  Initially, the issue would be resolved in 15 minutes.  The second time, they told me to wait to the next day so the system would clear the issue.  Now they tell me that the issue will be resolved but they do not know when.  It's been 4 days and the issue remains unresolved.  It has been very frustrating and their customer service is worthless.  The reps working customer service have no idea what they are doing.  All I want to do is buy a gift card.  It cannot be that complicated; but apparently, with Target it is.

name: Rachel Bence
review: Below is the email I received from target red card. I entered a new bank account to pay my red card and I messed up a number, so it was returned. I figured since it was my 1st issue that they would waive the $29 fee with no problem. The 5 managers I spoke with (all at different times) all said they can’t wait the fee and that’s their policy. They would not transfer me to anyone above them and told me the Only way I can connect with somebody at their corporate office is by writing a letter. They also didn’t care that I was canceling my card and going to shop elsewhere. Worst Service EVER! ARCHIVED RE: Transactions Jan 07, 2021 Hello Rachel, We're sorry to hear that you weren't able to receive the help you needed when you called us. After reviewing your account, we found that your bank returned the recent payment of $121 payment because the bank account saved online was deemed as an invalid bank account. Your RedCard account was charged a fee due to this returned payment. We're sorry, but we’re unable to remove the returned payment fee from your account. We understand that this may not be the outcome you were looking for, but we hope you understand that we must remain consistent with our credit policies, in fairness to all our accountholders. Unfortunately, we're unable to arrange for a phone call to you through an online message request. We're sorry for any disappointment. Thank you for taking the time to contact us through Manage My RedCard. Sincerely, Target Card Services, servicer to TD Bank USA, N.A.

name: Chas Rand
review: Convenience and mobile banking are "ok", but not cutting edge like my other banks. Three stars reflects TD's broken system dealing with pending credits and debits.  They process same day transactions sequentially based on a time stamp.  They charged $35 in overdraft even though on the same day that a debit was processing a credit had been submitted an hour later, both appearing as processing.  Customer Rep was unsympathetic.  Bank of America, my favorite, processes credits first, then debits last. In my opinion, TD ranks among the nickel and dime money grabbers. Sad, because I'm Canadian (as are their roots) and want TD to be my primary bank; they haven't earned that distinction.

name: Lisa
review: After about a year of having the card Target decided to lower my credit card limit from $1,000 to $500 without any explanation or warning.  My highest balance was $34 which was paid before interest could accrue.  WHY??

name: Alia
review: Credit card companies will run another check on your credit periodically to determine if they lower your limit or offer a higher limit is what I was told

name: snipes_lakenya
review: I have been with Nordstrom for little over a year. I called 2 months prior to inform them that I was having hardship due to the pandemic. I paid a sum of $600 at the end of September or the beginning of October when I spoke to a representative I was told this could be dispersed over two months. In December I received a call for payment which I thought I took care of within the $600 payment. Now I didn’t complain because I had the cash, so I paid the minimum balance. Now here’s my issue I am in the process of buying a home. Nordstrom reported a derogatory claim which caused my credit to drop 116 points.I have never had an issue paying, and I always know to communicate if so. I communicated to all my creditors and the only issue was Nordstrom. When I called to speak to a representative and I asked her why this issue during a pandemic I was told Nordstrom does not offer any accommodation for the pandemic. At that point I asked to speak to a supervisor whose name was Ashley (LAS). Ashley said she pulled the records and that I basically was lying because all here records show otherwise as if Nordstrom’s don’t make mistakes. Well here is where they made a mistake hiring Ashley. Her customer service skill are terrible. She did not want to do further investigation and said basically Nordstrom does not embrace the CARES ACT. My credit was Ruined because of Nordstrom’s lack of proper communication and the choice not to care about what the American people are going through during this COVID Pandemic. I wish I could cancel this card, but I know it would further ruin my credit. Therefore, I will use it as little as possible. I will never shop with them again it's such a sad case. Nordstrom hire or train people who are more sympathetic at this time. Get rid of the Cowboys!

name: Mathew Issac
review: The customer service is the worst ever. A bunch of lazy people that wont take the phone after 3 hours even if the expected wait time is only 10 min. Called more than once and no reply. Irresponsible and disappointing

name: davbraught
review: They deserve daily 1 star reviews! I’m going to take some time to post a 1 star review everywhere I can today. Worst customer service anywhere. I’ve spent countless hours trying to get them to do their job. They have negatively affected my credit for over a year now.

name: hiran
review: Great company love their cash back offers. love this card

name: nls11baggjo
review: This is one of the credit cards where they want people to spend at convenience so they can charge users with high-interest rates. In terms of the rewards, very ordinary compared to many other credit out there. One plus side that they do give a high limit, meanwhile, it also tempts people to spend more. 1, Unlike other store credit cards, very little help was offered during the pandemic. I have cards with BestBuy and other retailers' stores. They all offer to help such as lower the interest rate, no minimum payment required and/or defer payment, etc. However, Nordstrom cards only offer to delay payment for ONE month. Even though I didn't need the help but it showed that the Nordstorm card was made to get people to spend money when they don't have it. So, that the bank can start charging interest off people, rather than to help you earn rewards. Especially during a pandemic where people's help is in need. 2, additionally, they have very little to no communication on what going on in the account. Make sure when you made the payment online and don't have any problem with your bank. Otherwise, a problem can occur without your knowledge. I submitted a monthly payment but for some reason, it didn't go through. Meanwhile, my online account still shows as "payment posted". So I thought it was grit in the system but didn't realize until they reported to my credit bureaus. Therefore affected my 4 years of no late payment record. I called and asked for help but customer service said "we have to report the truth". Nonetheless, I had the same incident with the Vitoria Secret cards and when I called, they helped fix my account. I don't mind paying the late fee but I hate the stain and score drop on my credit report. 3, Horrible customer service. With regards to the above incident, I was in the store for a return and I don't have my card on me so one of the retailers at the store said they can help me call to get my card number. (I still haven't realized what's going on with my account at the time) But when called, they were being really ruled and said my card was locked bc of late payment (in front of people) I told them that I did make payment and asked what's going but instead of addressing my problem, she just focused on the aspect that I can't use the card bc of the late payment. Quite disappointing on how they handle customer financial outlook. Update: I changed the bank info to clear out any balance off on this card. I was extra careful since I had so much problem w this card already. But one more time, they didn't update my banking info and charged a $25 fee for a "returned check". I would give this card a negative star if I could. I feel like this card doesn't only reflect poorly on Nordstrom itself. It also reflects very badly on the bank it's from, TD bank.

name: Theo
review: I am a TD Bank Family Member and their products are somewhat decent. I already bank with TD Bank so it made sense to get a credit card with them.

name: metzler_justin
review: Received financing through Samsung phone and they were charging interest on my Samsung Premium Care. I just found out that this is how it is brought over to TD and unless you cancel out and put the Care plan through Samsung within 60 days, you'll be charged interest on this service. This is even if you have a 0% APR on the phone. Very deceiving and I am disappointed with both TD and Samsung. Certainly points to a scam and a way for TD Bank to get some easy interest. Thanks TD.

name: Kourtney Elmore
review: Literally the world's LEAST convenient bank. This bank is absolutely awful. My account was hacked into, and I filed a claim. They’ve been giving me the run around ever since and the only thing they can tell me is to “go into a branch” when the closest branch to me is an hour away. Every time I call, they can’t help me or verify my information because my account has been closed, due to fraud. The fraud department gives me the same response. There’s absolutely no way to figure out what is going on with my claim or my account. This has been the most frustrating experience and I sure as heck will NEVER bank with this company again.

name: kshah_ba
review: DO NOT GET this Card, worst experience, they charge late fees on interest they change which was waved by customer service associate however it was not the case and next thing i know, i had to close this account to resolve the issue (rendered the issue for 4 months). there are many good credit card companies which care about customer.

name: cretu_construction
review: Terrible attitude to the costumer service rep. Linda in regards of my Samsung account payment plan. She even told me that she wasted 1 hour of her time with me on the phone ( because the clarity of their bill ?!) really ?! the time that she gets paid for ?! how about the hour I've spent on the phone with her and another hour before I finally got connected to someone who did nothing but to make my day miserable !!! For this reason I will never do any kind of business again with TD Bank neither with Samsung for how long they share their business!!!

name: abeyh
review: Branches are usually understaffed and they've been reducing their business hours for the last couple of years.  They've also been sued for the way they post transactions from biggest to smallest resulting in more overdrafts and fees.

name: irobink
review: $592 Credit Balance and they won't close my account and give me my money back. When I call I typically sit on hold for over an hour (last time it was over 2.) They told me they would close it, here I am weeks later and it is still open.  I emailed customer service and they told me to call (and wait another 2 hours??)

name: Tracy Rogers
review: I went to TD bank in South Carolina for my construction loan based on my builders recommendation.  I was promised that we would be able to close within 30-45 days.  It has currently been over 60 days and we have still not closed, at no fault of mine.  The process has been painful, lack of communication and no sense of urgency from anyone there to get this loan to settlement. I am very disappointed and would not recommend them.

name: s_deschamps23
review: Currently contending with the exact situation. We’ve had to make contact each time , no responses to emails. Going to miss our closing date. Huge regret going with this bank

name: solwetts
review: Applied for Samsung Financing. A month later and still haven't received my card or "welcome kit" from TD. Called the number Samsung gave me. Listened to a long announcement about active service members. Then line was cut off. Returned my items to Samsung. Bought on Amazon with their store card. Am happy. Learned one thing. Synchrony apparently is gold compared to TD.

name: Yelena Gordiyenko
review: I used to love this card, and all the perks (especially the cash back points with extra 10% to my TD brokerage account), until I had a really bad customer service experience. I had an $11,000 credit limit on this card, and my account was always in really good standing. (I pay my balance on all my cards every day). Then, a month ago, we moved and I used my TD card to buy some furniture. I made about $3,000 worth of online purchases from several different retailers, and on my fourth purchase my card started getting declined. I called TD and they informed me that my account had been flagged for suspicious activity, in spite of the fact that I spent way less than my limit, and they'd have to put me on hold while a manager reactivated it. I was on hold for at least 40 minutes. Every 20 minutes the girl I was on hold with would tell me, flatly and indifferently, that they were still working on it. After 40 minutes she finally informed me that the hold on my account had been lifted.  By that time I was practically crying with frustration because my newborn was screaming, I hadn't eaten all day, the people who were working on our floor had finished and left without me seeing it, and my only window to eat lunch had passed. I told her I wanted to cancel my account, and she blandly informed me I'd need to talk to Customer Service for that. I asked her to transfer me to Customer Service and she did, but it was their Canadian office (I'm a U.S. customer). Finally they transferred me to the correct departme nt and I was able to cancel my card. From now on I'm sticking to my Chase credit cards - the rewards are still great, and I won't have to worry about the headache of such crappy service.

name: maaustin91
review: Honestly this is the worst bank I have ever had to deal with. I had covid and was battling for my life so I accidently missed a payment. Apparently I didnt not qualify for late fee reversal. Zero sympathy or understanding during these times that are difficult for everyone except the big corporations and banks. If your only option is this bank then just keep your money under your mattress. Garbage

name: nls11baggjo
review: This is one of the credit cards where they want people to spend at convenience so they can charge users with high-interest rates. In terms of the reward, very ordinally compare to much other credit out there. One plus side that they do give a high limit, meanwhile, it also tempts people to spend more. 1, Unlike other store credit cards, very little help was offered during the pandemic. I have cards with BestBuy and other retailers' stores. They all offer to help such as lower the interest rate, no minimum payment required and/or defer payment, etc. However, Nordstrom cards only offer to delay payment for ONE month.
