Quite disappointing on how they handle customer financial outlook.Update: I changed the bank info to clear out any balance off on this card. I was extra careful since I have so much problem w this card already. But one more time, they didn't update my banking info and charged a $25 fee for a "returned check". I would give this card a negative start if I could. I feel like this card doesn't not only reflects poorly on Nordstrom itself. It's also reflects very badly on the bank it from, TD bank.

name: missmurph2012
review: Charles Brydon NMLS: 1208792 wasted almost 2 weeks of my time and ran my credit (lowering my score) KNOWING I wasn’t going to be approved for a home loan due to my income in 2018.  Do not use them unless you like being jerked around.

name: Naveen Bachan
review: Hi I m still in process with my loan for refinancing with TD. Worst bank service ever in this world. I applied in July 23rd and today is November 10th still have no idea when they r going to close my refinance loan. Please do not deal with TD BANK ? mortgage. Please do not waste your time.

name: No Way
review: TD bank sponsors the Yard Card credit card. Well, they shouldn't. Yard card customer service is the worst thing on this planet. On hold for hours, finally get a call back and said my name. They hung up the phone.Why is TD bank letting them drag them down it's all about the money. Canceled this card in june, with no balance.  Still shows up on my credit report as we owe 6k. We owe no money and never used the card.Went into a TD Bank and they couldn't figure it out or cancel it as it is from a 3rd party vendor.Check for yourself the many number of complaints about this yard card company. It's a joke and TD bank is is becoming one.To bad, for being dragged into the sewer with them as their bank branch it was very nice.

name: castrojennifer1700
review: @diana2brown Hi Díana I really need to fix my credit can you send me Matt’s info, I totally understand you

name: Nick Sodano
review: Awful bank love to charge fees,awful bank in every way.biggest mistake I made was moving over from Chase a bank that is far superior in every way.

name: Joshua Burby
review: Worst company I've ever had to deal with. I've sat on hold for more than 3 hours and still haven't been able to talk to a live person. All I want to do is close my account...

name: Taillone
review: This card is just not up on that technology the card and website need major upgrades .

name: Robert Hamel
review: Td bank is one of the worst banks you would ever do business with. Go somewhere else. They will freeze your account without telling you why and have you jumping through hoops to get it resolved. Go somewhere else!

name: SSuu Higgins
review: FRAUD Dept. is awful.  It is no use filing a dispute.  I wasted SO MUCH time on the phone and on hold.  What a joke, they pretend to take notes and udate the case but when you ask them to read it back they have no reply because they are just acting not really doing it.  I was on the phone and on hold for over an hour.  In the end they will close you case with no positive results when you have a case against a company that is scamming you.  DO NOT get the credit card and DO NOT use it,  Discover Card is a much better bet. I will cut mine up ASAP.

name: anonymous name
review: Fraud Department Incompetence!  PLEASE READ.  I received a call from "Daisy" from TD Bank on a Monday in September, 2020, telling me that someone had completed an online application over the weekend and that the bank was suspicious of the activity because "the information seemed off."  When I asked for more information, she provided nothing more.  When I confirmed that I had not submitted the application, she said, "I will prevent the account from opening due to fraud and you should contact the credit bureaus about this."  I asked what number she could be reached and she said, "There is only one Daisy in the fraud department and if you call back to ask for me, they will know who that is."  When I asked for the number, she said, "Just look it up online."  Several days later, I received in the mail several packs of checkbooks from TD Bank with my name and address but the wrong phone number.  I called the number I found online for TD Bank and asked for "Daisy."  The woman who answered the phone, "Diamond," said she could not confirm if there was a Daisy who worked there and that I would need to speak with her.  I described that no account was supposed to be opened in my name since I did not apply for it and that I wanted to speak with Daisy since she was familiar with the situation.  Diamond refused to transfer me and after asking the account number for the checks, she said, “I have taken care of the problem and nothing further needs to be done.”  I told her, “with respect, I cannot simply take your word for that” and asked to speak with her supervisor for more information as I was very worried about the fact that someone had committed identity theft with the bank and that the bank had not prevented the account from opening as promised.  For several minutes, she argued with me, telling me she could not tell me who her supervisor was before finally telling me his name was Victor … but he was not in.  I asked who the bank president was and for several minutes, she simply ignored the question and would not answer.  It was truly bizarre!  She finally told me the bank president for TD Bank is named Greg.  When I asked for his last name, Diamond said, “We cannot give out last names.”  What??  TD Bank has a policy of not giving the last name of their bank president?  No.  Simply no.  That cannot be.  PLEASE avoid using this bank at all costs.  They have incompetent staff working in an area that should require the highest level of competence.  Even worse, there is ZERO accountability.  I will be filing multiple complaints regarding this issue in hopes that others do not experience something similar.  We all deserve better.

name: armt68jw5
review: Their Samsung financing branch has an online system and customer support section that is gear to induce late fee charges by being deceitful in the manner of setting false expectations making you think that you automatic payments are set up and later telling you that it takes a billing cycle to go through  and justifying the "late fee assesment".It happened  twice even whet the system already had the bank account information from previous purchase.

name: Katrina
review: Great card to have to build your credit . I will recommend this card to anyone who wants to restore or build up their credit. Very convenient

name: Dechen Yangkyi
review: TD is the worst bank EVER! Don’t bank with them. They will keep taking money away from you over and over and closing your account with them will drive you crazy. So honestly, stay away! I had many accounts and never come across worse than TD.

name: cnjarroyo
review: After 2.5 years of making ongoing, on time, DOUBLE monthly payments... NEVER EVEN ONE LATE PAYMENT... This card arbitrarily lowered my $2,600 credit limit to $600.... NO WARNING, NOTHING.... My balance at the time was only  $530, it had NEVER been higher than $700....So, imagine, it SIGNIFICANTLY lowered my available credit & immediately raised my usage percentage...ALL because a medical billing company FAILED to bill my secondary insurance, they ERRONEOUSLY flagged my credit score with a collection and despite having called them TWICE within the last 4 mos, with my secondary insurance information, they FAILED to run my secondary insurance... It took me opening a dispute for them to FINALLY charge my medical insurance and erase this garbage from my credit score... Jerks!! They are playing with people's livleyhood! Despite calling target MULTIPLE times and asking them to look at my credit report, again, to see the change they informed me it was an irreversible change and they would not be looking into my claim, period done.They said they will review my credit score in the future... One of their reasons were "credit history not long enough" LOL.... they gave me $2600 2.5 yrs ago, but 2.5 yrs later, my credit history is too short? Really...? Sounds real smart...I'm done with ?, the only reason I went there was because I had their credit card.... And after seeing how they treat their LOYAL CUSTOMERS with not even one late payment in 2.5 yrs, I'm done shopping there! I promised them in the phone I would pay my balance due and be done with them... Buh bye, Target!!

name: Leah Hill
review: Worse bank ever. They wait to post your overdraft fees 24 hours later. So even if you fixed the first overdraft you will have more trust me they tried to charge me over 300 dollars of overdraft fees. Then when you call them up they tell you its your fault. I looked at my bank account online and it showed that I was positive.  We are in a pandemic and they want to take our money. I really thought I found a good bank but nope. I should of stayed with my prepaid bank at least I knew what I wss going to get.

name: William
review: Past due account how`s on my credit report even though it has been settled 2 years ago. No one at TD knows how to go about resolving the issue for me.

name: bonnie_recca
review: Multiple mistakes and terrible customer service.  The bank made two major errors within 3 months.  The first time they cashed our check but did not record it, then sent us late payment notices with fees.  It took  4-5 telephone calls with long wait times each time told it would be fixed until it was finally settled.  Within a week we had a second problem they recorded a check of 2701.21 as $1.21.  AGAIN late notices and late fees and multiple phone calls until this was settled, with the promise that this would not be reflected on our credit score since it was entirely the bank' fault.  Recently we went to refinance and take advantage of the low rates and OUR CREDITED RATING IS DOWN BECAUSE OF TD BANK.  If you have an option, DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THIS COMPANY!!!!!

name: Leah Hill
review: There one only one nice lady that had great customer service and the other act like they are doing you a favor

name: michael_gingrich_sc
review: Love my RedCard!  Applied a year ago with a CL of $500.  After a few months it was increased to $700.  I use it regularly and pay it off each month. Target is an excellent company. I don't work there but have friends who have and they give the company rave reviews.

name: Melissa
review: I have banked with TD Bank for more than 10 years. I like the bank for the most part. There are some aspects of it I am not fond of but overall they operate all hours of the day and night, locations are good, online services pre-pandemic were very good response time for secure messaging. Features of my account are pretty decent.

name: kstengle
review: Stay as far away from TD Bank as possible. I tried to call customer service and twice was sent through a maze of people only to be disconnected. Then I sent them an email and was told to contact the exact number that sent me through the maze of nonsense.. TD has gone way downhill

name: whuser66841758
review: Careful, this caused me 70pts on my credit score. Reported a missed payment to the credit bureaus on $25 bill. This was in March. I was sidetracked by spending my grandmothers last week with her and the emergence of a global pandemic. I have twice explained and submitted a request for review - but they are not going to help. The 5% savings at target sure had cost me a lot with my credit. Beware - this is the only card I have ever gotten a late payment on and with it being a balance at $25 it is extremely frustrating. Check the recent ratings looks like in the last year this card has gotten really BAD!!!

name: waldohammernut
review: Second payment to these leeches, made on time (actually early,) on my next statement, there's a 29.00 return fee. What? Called them, and got exactly nowhere. Not our fault, TFB.  I have NEVER had a late payment, on this or any other credit card. Will pay off the 121.00 balance at the minimum, then destroy the card. Will not ever shop at Target again.

name: Chelsea Spicer
review: I am really disappointed to have to leave such a poor review. I've been a loyal Nordstrom customer for nearly half my life, and have always appreciated the high level of customer service I've received. I typically never open retail credit cards because my other cards offer such superior benefits, but I finally gave in recently and opened a Nordstrom retail card. The first month after I opened the card, I paid online using my checking account. I have had this checking account since I was 16 years old and have had the same account number the whole time. So when I received a call from Nordstrom saying I hadn't paid my bill, I was shocked. I had submitted payment for my entire balance. The customer service agent informed me that my payment had been returned because the account number was incorrect. First, I was confused that the payment system showed that I had submitted payment if the number was wrong; I was also frustrated that I had not been notified of that right away, and now they were trying to charge me a return fee. While on the phone, I logged into my Nordstrom account and verified that the account number is indeed correct. I asked to have the return fee reversed, which they did, and asked her to run the payment again. It went through. This exact same thing then happened the next two months. I did not change my account number at any point, yet they kept saying my account "was not found". As someone with a fairly long and robust credit history, I was baffled that it was so difficult to pay them. I have never had a company make it so difficult to pay them. (I have also never had any issues paying my credit card balance from my checking account.)Already wondering if I had made the right decision in opening this retail card, I gave it another go several months later for Anniversary Sale. My fiance needed a new wardrobe and we both wanted to purchase a few things for wedding activities. The total was significantly more than I had charged to the card previously, and I paid it off in full at the end of the month, just like I had for every other month that I used the card. I tried to use my card again a few days later for an online purchase and I got another error. I called into customer support and was informed that because I submitted such a large payment compared to my first few months, they had placed a TWO WEEK hold on the payment, which has already been deducted (not pending, fully deducted) from my checking account. I would understand 2-3 business days for the transaction to clear, but two weeks is unacceptable, especially since I explained that my payment history actually is very consistent with this, because I always pay my full balance at the end of the month. I simply hadn't purchased very many things the first few months so the balance was relatively low. I feel there is little to no incentive to shop/spend money/use the retail card. I'm  really quite disappointed to have to leave such a poor review, but at this point I am questioning why I even opened this account and will likely go back to using my Capital One or Sapphire Preferred cards moving forward.

name: ashimkb
review: I am not shocked!! I like Nordstrom until I got to know it uses TD Bank. I have personal and business account with this bank. Several times I decided that I will close all my accounts because their unprofessionalism. I moved 90% of finance to different bank. I am at the edge of turn down (TD) this  bank. Even though it didn't happen to me! a lots people told me that, it turn down their CC and loan application with fair to good credit. I told them their names says it TD (turn down) bank.

However, TD Bank caused my wife and myself credit to drop and applied late fees. Just recently, they finally updated the address and we now received over 6 statements from TD Bank. I would recommend anyone who is doing finance with Ashley to not go with TD Bank. TD Bank doesn't care about people credit and life. TD Bank wasn't willing to remove late fees and contact the credit bureaus. Everyone be careful and mindful. I'm just referring to my experience and do not want anyone else to experience this.

review: This bank is the worst it lies to attract customers  once you set up a account  everything  is different..no overdraft  coverage as they say or advance  coverage..there liars I was told 90 days til I could  use the services ..the customers  service representatives  are very nasty..attitudish and rude as if there doing you a favor by using there bank ..during the pandemic  forcing people to pick up there debit cards ..then there not open ti cash checks they gave customers  standing in the drive thru ti cash checks in the hot sun..disabled people in wheelchairs..specifically  the Atlantic  City  T D bank....this bank was the worst experience  and the way they treat customers  is horrible..leave this bank alone dont give them your money..the online messenging  system takes several  weeks to respond  when other banks are working  remotely..and allowing customers  inside..once again the customers  service  representatives  are straight  nasty and sarcastic..and rude..not respectful toward customers..or understanding  of the customers..leave thus bank Alone

name: Kimberly
review: I’ve never had a problem with payments or reporting.  I got the card last October and am still stuck at a 1,000 credit limit. I use my red card almost every day for something and pay my statements in full every month, but still no CLI.

name: wmballou
review: I opened a checking account with TD Bank, NA, in mid-2018. Opening the account was the only straightforward transaction I had with the bank over the following fourteen months. For every standard activity, bank personnel were adamant that I had to initiate the procedure from inside a "local" branch... I live in Oregon and, to my knowledge, there are no branches west of the Boston to Miami corridor. The activities to which I refer included getting my wife's name on the account, ordering checks, initiating fund transfers, getting fund transfer limits raised, etc. For each of those activities, I had to escalate my request to the regional manager level to get any assistance at all. Finally, when I had set up a funds transfer to an outside bank and the transfer failed to take place, I had to accept the inevitable: I had to close the account. When I called the bank to notify them of this decision, I was told that to close the account, it would be necessary to visit a "local" branch to initiate the procedure. TD Bank is far from being "America's Most Convenient Bank", as it generously brands itself. In fact, it can't even appropriately be considered a "national" bank at all.

name: Dale
review: Recently discharged from Chapter 13, obtained as a Secured Card with a $5,000 limit.  Their policy is to unsecure the card after seven months assuming all payments are on time; that will not be a problem.  Yeah, tying up money for a while is annoying, but this seems to be the easiest path to a good credit card; most other cards for post bankruptcy charge significant annual and monthly fees.January 2021 update...24-Jun-2020: Applied for a Secured TDBank Cash card and funded the "Locked" savings account used for security.08-Jul-2020: Made my first "charge" on the card05-Jan-2021: TDBank "unsecured" my credit card, "unlocked" the secure savings account, and returned half of the Annual Fee (which only applies to the Secured Credit Cards).07-Jan-2021: I transferred the entire security deposit out of the formerly locked savings account into other accounts.Long story short, my experience with the secured version of the TDBank Cash credit card has been exactly as I had hoped it would be; my credit rating has improved significantly, I've earned something like $114 in cash rewards, and true to the "Agreement", I used and maintained the card for seven consecutive billing cycles and had it unsecured which in turn released the security deposit and refunded a prorated portion of the annual fee.

name: Diane Wishart
review: On time paying customer for over 20 years. Received one credit line increase within the first five years. Good credit and never late on payments; never extended an increase. No real advantage to the card.

name: Dana Wright
review: When trying to redeem my rewards I was flagged because the person felt I should be female based on my name. I explained I have had this card for years and this has never been an issue. Even after everything had been verified the woman still believed I should be female as my first name is Dana. She stated I need to go to a branch with 2 forms of ID to prove this... The card will now be canceled and I could care less about the reward points.

name: suesha64
review: Worst customer service of any other bank I've dealt with.  No carry through. Every-time I call branch, there is never a manger on duty to assist. Wait times on phone are ridiculously long. They transfer you to numbers will full mailboxes. They make a multitude of errors.

review: Depositor beware, TD will screw you when they have a chance. Here's my story.They didn't email or notify me when my account was down to zero, then hit me with ridiculous fees. I noticed and made a deposit to bring it back in to the black but TD more $$ in OD fees in store that hadn't shown up yet that brought my account back in the red. Then because they'd got my account back in red (again without alerting me) TD was able to charge another $175 in OD fees.I called customer support. They "generously" remitted the last $175 in fees. What a lark, thanks for only stealing $250 or so from a longtime loyal depositor, TD.

review: I do 80% of my banking with TD bank....I have been treated very good and wasIssued a cash credit card at time I opened The account...They notified me when I wasOn vacation about suspicious activity on my cash card and told me they were closing out the card and shipping me a New card "Next Day"....I definitely recommend TD bank.Thumbs Up!!!

review: First of all, the bank had my personal checking frozen for credit related issues. they held my $100, the rest gave to me as a cash. So I forgot about this account for like 4 years. Then my credit card with my sister and possibly mom added as authorized users charged me some financial fees twice the same month, even though the balance was paid in full, because i just hit the next billing cycle. So I stopped using this card, and they sent me a letter stating that they close it due to non usage. Now, 4 years later, i am receiving TD bank emails stating that i have some balance on my checking (I guess they unfroze whatever was left of my $100, same no reason for unfrozing as there were no reason for freezing).  I threw out all TD bank and credit cards and checks. So now I call them to close the account and get whatever is left on the account, and can't get help doing that on the phone because i am not sure if both my mom and sister are on the credit card acccount and not sure if its been closed by TD or not because I don't want their awful card anymore! So knowing my name, SSN, address, bdate and the  last 4 digits of the account I can't pass the verification process to get a check with a remainder of my money that that held for 4 years, in my name going to my address!! Stay away from TD bank, they will screw your credit score, charge you fees that no other (I have like 15 credit cards) company is charging you, freeze yoru account just because, and will provide you with no service!

name: cpopovits08
review: I've been a loyal customer for almost 15 years. I woke up one morning to 3 fraud charges and TD "determined" that 1 out of the 3 charges was not fraud. I was charged overdraft fees on top of those 3 and I'm still out hundreds of dollars of my own money that I did not ask to be taken away from me. I re-opened the case with TD twice and they keep telling me there is nothing else they can do. There is a global pandemic due to COVID-19 and I am struggling to get by. This bank, which charges me a monthly maintenance fee, was not able to provide sufficient help when my account was compromised during this trying time. This is how TD Bank treats a customer of 10+ years that was hacked during economically challenging times.

name: cmyers152
review: Currently use them for samsung Financing and they could not have a worse system.... It is built with the set up of a 1995 website that barely functions. Not to mention that regardless of how many times you delete a card from their website, it always stays. So this is great when you consistently delete a card from your account, yet they still try to charge your closed account.... I had another card on the account that I specified as a new debit card, which was to be used for auto-pay.. Their system is such outdated trash and they refuse to fix it. Clearly its just a scam for them to get an extra $25/month out of their customers. If I could take this financing to another bank I would... These guys are a total scam and I would never recommend them.

review: They are not as convenient as they used to be. Their hours are shorter but online banking is easier than some other banks. I’m with more out of convenience due to having the same account for 23 years.

name: Jay
review: Every now and then Target will refuse to accept your username and password when you try to login and make a payment. They'll ask you ridiculous security questions and the answers you provide are case sensitive. This was my case on TWO separate occasions while working out of town and trying to log in and make a payment on small ($40) balances. The answers to my security questions didn't jive therefore they wanted me to enter my credit card number to reset those questions. There's absolutely no reason to take my Target card out of town for work so that meant I wasn't able to make a payment. Yes both occasions I was out of town on the due date. It should have simply accepted my username and password. And they do NOT follow the practice of some other store credit cards where you can go into the store and make a payment with your name and other identifying info. It's like they want you to miss your payment. Today was the last straw. They refused to waive a $28 late fee on a $40 balance so I called to cancel my account. After explaining all of this to some foreign lady she asked me why I wanted to close my account LOL. Just because she sounded different shouldn't mean her brain works different. She waved the late fee last time but not this time. She couldn't close the account so she had to send me to another department. I explained the same scenario and told her the headache isn't worth it. Despite having $8K on my credit cards with $17K in total credit lines, Wells Fargo just approved me for a propel American Express with a $3,500 credit line so obviously I don't need this Target card. It was saving me 5% but I still opted to use my Chase Visa recently on my 55" smart TV at Target because it offers an additional two year warranty on purchases.

name: James Owens
review: Td bank sucks. Dont get an account with them. I had fraudulent charges. When I disputed them, they denied it twice without calling. They gave a vague reason why and the guy I talked to on the phone didn't even understand it. The paper says they care about the protection of you account but they dont. It's a lie.

name: smallory23
review: This credit card company is sewer level. Will not refund fraudulent charges on credit cards.  Stay waybfromnthese Canadian clowns. They are garbage

name: Francis Amegashitsi
review: This company reports false negative information and won't even admit wrong doing.Then when i asked to record their response for my lawyer,they refused to talk.

name: armenmeyer
review: Most INconvenient bank. Used to be good. Now long hold times (sometimes 40+ minutes). Poorly trainined service now. No abillity to speak to supervisors. Constantly making excuses like blaming other departments, and tranferring you. After 15 years, I am closing all my accounts with them. They most recently canceled all my debit cards due one online bill pay they couldn't identify which i legitamatley did. Rather than just denying the one payment, or texting me, or asking for a security code, they just cancelled everything and me locked out of website so i couldn't even know what happened. Some service. Stay far away.

name: Alan Lamb
review: Honestly, the services at TD are pretty good. We love their no-fee credit card, their flat monthly fee, and their very friendly tellers. HOWEVER; the whole reason I felt the need to write this review is because of what I have seen happen to people close to me, and how utterly appalling I think it is.The majority of frauds and scams are (or at least used to be) based on checks. People will deposit these checks at TD bank, send some of the money back to the scammer, and supposedly keep the rest. These can be in the amounts of hundreds all the way up to millions and most people CANNOT absorb this loss. TD will tell you after the fact that the check did not clear and the money never existed.WHY on earth are they putting money in your account (the amount on the check) and allowing people to withdraw or spend it when it was never real and never belonged to the person in question?? People trust their banks and I can't tell you how big the sense of betrayal is when they are suddenly demanding the person "return the money to them," all while blaming the victims 100% no matter how they were defrauded, and sitting there with a lawyer who is telling you what will happen if you don't pay them back.I fear this issue is deep and far reaching in the financial industry. But until TD starts taking responsibility for THEIR contribution to fraud; giving people money that isn't real. There is no reason whatsoever to do this. Simply wait until the money is confirmed. The second way they contribute to fraud is when someone is fraudulently taking money from your account, doing it without permission, etc, YOU, the customer are told you need to pay a regular monthly fee for each person/corporation you want to block from charging your account. How can they tell people, when they are the ones being paid to protect and securely store your money, that we must pay every month to stop someone from stealing that money, for as long as they are trying to do it? Once again, all the responsibility is put on someone else for something that is a part of their job. if TD fixed these issues I would be giving at least a 4 star rating, but it hurts my heart that anyone would go to such lengths to avoid accountability and cause further harm to victims of crime.

name: Jay Jay
review: I recommend no one to get this bank. I been waiting on the phone for literally 1 hour to get someone about my card. I have been waiting for almost 3 weeks now after I have been told It would take 3-4 day to ship to my house. Don’t get this bank. I recommend chase Bank and Wells Fargo.

name: Scott
review: Easy bank to do business with....Absolutely love their online banking app...easy to navigate even for beginners.the rewards points are tiered but You can cash them out for CASH deposited into Your account....highly recommended!

name: amarieddie
review: Worst customer service on earth Even after being put on hold for more than 30 minutes, then speaking with a representative to be able to access my account online and change some information like my address and phone number, I still can’t access my account, and I can’t get in touch with the customer service over the weekend because they are closed, I’ll remember again that I will refuse to be financed by them in the future, terrible customer service

name: hmessinaaaa
review: How is this bank still operating? I've had more problems with them than all other banks combined. The $25 "Maintenance" Charge should be enough for anyone to turn around and reconsider a more customer friendly bank such as Chase or Wells Fargo, where you will never be a charged a fee just to hold your money in an account. Think twice, choose right. TD is a disgrace to all other banks and gives them a really bad look if I may add so myself. Fair warning to ALL prospective TD bank customers - do not (I repeat DO NOT) choose TD bank as a bank to hold your money unless you are ready to add headaches and unnecessary stress to your life. if it isn't one thing, it is another with this company. they are hungry for your money and will do whatever they can to make your life more difficult when it comes to accessing the money you worked so hard for. please - take advice from someone who has experienced this first hand. STAY. AWAY.

review: TD Bank lowered my credit limit during the Corona Virus and lowered my credit rating.
