name: satyaraj2056
review: somebody send me money by zelle it's says within minute i got money but till 9 days no money in my account and no return in my wife's account. i called many times in costumer service but not solve. what can i do ???????

name: markua215
review: I can't believe this bank. First they cancel my card. Then overdraft my account and lock me out of my app while I am waiting for a refund. I'm in shock. I was waiting on a 146$ refund.  But now I'm overdrafted 170 instead cause this bank is bullshit

name: Joe Klein
review: If you're looking for a company that couldn't care less about protecting the security of its customers, Target is the company for you! Somebody got hold of my name and address, and attempted to open six separate Target related credit cards under my name. Numerous attempts to resolve the issue, and many hours on hold in doing so, all verified as fraud by their customer service department when I finally got through. Requested written correspondence confirming accounts had been deleted, but only one out of six (that I know of) has been resolved. I asked that my home address be deleted/blocked, but was told, "we can't do that".I even sent a detailed email to these fine Target corporate folks, and other than what seemed like an auto reply saying "we'll respond soon" with no contact info whatsoever, not a single response from ANY of these Target executives:samir.shah@target.com; Mark.Schindele@target.com; john.mulligan@target.com; brian.cornell@target.comWant a bull's eye on your forehead when somebody tries to commit credit card fraud? Target is is your company of choice!

name: merdenoms352
review: No longer doing business with TD Bank. I had a renovate card and after never making late payments made the mistake of missing one number on the new account I listed with them for payments. They decreased my credit card from $10k-$500. I have excellent credit and again have never been late. In fact I always made extra payments throughout the month. I went ahead and paid the remaining $1400 and closed my card. No need to do business with a company who insults their customers in such a way.

name: Caleb S
review: I purchased cell phones through Samsung Financing with a 'no interest' promotion, which are handled by TD Bank. I was to receive a trade amount for each used phone, which was never properly issued. Additionally, I would always pay more than my minimum payment and my account should have been paid ahead by numerous months. However, regardless of my requests they always apply any extra payment amount to ONLY the principle. I was one day late for a payment (after well over a year of making payments ahead of time), and they added a $27.00 late fee on a balance of only a few hundred dollars. I called and requested this to be removed as it was errant because TD Bank applies payments only how they want to, not per a customer's request as with any other bank I have borrowed from in 20 years. They agreed to remove the charge, but it never came off the account. A month later, I paid the remaining balance to close the account, less the $27.00 that was to be removed. Fast forward several months and it was never removed, and they continue to add chargers upon charges. TD Bank will never see another penny of my money, I do not care how long this sits in collections. After calling and speaking to several different people, including two supposed managers, they still refuse to remove these amount. The service reps only argue with you and have a very negative attitude. It is clear that they hate their jobs and could care less about helping customers. The overall horrendous ratings for TD Bank on multiple websites are not only deserved, but expected. If possible, I would recommend never using any financing programs ties to TD Bank.

name: dayton
review: Does target not give CLI's?!?!I opened my account  in June 2019,I made all my payments on time and in full,yet I'm still stuck at the same measly $300 credit limit and there is nowhere online on the account page to request a CLI. Ridiculous!!!

name: alma
review: hahaha i've had $200 (most of my credit cards are at $10+ limit) and for 2 years its been at $200

name: Helen
review: TD offered me a great rate and professional, personal service. I highly recommend TD bank for personal loans. I have not been paid for this recommendation.

name: kahanhome
review: I was told that the wait to be answered was 20 minutes; it's been well over a half hour. An up-to-date operation has a call back facility. Not TD Bank, nor do they print checks (incoming) on the monthly statement. One can only go back three or so months; not helpful; not enough. Finally, there's intentionally, too much bank officer movement. In my branch you get to know the staff and are soon replaced. Indeed, TD Bank has floaters as a position.

name: sjcox2733
review: Horrible never got the red card... charging me late fees.. they do not care about you ! Worse credit card I’ve ever applied for! It’s ridiculous. I hope you never apply this card because it would ruin your credit baddddd

name: jalcus
review: TD is not working with small buisness during this time of need I called in was on the phone for over 30 min they would not even defer a commercial loan 1 month I would never use this Bank again. CLOSED due to the pandemic BUT TD does not care about our payroll or TRUCK PAYMENTS heartless

name: Jacqueline
review: This is a good card to have and carry with. Good rates, no complaints. Started me with a good credit line. I’m happy using this card

name: kjle58
review: Asked for too much verification of my identity like a copy of my Social Security card and a copy of a utility bill faxed to them. Too much leg work for a card and they don't even tell you they need this extra stuff till after you apply so you have this hard pull on your credit and don't get approved for a card until you fully verify your identity by giving them info that can be used by anyone who has access to that info by fax that can be used to steal your identity. I have a Best buy visa, a Citi double cash and PayPal MasterCard with 2 percent cashback on the ladder two rewards card. I never had to do that extra leg work before and I have a FICO score in the 750s. Hard pass on this card.

name: Jess M
review: Closing my account with them soon. I make a payment days before it’s due and they still charge me late fees. They’ve even charged me double late fees, even after making a payment ($76 in fees). I’ve called and complained and they tell me there’s nothing they can do about it. I’ve paid Ofer $150 in late fees, in the last few months, when my payments are clearly being made. Paid my card off and will be closing the account soon. Awful customer service.

name: Heather  B
review: I suggest just not using it because canceling credit cards with lower credit score for a bit.

name: Sauman
review: Nordstrom Visa Credit Card from TD Bank:Low-quality customer services, nobody is responsible, they don't know really what's going on there. Old policies, rules and WEB SITE. Be careful about their unprofessional and odd behavior! Nordstrom is more likely to lose some customers due to its credit card.

name: carlacristh91
review: Online management is terrible. I set up an auto payment and they couldn’t find the account. So I was charged $30 for the Payment return. When I went online to check out what went wrong I couldn’t find the account It have been deleted!!!!! They have no back up they can’t proved any information !!!!  I end up paying 30$ when didn’t  know what  happened. I have been a customer for 3 years with no issues ever. They refused and did not care at all. Don't let the 5% trick you, their stuff is already marked up. Very very disappointed

name: Kris Duttlinger
review: Credit karma reported me as 30 days past due and charged $69 in fees when I never missed a payment. I've gone to the store and they can not help me. It also shows over the limit by $79which can't be possible either because I had $100 available credit

name: Deborah A
review: TD Bank has always been very helpful with any problems that arises on my account. It is very convenient to pay right over the phone where money gets put on your account fast.

name: rosanacarr24
review: My card wasn’t renewed after 25 years of having the credit card and excellent payment history with them. They wrote that my score was too low. I’ll never shop at Nordstrom again as loyalty means nothing to them.

name: deidre
review: I have had this happen as well where they either close the account or in your case do not renew. Seems to only happen with store charge cards. Unfortunately it is their right as the card issuer which I know does not make it better but there is no recourse. Just honestly stay away from store cards as the apt is ridiculously high anyway just stick major credit cards with rewards attached

name: jackiegarrido472010
review: My account got set as a delinquent account for 24 dollars that i didnt know i had on my statement and they made no attempt to contact me even though for 2 years i never was late once for a payment now this lowered my credit score 83 points and they say theres no way to remove it. I got 1 phone call from them 2 days after they set my account to delinquent status. I wish i could close this account i dont even use this card ever

name: deidre
review: @kayleecherieee my thoughts exactly. It’s your responsibility to keep up with your money. If the charges are wrong then you would take the time to call and rectify the issue. I’m sure you got a bill either by mail or paperless to let you know about this.

name: Suman P
review: I was charged maintainence fees twice in two months. I should not be charged this as I maintained required combined balance across TD accounts. I called the customer support and asked them to revert the fees. They said I was charged the fees as the accounts are not linked and they can only refund half of one maintenance fees. How can customers know the accounts should be linked and they are not actually linked? I am closing my account and never open an account with TDBank.

name: sljhenshaw
review: TD Bank is really crooked!!!! This has to be one of the worst banks ever!!!! They allow money to be taken even when there’s no money there, causing acct to be overdrawn. We had my son’s acct set up to not allow that to happen but they still allow it when it’s PS4, Netflix, or whatever automatic debit...but that’s not right. If there’s no funds, that should be that n it should be automatically blocked/denied. They not only hit him with overdraft fees of $30 each again, but also an extra $27 from transferring funds from one acct to another a few times. His taxes are already set to direct deposit into this acct, but as soon as that money hits, I’m going with him to withdraw everything, close acct, and bank with the credit union bc they won’t allow all of the nut shit that TD has going on. Banks collect millions of dollars yearly in overdraft and other fees. Crooked f******!!!!!?

name: sheryl_dinsmore
review: I had this card since 1997.  I had a dispute with a merchant and their policy to dispute my charge was beyond ridiculous.  I can't believe they would treat a customer of so many years like they need prove the charge should be disputed in such a manner.  All the years I have held the card this was my first dispute and the last one.  I closed my account and will never use them again.

name: cindy0246
review: We were an excellent paying customer during a promotional credit card offer.  Paying off and closing the account costs an extra $600 and took 3 attempts to pay it off.   They wouldn't compromise with the timing to pay.  A credit spanned the billing cycle that caused another late fee that they wouldn't reverse. Will never do a promotion with them again.  When talking with customer service they wont take the payment during that call to close the account.  you  have to call another number and that payment took several days to post which caused more late fees.  Not happy with them.  Both them and the store has lost my business.

name: luxeconstruction00
review: Worst bank I ever bean with I did withdraw at 12:09 am and had notifications that account reach negative I was on road so I stop by near TD to put cash so will not be negative they charge me $170.00 next day this is insane never will deal with them agin and worst part not first time

name: rfoldesy
review: TD is the most INCONVENIENT bank in the world.  They have the WORST phone service of any bank I have ever dealt with.  If you have business that requires you to speak with someone, you’ll have to go to a branch to get it done.  After waiting 45 MINUTES to speak to a phone agent, I was rudely told I couldn’t be helped because I couldn’t accurately recall the balance on my mortgage.  “Go to a branch “ I was told... I will, but not to a TD branch!  I’m through with you.

name: None Yabusiness
review: I had this card for several years without problems. Suddenly in the last few months all hell broke loose. My account was locked, my passwords didn't work, my payments were rejected. Finally, I got so frustrated with this company that I told them to close the account. I also don't need or want these problems, like another reviewer said. The representative said I had paid my whole balance. Then two months later I got a letter in the mail stating I was past due. I called the 800 number and it took me almost twenty minutes. Just to pay a bill, you have to provide a checking account and routing number. Debit cards are not offered by phone. These people don't communicate, they don't care and they are the worst I've ever dealt with. I have accounts with several other banks and have no issues. I also am just not going to bother going to the store anymore. There are other options, clearly the quality I thought that was there, is not. Goodbye Target!

name: Stephanie
review: Thanks this account was closed in good standing. I don't want this account to affect my reports, wallet hut is helping me understand more my score and how to work on my credit. Wich i can start building know.

name: reidbranston
review: WORST BANK EVER! I own a car dealership in New York and TD Bank is by far the worst bank out of all the banks we work with regarding car loans. It takes them months to get paperwork to us that normal banks return in 1 week. Every time we call we get a different story from a different employee and half the time they are lying. DO NOT USE TD BANK!

name: Robert
review: I applied for this secured credit card to help rebuild my credit. Application was easy at my local TD BANK. I can easily track my spending and pay my monthly balance directly from the TD Bank App. I haven’t had any problems using the card at restaurants, gas stations, grocery stores etc.. So far it’s been a great card and have already seen a 60 point improvement to my credit score in 8 months.

name: Scott Gardner
review: We got pulled into this bank by their "$300 for a new checking account" ad. Come to find out that the small print stated that although they are advertising it in the middle of the month, the program did not start until the the end. So, for everyone who did not read the very fine print and catch this, you opened up a new checking account expecting your $300 only to be told that it is not going to happen. Misleading advertising at best.....cheap low-down business practices are also an option. This will be the shortest time I have ever spent with a bank and good riddance. If this is their idea of customer service I would hate to have a real problem and ask them for help.

name: Thomas
review: Great card to begin building your credit  I am happy with the cards in TDs member services are always great...........................................

name: jessicamc1215
review: This bank is the worst they don’t deserve one star!!! For months I go into the bank cry before for MY OWN MONEY BACK!!! I had purchased for $8008.00 the cashiers check was accidentally destroyed while my children where doing arts and crafts at the table. A manager informs me to take a bond before me and my 3 children are homeless and have no Christmas I use another $560 dollars to purchase the bond I also pay $32.95 to overnight it. Mind you the branch manager at TD Bank puts me in contact with a bond company for the cashiers check so I am just trying to keep a roof over there head and give them Christmas. I get the bond get to the bank finally relieved they than tell me that manager no longer works there and they don’t take the bonds at the Most convenient  bank in American I than contact corporate where they inform me with in 72 hours they will have it cleared up it’s been over 3 weeks since I got a call back from anyone corporate or the branch !!! I’m sure there children and families had a great Christmas horrible bank shame on you!! Thank you to the worst bank ever! Thank you for the worst Christmas ever!!

name: Anthoneil
review: Not what I expected and the take forever to give a credit increase even when u pay ur bills on time so I probably will be closing my account with them

name: jasonmatthew913
review: I have had my Target RedCard for 7 months now.  I have NEVER missed a payment with them.  I have also NEVER had a payment returned to them for any reason.  I ALWAYS pay my balance down to 20% EVERY MONTH.  I paid it this December 17th, and the payment cleared my bank on December 18th.  They REFUSE to post it to my available credit.  It is not like I need it, or at this point would use it.  However, there is NO REASON that they should be holding my payment hostage.  My e-mails to them and phone calls have all gone with BS excuses.  Now they want me to call my bank on a conference call with them.  This is ridiculous to say the least.  I will be paying off this card this month, and never using it again.

name: Edward
review: I just had the same issue, it took 16 days for my payment to show in my available credit.  They wanted me to do a 3-way call with my bank as well.  I refused and wrote an email to the Target CEO and the TD Bank CEO.  It's ridiculous how long they hold a payment.

name: gd2341
review: I recently got a credit line increase of 15 thousand and today they called me and a very rude lady told me they are shutting the card down no reason giving ! I kept asking and they simply said they are closing it !

name: Randy
review: Discover card is definitely the best car they’re always on point and very knowledgeable thank you TD bank makes to many mistakes and also they don’t tell the truth on the consumer fraud law it’s called bait and switch

name: Amber James
review: So when I first opened the account everything was ok for the first few months then three weeks ago some fraudulent company took 103 dollars which left my account negative so I called TD filed a dispute then waited on this so called provisional credit from the bank I got told two different from two different reps when the credit was supposed to be in my account never came so I call a fourth time I was told well we don’t know when or have a specific time as to when the credit will be there mind you I have bills and kids and I needed that little bit of credit to put groceries in my house so I had borrow money so two days just before I decided to go the bank to raise hell the credit was in my account so I thought everything was good. Nope!!!! So today while checking my accounts I have two account I WAS closing one account to transfer to another account but not after what happened today so my accounts were both positive on Sunday so checking my accounts today one was negative one was positive I’m like that doesn’t look right so I called TD even the rep was confused as to what had happened so he just moved the positive amount into the negative which made the whole account positive so I said ok next thing I know I checking the account again in the afternoon my account is negative I’m like what the hell so here we go again I called TD speaking with another rep who didn’t understand me like I was speaking complete English I explained to him my transactions and what transpired over weekend and asked how am I in the negative when and ever time before I make a purchase or pay anything I check my account and I know for a fact it was in the positive so he transferred me to the supervisor she tells me from such a such time is was in the negative she kept asking are all the transactions yours well you shouldn’t turned of the overdraft protection I asked her why is the mobile app and your system are telling me two different things my app shows me positive and her end shows I’m negative and continued to be negative as transactions were being made but I’m telling her my end showed me positive before making any transactions I asked her can tell me why my mobile app was not telling me my account was in the negative when in fact it showed it was positive she said no i can’t 32 minutes going back and forth so all in all nothing was done to help me understand why I was being told two different things from her and the mobile app so once that money goes back to them I’m done im closing my accounts and this isn’t little bit is money their taking it’s a lot and I only work part time it’s a BIG chunk of money their taking so I’m done with TD forever!!!!! I’ve had it

name: Kenneth
review: Nothing special about this card.  I rarely use it.  Reward rate is lower than other cards I use.  I don’t even know why I have one. For emergencies only, I guess.

name: Dontiburcio
review: It’s a great card to build credit. Gives you the opportunity to increase your credit portfolio for better card offers down the line.  I’ve had nothing but positive things from this card.

name: melody
review: I have never used this card and it has dropped my credit rating. Please take this off of my credit report as this was closed 7 years ago.

name: tuseowp
review: wors bank to get a loan, even with a 700 credit..this please suck. This is  small bank, and help people, this is the reason always will be small.

name: klevisgallani42
review: Worst retail credit card ever. 0% APR for twelve months but accrues interest on the balance that you have during the twelve(12) month period. How is it exactly 0% APR then? Customer service is terrible at speaking with customers.  The supervisor who worked on 11/18/2019 for East Coast at around 8pm ET was uneducated and raised her voice multiple times during our conservation.

name: jasminelee_carter
review: I was charged by Target for a return payment fee ($28.00) and called into Target Customer Service who said the payment was withdrawn from an old bank account. I let them know that the account it was withdrawn from had been closed almost a year and I had made subsequent payments on my Target credit card multiple times from the correct/active bank account. They could not tell me why the payment was drawn from my old bank account. The Supervisor I spoke with asked that I log into my account to delete the old bank account - when I logged in and told her it was already removed, she told me that they had removed it already for me. I asked how I could be refunded the return payment fee and she said that it could only be removed if it was a processing error on their end. They were not able to tell me why this didn't constitute as a processing error or why it had been withdrawn from an old account. Since they were not able to refund the return payment fee, I elected to cancel my credit card immediately.

name: melissaxstiles
review: I called and spoke to “Richard in California” I told him repeatedly I am locked out of my account online, and just want paper statements mailed to me so I can pay, and make sure they are paid on time.... apparently that’s too hard to understand... he kept repeating himself, not listening to me, and then even said “I mean I can repeat myself again”. Are you kidding me? Damn right I told him you suck at customer service, and hung up...Asshole please change jobs

name: Richard
review: This is a good all around card to have. I enjoy receiving the cash back when I use the card , especially for dining out. I would like a larger credit limit though. Thanks.

name: Jennifer W
review: I didn't read the fine print when applying for this card so I missed the $49 annual fee - my fault   I got it to add a 'mix' to my credit report (the whole credit card, retail card mix creditors want to see).  There isn't a Target within less than over an hour drive from where I live so I figured the TargetRed Card would work fine.  I  charged 3 things on it at one time, all shirts, and none fit- they were all too small.  I'm 5'9 & 165lbs and ordered Mens Large.  Theoretically, a medium should have fit me.   The hassle to mail them back isn't worth it to me so I paid the bill.  They show items, but when you click on an item to view it's options, the item is not available for online purchase and if you CAN purchase it then it'll say "out of stock" 85% to 90% of the time or if it's clothing or shoes, your size won't be available.  This happens under any given category on any given day.   I find that odd and the card simply isn't for me.  I, personally, don't recommend  getting this card.

name: Jeryl
review: TD’s credit cards come with high interest rates and long wait times for customer service. In addition, the card’s “security features” make it difficult to use the card for travel or big purchases. When traveling, the card is routinely blocked, even if you call to notify them. It regularly blocks purchases over $300, again even when the bank has been notified. Customer help generally takes upwards of 30 minutes wait time to get to a surly CSR. The ever-changing language of phone codes, phone pins, security codes, and security words mean that once you reach them, they will often be unwilling to solve your problem anyway, no matter how much personal information you can furnish. At least it has a VISA logo and a decent points program.

name: Meeko F
review: I opened a Nordstrom Signature Visa account on September 20, 2019, during my checkout at the Nordstrom Rack on Boylston St in Boston when I made a $1000 purchase of clothes.  The next time I tried to use it at the same store a week later, I was held up by the cashier to verify information by phone with cardservices and told to send in my utilities bill and drivers license photocopy.  This seemed sketchy so I asked if they could email or mail me what they need from me, but was told "no, we cannot mail you this... please get a pen and paper and write down our address and what we need." I am a disabled veteran with memory issues and a service dog, and there were 20 impatient people in line behind me. This was extremely stressful, so I just said "yes" to everything to get out of the situation and put the charges on my USAA Visa card instead.  I also have an 830 credit score, no debt, and solid financial situation, so I found all this highly unusual.  Two weeks later I received the plastic card in the mail and was barred from activating it due to a hold on the account.  So I called customer service to at least pay off the initial $1000 balance to prevent interest and fees.  I did an electronic funds transfer from my bank to do so, but was told if I return any items there may be problems putting the refund $ back on the card -- I may need to take store credit instead.  I don't want store credit if I return items -- I want cash, but I checked the back of the receipts and this is actually the contract for returns: credit back on the tender used for payment or store credit.  I look forward to returning any items, sorting out any credits, and closing the account.  What a nightmare.

name: ysbhandar
review: - Mortgage limit on lower side- For pre-approval they hit my and my partners credit thriceNow I am applying for mortgage and due to credit score was hit finding difficult to get required mortgage from other Bank.Highly recommend you not to go with TD ever for Mortgage and stick to one bank from the beginning.

name: Phil Coleman
review: $1500 minimum balance to avoid a $25. monthly maintenance theft for a small business account. Ridiculous. TD Bank is no help to your small business.

name: argentinachristiano
review: The waiting times to get a customer service representative on the phone are HORRIBLE! Today, I waited 30 minutes plus and NOBODY answer the phone. This is by far the worst waiting time I have ever experienced.

name: Alyse Coleman
review: I was really excited about the Target Red Card when I first signed up. I liked the idea of getting a high value coupon and 5% back on my purchases. When I first signed up at the desk, I used a check from a joint account with my mom that I didn't realize she had closed. Although the account was closed, they apparently didn't have any way to check that right away and went ahead and let me make purchases. I made 4 purchases right away, needing 4 receipts for different reasons. I soon got a bill in the mail with penalty fees for each of the 4 purchases, doubling the amount I had spent in the store. They would only waive the fees one transaction, even though all purchases were made on the same day immediately after signing up for the card. Up until now, I have been a frequent shopper at Target but I plan on spending my money elsewhere.

name: teresa
review: That is your fault! You have responsibility to read to understand the do and don't of any credit card! Also your fault for not maintaining a checking account that is in your name! They should of got you for Fraud!

name: Angela G
review: How would you not know if a checking account is closed? It sounds like you knew what you were doing and who gets approved for a card and use it four times in one day!! You should have been charged with fraud, because you knew what you were doing. Get out of this forum complaining about a company, when you committed fraud.

name: deidre
review: Was this the target red DEBIT card because I’m trying to understand how you opened an account to use for purchases but still used a check from a closed account to pay for it. Am I reading that wrong? If I’m not then the two respondents above are correct the bank that owns the target cards could have charged you with fraud and you were lucky you were only made to pay penalties.

name: Rahul Iyer
review: The cash rewards are not the greatest but if you are a Canadian with good Canadian credit score but no history in the US, this is a no brainer. No other bank is going to entertain you with equivalent offerings. I have banked with TD Canada for >10 yrs now.. I believe I am most likely going to stick with this for atleast another 10.. Its a pity TD doesnt has a very good branch presence else I would have preferred banking with them as well

name: ujugolden4me
review: Worst bank ever. This bank is a joke. They care less about you. ATM too money out of my paycheque, I tried to resolve this several times but they didn’t do nothing. Listen TD bank, people work because  they need the money to take of their bills and family, so if you feel reluctant resolving financial issues it would be very selfish of you. This is ridiculous.

name: vorlovaactor
review: I had target credit card since for 5 year. My available limit went from $500 to $9k. I had payment returned because their website defaulted to the wrong bank account on my profile. They did not want to take responsibility for it and would not credit me $30 payment return fee that I was charged. Any company I know offers courtesy fee removal at least once a year. Target will not do it even once in 5 years! I will be looking for more friendly credit card now.

name: Amanda Farmer
review: I have the secured version and never went over limits and paid my credit card perfect and I can’t graduate. I have two other credit cards in less time and both have increased credit limit. Will be closing soon

name: combat_cook8
review: I’ve had my card since 2015 with a $300 cL but with consistent use I’m at $2600.00 now.. As Walmart lowered my limit when I got into a financial jam in 2017, I paid all my cards off in 2018 and noticed Target was the only card that didn’t lower my CL or give me any trouble at all! I grocery shop with it and buy electronics as I need them... Great card to have for household needs!

name: Lisa Davis
review: Beware  of the atm.  It will still your money.  I deposited my paycheck friday in the amont of  {exampel{) $657. 67. Well it only put the $57.67 in my account.  Yeah!. I went inside only to be told they couldnt do anything  but repirt it and i should get get it in 10 days.  I have auto bills that come out.  Called costumer service.  Told me the same thing.  Here it is Wednesday and i still dont have MY money.  Thank god i caught it.  I probably  would never see the $600. So beware of tbe atm.....

name: bucks_shopping
review: I accuse TD Bank of outrageous low end business tactics. Thinking to do the right thing, I cancelled my deceased husbands TD Bank credit card and at the request of the phone agent faxed his death certificate.  TD Bank subsequently cancelled the card and sold his debt to a collection agency.  My guess is TD Bank assumed the debt would not be paid. Then scrambled to protect assets by taking the low ground.  TD Bank ruined my husband's good name for a mere $1400 debt.  No statement was sent and when I called for an explanation TD could not speak to me because proof of executor rights was required.  This excuse after being able to speak with me concerning his death.

name: philip_blackstone
review: They neglected to send a statement in Nov and Dec 2018, I finally figured something was wrong when the card was declined. I immediately paid the amount in full, but not before they reported the account delinquent and took 80 points off my credit score. Apparently, they changed their system in Sep 2018 and this is a common complain on other forums.

name: Max Jordan
review: DO **NOT** Get the TARGET RedCard!  Target "National Bank" is a cancer on the Target brand name and needs to be abolished.  It's much more harsh, impersonal, inflexible, and conservative than any of the huge national bank conglomerates.  They don't care about their customers and are all about making a buck off your back.  (1) Target "pushes" this credit card through it's employees at point-of-sale and they resent being harassessed for not "selling" enough cards.  Check the online blogs including at 'ihatetarget.com'.  (2) Customers are being pushed into applying for this card at point-of-sale and tempted with immediate 'savings' on their purchase.  Standing at a cash register with people lined up behind you is not the time to be deciding if you want to apply for a credit card and the implications of that!!  (3) I applied at the register for my 5% savings but the application would not allow me to list my (correct) PO Box since I travel for business and don't want my mail sitting curbside for days.  I had to list my street address (which only gets junk mail.)   My first mistake, I admit.  I should not even have applied but they put me on the spot.  (4) My bill got mixed in with other mail and I missed making my payment.  Yes, my mistake, but an honest mistake.  As soon as I became aware of it, I paid the amount in full, not just the minimum due. (5) Due to the honest misunderstanding, I asked to have late charges and/or interest credited to my account as a one-time courtesy, since I don't make a habit of being an irresponsible borrower.  They refused.  They reported me 30-days late on my payment to credit bureau.(6) I used the card more over a period of a couple of years to show I was responsible.  (7) After a few years, I asked them to give me a good faith removal of that 30-day late payment.  They refused.  I asked again after several months, by elevating to a higher level (VP).  They refused.  *Note:  Statistics show the majority of customers who ask for a reversal of late charges, interest, or dropping of late payment reports succeed, especially on the first offense.  Most stores know people are human, they sometimes make mistakes, and they shouldn't be beat over the head for a late payment for the SEVEN YEARS it takes to fall off their credit reports.  Not Target.  They will take every opportunity to make every penny they can off every customer from interest and fees to make up for that 5% they pay out.  Not good for business or for customer relations, but they don't care about you.  It's all about the almighty dollar with them.  (8)  I proceeded to boycott Target fpr several years. They threatened to close my card from disuse and finally closed it.  I'm coming up on the end of my seven-year late payment sentence.  It really doesn't affect my credit much at this point, but it annoys me that they continue to hold it over me.  They lost a long-time customer for life over their foolish "REDCARD" program.

name: dave swiss
review: I've had the TD Cash Card for years, recently they did a promotion and gave 2% back on everything for 2 months. so I only used that card, for everything. spent about 7500 and had about 15,000 points or $150. so I ordered 3x $50 gift cards and have been waiting for a month. never received them. I contact TD, they pull it up to see if it was shipped, and it was 3 weeks ago, they say "sorry we are not responsible if the card is neverreceived, lost  or stolen" okay fine, but since it's a card with a number cant you trace it, they give me some serial number and say contact amazon. amazon cant do anything because the gift cards were not ordered with my Amazon account so they tell me to go back to TD. call them again, they tell me the same thing again, I speak with a supervisor and again no, sorry nothing we can do. we live in a time where everything is digital and traceable and yet my digital gift card is completely untraceable. I have nothing against the staff they are friendly and doing their job. but the card company itself should get with the time and be able track their customers well earned "cash/gift rewards" a little better. very disappoint in TD. guess it's time to stop using their card.

name: Danielle Lapointe
review: Horrible, horrible people working for this bank. Wont release my payroll check money to buy gas to go to work. They have attitude that i want my own money be available. Dont deserve any star. I called the branch and their general number noone of them gave a damn.

name: kennyk89
review: They accepted my online application for Target credit card. After waiting nearly 3 weeks to  recieve credit card In mail and register card online Suprise!, I can't use card or register it. After calling customer support, they said they needed more verification and  I would have to fax them the front and back of my ID and social security card, plus utility or bank statement. After a long hassle they wouldn't accept my bank statement.  Customer support is horrible and useless. Stay far away from Target credit card!

name: Chris Smith
review: DO NOT get or use this creditcard. You cannot dispute transactions online.  You have to call them in order to dispute a transaction and it is a complete hassle.  Also, I cancelled my card in Sept and a company was allowed to force through a charge in January, even though my card was cancelled.  I disputed the charge and they outright REFUSED to take it off my account.  There are so many better cards out there that offer more and are "with the times" - they are so old and archaic with the way they operate and their customer service stinks.

name: tthomps1
review: "Why You Just Lost A Customer"To Whom It May Concern:Effective today I will no longer be a patron of Nordstrom.One two separate incidents I have applied for in store credit, and was duly denied both times. Keep in mind I am a card member at Neiman Marcus and Saks Fifth Avenue and were approved with hardly any hassle- instantaneously too I may add. You may see my choice to no longer patronize menial, however consider the following:1. As mentioned previously the other, more distinguished department stores issued me cards on the spot. By you not doing do- or even giving the option to start off with a small credit line you are only hurting your bottom line…	 A. Since I opened by Neiman’s account in early December, I have already spent $2,250.00 on merchandise. Based on that trajectory, that would be about $13,500 a year I spend with them.          B. People who make purchases with credit cards are higher than those who use cash/ credit         C. I have read that even those with good credit have been denied a card with Nordstrom.         D. As a company, your net worth has been decreasing since 2014 (734 million) to 437 million in 2018.While I understand every strip has their own policy and the right to deny credit to those who are deemed unfit. Im just disappointed I was given no other action…Im a cardholder with Neiman’s, Saks and Bloomingdales…and I couldn’t get approved for a Nordstrom card?

name: brittanytheberge
review: If you like getting insessent calls about your balance and making a payment this is the card for you. I literally recieve 60 calls a day. They dont communicate. Its too much. I get it i owe 114 dollers. I will pay it in two weeks. Like what i told ever other person. Like come on i bought 2 things. Everyone tells me a different min. You won't let me do a 25 doller payment but a 125 doller payment min or whatever. Dont call me every day every second of the day it will be like 10 at night or 6 am and i get a call from them. Like stop it. Please i will pay when i can. I dont want you to call me at work or picking up my son. Etc. I will deal when i can. You dont listen when i say i am inbetween jobs. Ir just started making money etc. It is way too much. I am more than frustrated.… read more

name: bobbiejrae
review: Never get a TD Bank credit card!  They lie and scam you!I disputed a transaction and TD removed the anount I had disputed from my account.  About six weeks later, a representative told me on the phone that it had been resolved in my favor.  Two months later, without any advanced notification, TD bank credit card added the disputed amount plus interest  back onto my credit card.  WTF happened?I did nothing to deserve this treatment.  My account had been open for 3 years and I had paid off my balance in full each month.Again, WTF happened?

name: crashtestdummie
review: Don't ever use this company, I in error paid 300.00 09/17/2018 that was not owed. It is 12/31/2018 and still no refund. My Husband has called them every 7 to 10 days. Same old song and dance. Check never shows up. Don't use this company! DON'T USE THIS COMPANY!

name: abigaleguo
review: I cannot believe that TD bank is one of the largest bank in the US. I opened my account in midtown New York. The lady who helped me opened my account misspelled my name and my ssn, but I didn’t realize it until the second when I am there to pick up my debit card. On the second day, the other lady there helped me did a correction on my ssn and copied my ssn card and saved to there file. Six months later, I went to the TD bank in Flushing with my mom to add her name to my account. And a week later when my mom was there again, she was told that her name is not on my account... so interesting. So I went there again with my mom, and realized that my name and ssn are still the wrong one on the file..... so I asked the costumer representative who assisted us if he can change it, and he said he needed the copy of my ssn card. I told him the midtown office had already take the copy twice and asked if he can go through the system to retrieved it. And he told me he was unable to because my file is kept in midtown branch system. What a great bank and wonderful experience.

name: Mo Hesari
review: 3 months ago I opened a Checking account in TD bank in New Jersey. Also I applied for a Credit Card.I put 5 grands in my account immediately and I received 8 grands as my started Credit line, due to my great Credit Score. Now after less than 3 months, I received an official letter that tells me TD bank decides to close my both accounts, without mentioning any reasons. When I call TD, they said “we can not tell you why we decide to close your accounts”. It is unbelievable. IT IS MY BASIC RIGHT to know what is wrong. If anything was wrong, why TD bank accepted me as a new costumer and gave me a good credit line?! I DO NOT have any residential issues, and because of my job, I am passed highest background check several times. There is no reason for TD to behave like this. It’s rude and ridiculous. It is too frustrating when I have to spend a lot of time to manage my Deposits and Payments again. They do not have right to do it.

name: pritchardb789
review: I laughingly refer to TDBank as Americas Most Inconvenient bank. In fact this really should be their slogan. Yes tellers are always nice but I haven't found anything about their banking system to be convenient from their app to asking for any help with converting foreign money.  2019 will be my year to find a new bank, I'm done!

name: cc246
review: They do not care about the customers and are unwilling to work with you. I had a situation that I would have liked for someone to at least show concern and look at the details. They did not and unfortunately, I had decided to close my account.

name: John Doe
review: Worst customer service. You can't dispute transaction online, you have to call them. I've spent 20 minutes on the line with customer service just to dispute duplicate transaction.You can do that in 2 clicks in other banks!They even don't have mobile app.

name: Monteo Campbell
review: I have had this card for 16 months with 500 credit limit never been late for 12 months straight I have paid balance off still no increase even after several times asking and the rewards part is an complete joke

name: sarahsalem1919
review: I applied for this card and got approved, so I made my first purchase and after a week of waiting for my first order I tried to track it to find out that it was canceled..those people sent you a card and tell you that you’re approved then they cancel your order because they want you to mail copies of your SSN and ID AFTER RECEIVING YOUR CARD!!!!!  What a logic!!!!! Who would do that? Honestly? It’s okay to not approve people or decline the purchase, but to give them a card then after they use it you tell them that they’re not approved yet and they need to mail more things! I won’t send a copy of my SSN to anyone after giving it online and getting approved. That’s so misleading!   I ended up closing my account! They should’ve told you before they approve your account that they will need you to send those copies so you won’t have to close the account and affect your credit score. I have more than 5 cards! Never had this kind of bureaucracy before. You don’t give people false impressions like this and waste their time. My size was sold out when I’ve tried to make another order and pay the full amount! Also messing with people’s credit score is so unacceptable. You do it all in reverse! The card approval should be after I meet your acquirements not before.  You don’t give people an account and a cart number then ask for more things. If you needed more verification you should've asked and let people know from the beginning!! It’s not just confusing but It doesn’t make any sense. Thankfully I found my size in a different store. I will make sure not to spend my $$ in this store again. I really didn’t need their card. I was just trying it and I ended up wasting a whole evening trying to understand whether if I have a card with them or not. I didn’t even get an empty sorry although the person who answered me admitted it that their process doesn’t make any sense! He said it should be in the right order in a perfect world!  Guess what! Other stores made it perfect. He said those stores are not Nordstrom. True. they’re not. They are better than Nordstrom and have more logical intelligence, ethics, transparency, and communication. Don’t apply if you’re an honest person who wants to live in a perfect world when people don’t take their word back, give false hopes and play with people credit score like it’s not an important thing. Nordstrom card really deserves the bad reputation I’ve heard of it from everybody I asked about before applying. I should’ve listened. DON’T APPLY

name: Meeko  F
review: Same thing happened to me with Nordstrom and this card 3 weeks ago.  Most stressful shopping experience I've ever had, as they held me up at the cashier (I'm disabled with a service dog) to take down information over their phone that they would not email nor mail me, asking me to send them utility bills and proof of social security number.  I have an 830 credit rating.  The amount of work needed to pay my initial Nordstrom purchaseon this card before they put a hold on it required me to call them several times since the card would not activate nor let me pay online when I finally received it this past week.

name: anneh_24
review: TD Bank is the worst. First of all the annoying things that make it an inconvenient bank, but don't make you want to go through the trouble of closing your accounts. Almost every day the ATMs are out of order around NYC. The mobile app rarely works outside of banking hours. Customer service wait times are very long, and once you reach an agent the hoops you have to jump through to prove it's your account are incredible. They have a policy that transactions are handled in time order, so if I have a recurring payment that goes through a day early, which happens often, and I see that it's unexpectedly pending, and deposit money to cover it before it posts, I am still charged an overdraft fee. I hate all those things about TD Bank, but today I had an experience that set me over the edge and I am definitely closing my account as soon as my check is cleared. I deposited my paycheck from work on Friday after the cutoff time, so it's usually available to me on Monday when that happens, but this time it wasn't. I assumed it would be available on Tuesday because another annoying thing is that they're inconsistent about whether Saturday deposits will be available on Monday or Tuesday. I had no reason not to believe it would be available Tuesday as per usual, but Tuesday morning it was still on hold with a code that said something like FM Hold - See SM. I was told this meant see secure messages. No messages. I called customer service to ask about it and the agent just gave me a bunch of nonsense read from a script and couldn't explain anything to me so I asked for a manager. The manager told me it was just a random hold that they do sometimes and even though I have been depositing checks in this amount from this employer since I opened the account two years ago they flagged it for verification, and I can expect this to happen at any time in the future. I asked why I wasn't sent a message to notify me that the deposit wouldn't be available when it usually is and she said it isn't their policy to notify customers about extended holds because they don't have the manpower. I think that is incredibly bad customer service. I had scheduled payments to the IRS and my credit card company to go through on the day I expected my deposit to be available, so I had to take time away from work to withdraw money from my savings and deposit it into my checking account to make sure my payments cleared so I wouldn't be in trouble with the IRS and get charged overdraft fees. The manager told me that in the future I can check with the bank manager of the branch where I make my deposits every time I make a deposit to find out if there will be an extended hold. She seemed to think this was a reasonable thing to expect. The whole situation is just so abusive to the customer. I feel taken advantage of. I feel powerless to control my own finances, and each of the people I talked to clearly didn't care and basically just said oh well, not my problem, deal with it. I'm not a deadbeat customer either. I have a very high credit score because I pay all my bills early, I keep money in the bank, I don't cause problems or have unreasonable expectations. There's no reason they shouldn't treat me like a valued customer. My expectation that they should notify the customer ahead of time if a check will have an extended hold time is not unreasonable at all considering it's a checking account and the main reason to have a checking account is to pay bills, but apparently they don't think their customers deserve this courtesy. I really hope they go out of business because they definitely deserve it.

name: underwoodadrienne
review: TD Bank has the worst customer service and efficiency I have ever encountered. I tried to use Zelle to make a rent payment. My payment had a red flag put on it because my first time payment was large. Okay, fair—I call them, they say the payment will be cancelled and I can send it again after it’s cancelled. The next day, I go into my account to resend the payment and find that my entire account is on hold, in direct contradiction to what the customer service representative told me the previous day. I call again. I’m told that I need to go to a brick and mortar bank to verify my identity. Wouldn’t be a problem, except that I live in Louisiana and the nearest bank is in Florida. I tell them that, they say I have to come to Florida. I’ve never had suspicious account activity, no overdrafts, nothing. Just a college kid trying to pay rent, and TD bank tells me I need to drive through four states because they cancelled my payment. I will no longer be a customer of TD bank, and will be warning everyone I can about this crooked company.

name: vertigo icallio
review: Customer service telephone help used to be responsive, but now is practically unusable, with waits on hold in excess of 30 minutes. Tellers also often rude and poorly trained. Fees excessive compared to other banks.

name: Ray Reynolds
review: Have had no problems, they upped my limit from $2500 to $9000, who spends 9 grand at Target? My top balance was probably only $50. xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

name: Rickkiboi
review: Credit Line Increases and MasterCard ConversionTarget does NOT issue a MasterCard as an initial credit card. I've been mining my REDcard in hopes of having it converted to a MasterCard. I use it every week for simple needed purchases; groceries, toiletries, household items, etc., usually $10 - $30. I make purchases in-store, online for store pick-up, and online for home delivery (for moderate purchases that qualify for FREE shipping). I payoff my transactions online or in-store as soon as they post.Thirteen months fresh out of a BK7 I applied for a REDcard and was approved with an $800 credit line. At four months I received a credit line increase (CLI) to $1,400, at nine months a CLI to $2,700, and at 11 months a CLI to $9,000!One week after my 11 month CLI and statement cycle I received the letter I was hoping for. Target is converting my store REDcard to a MasterCard! From day one for 11 months I've been grooming this account in hopes of conversion, it will convert at 12 months of billing.In addition to the already instant savings of 5% on every purchase, the REDcard MasterCard is now offering 2% Rewards on gas, dining, and travel purchases as well as 1% on everything else. Rewards are issued annually in the form of a Target store gift card.FICO scores at conversion avg. 670, income $94K

name: Ray  Reynolds
review: Not sure why they said they are converting mine later this month. Nothing yet though.

name: Kim Greller
review: Absolutely deplorable customer service. I made a payment over the phone. The girl put my info in wrong and caused my payment to be late. They not only had the audacity to try and charge interest along with other hidden fees they actually notified the credit bureau for mistakes they themselves made. Extremely unprofessional.  They claimed that they left messages . When I asked "what's my number " they responded with some random phone number that they referred to as my business number. I've worked for the same company for 10yrs and my cell phone number hasn't changed in over 10yrs. They had correct cellphone number but couldn't explain why they didn't call it. They leave you on hold when you ask questions that they should be able to answer. When asked about them notifying the credit bureau of their mistake the girl claimed she'd leave a note with her supervisor.  Could only tell me that all 3 major bureaus are notified every 30 days.  Never had any negative experiences with any other credit cards and the info above is one of 2 negative experiences that I've had with them. Kimberly Greller

name: k2sha2m
review: I trust few credit card companies, maybe just capital one I trust, but also few store credit companies and Nordstrom rewards card is one of them. I have been screwed over and over charged so many times. This company and their card might as well be a scam. I am very disappointed, upset, and was way too trusting of this company and their card services. I should have listened to verbal bad reviews I was getting. Nordstrom you should get your act together with your card services. You do have dissatisfied customers.

name: Joe Ostrowski
review: I have been a TD bank customer for roughly 20 years.   It was my first checking account.  My entire family banks with TD.  1 month ago I lost my wallet and my debit card was used for a multitude of charges and withdraws of 1,300 dollars. On top of it, TD charged me with $140.00 in overdraw fees as well as non ATM charges and maintainence fee for my account being under $100.00 dollars.  I turned the claim into TD fraud department and the came back twice with denials.   They told me the reason was that they could not get in touch with police department.   The process is going through a third time claim. I spoke with a manager Chad from the Mt. Laurel branch and let him know that If this isn’t rectified correctly TD bank will lose not only myself as a customer, but my entire family as well.   It’s really upsetting that I have been banking with this institution my whole life and the one time I have a fraudulent claim they would deny me.  I do not want to submit anonymously, my name is Joe Ostrowski

name: ier80899
review: After placing 3 orders last week, 2 subsequent orders were denied. After several attempts, the credit card was processed for the remaining 2 online orders. A week later, I AGAIN could not process a simple $38 order and when I called as 12:30 am, I disconnected the call after being on hold for 23 minutes - where NO one answered the call yet. Fair enough, I'll try again later.At 11:30 this morning, I tried again... and AGAIN, my order did not go through... and AGAIN, was on hold for 20 minutes. This time, someone finally picked up. She then AGAIN put me on hold for over 5 minutes... and now I'm frustrated. EXTREMELY frustrated as she didn't check in on me... as I no longer want to sit on hold.I was told that with my multiple attempts, the account was flagged as fraud. Really? Why was it flagged after the 3rd order? And if they flagged it, why did they then process the 2 subsequent orders? And then they later decided to re-flag it as fraud AFTER processing the payment? And then NO one contacted me... no emails... no calls. They ALWAYS email me after an order was placed, "We are notifying you that a transaction of $xx.xx posted to your account on xx/xx/2018. Your security is extremely important to us. If for any reason you are unaware of this transaction, please call us at 1.800.935.4202." So why did they NOT contact me after flagging the account for fraud? I wasted an hour of my time to place an online order... where the online order was supposed to save me time from running to the store.This company has HUGE COMMUNICATION PROBLEMS... NOT having enough staff to prevent 20+ minute hold times, NOT coaching the staff to prevent putting me on a NON-brief hold, and NOT telling me that they flagged my account (as they should have called or emailed me.)

name: Clayton
review: To be fair, they company typically has very short wait times for card services; the Anniversary Sale is in July, I’m sure they had increased hold times because of that. I’ve waited far longer than 20 mins for other things at other companies...

name: Hillary Marek
review: OK so each month I pay my balance due in full, but then at the end of the billing cycle they charge interest on the amount you totaled that cycle, regardless of if you paid it off or not. So I have been charged a fee and taken a hit to my credit score because after paying for the TOTAL AMOUNT due, I get a $1 interest fee, and they don't tell you that, so you unknowingly get a late payment fine on your little dollar balance  and now you owe $25. It's happened to me twice now. I'm not sure how they come up with the amount but I wish I could make one payment and trust that I won't get hidden charges. I'm really over it.

name: Gerardine Aka
review: These people are not honest.  I was shopping one day last month at racks when one of the ladies in green persuaded me to apply for a card and get a $40 note within 2-3 business weeks or when my card arrives.  The card came in the mail with no $40 note in it. When I stopped by to inquire about it, it became another rope to pull which was never mentioned when i was applying for the card. I left soo disappointed and with no such $40 note.

name: Ruel Northover
review: I got the card in March and I received my $40 note, not on paper, not in mail, they discontinue this practice. You need to log onto your card account. Nordstrom.com

name: mayankpande
review: They sent me a mail-in offer for 0% apr on purchases for 12 months. After applying online with the customer offer number I was approved but when enquired about the interest charges on my statement they informed that 0% is on balance transfer and unless I can provide the customer number they cannot honor the 0% purchase APR. very shady practice

name: Nancy Tellez
review: Up until now, I'd probably have given this card 4 stars. It does provide good discounts at Target. However, after being a longtime loyal customer, I had a payment issue - my bank account had to be closed and a return payment fee was assessed. After 2 hours of being transferred around, on hold and given varying information, I closed the account out of frustration. Other credit card companies are more accommodating, so I'm done with this one. They don't seem to care about keeping customers.

name: tarachristopher14
review: Thanks for sharing! I have had similar issues, however, I did not feel it was necessary to complain about it on wallethub. You also have a typo on “I’m”.

name: Richard Paguyo
review: If you were on the phone that log, its sounds as though they were trying to get you to someone to resolve the issue.  You appear to be impatient, wanting instant results.  Closing a trade line out of frustration because someone is attempting to help you...maybe you should have taken a breather then called back another time.

name: kennyk89
review: @tarachristopher14 this is a review, you're suppose to share your complaints. Take yourself elsewhere

name: saima_710
review: After having my red card I just made 1purchase.next month when I tried to make online payment for credit card balance,may be there was a mistake,it didn’t work,after 1month I got call from their customer service that they didn’t receive any payment,right there I made my payment over phone.next month I close my target account because of this mistake,as having too many credit card is a hassle and o really don’t need it.after 2months of closing my account they r sending me that I have 100+ due payment with delayed fee.then when I call in their customer service,my account is close already and I didn’t make any other transactions except the first one,for which I already paid total amount over phone.the person said when u made it first payment there was 9$ due,for that 9$ for next 3month with the delayed payment your balance is 103$.What the fuck????I paid total balance over phone and my account is close.now u r telling me that.when I close my account why didn’t you mention it?because I didn’t close my account by myself,I made it with your account manager.then they took out that money from my account when I authorize them.This is totally a injustice for the customer.is it a game?you should cooperate ur customers not just find a way to grab their money......

name: Shalane Pagan
review: I have been having such a hard time with this bank. When I first opened an account, I didn't really understand the overdraft fees, I thought if I put money in the account before the end of the day then I wouldn't get charged overdraft fees but it took two different phone calls for them to finally notify me that their bank is point of service and they'll allow you a few overdrafts a day before declining your card, a service a somehow have ok fine. That's not even why I'm so upset today. So I had gave my landlord a check and asked him not to put it in until the 9th, I even dated it the 9th thinking I was protecting myself. He said it was fine. Somehow I think we had some kind of miscommunication because he cashed it the same day. Me not knowing he did this I was swiping for coffee and diapers basic essentials, thinking I had money in there. I went to pump gas 6 or 7 days later and my card was declined. I told my husband that can't be we had almost $800.00 in there. Well we look at our acct we see that the $1200 check had cleared even though  we had insufficient funds. To make matters worse my husband's check went it and td bank had took it because supposedly  we were negative $900.00. Because of a check that was not suppose to go through. I called customer service extremely hysterical. I explained to them we work paycheck to paycheck,  this is how we feed our 4 kids. That check was not suppose to go through, we dated it the 9th. We're being charged so many overdraft fees and  we didn't even know we were overdrafted. The guy went on to explain that banks no longer do post dated checks so whenever I handed over the check the person I gave it to has the right to cash it, he even have me an attitude for not knowing this. This is something new to me. I explained that to him, I pleaded with him to help us, as our bank please be on the customer side. This is how we feed our kids, pay our bills. We honestly didn't know you couldn't post date checks anymore. He said all he could do is return $35.00. 35 out of almost $800.00. I asked to speak to his manager in a panic and all she could do for me was give me back another 110.00.  For some unknown reason she said we didn't qualify for a full refund. I can't believe that a bank that claims to be all for family, couldn't help this family. I understand that I need to be more aware of policies and I now know more then I did. But I can't believe for not knowing the new policies about posted checks my family is out almost $800.00. I can't believe I only qualified for 140 back. My family is suffering about this and we did not have the support of our bank when  we needed it. I Have people tell me there bank always works with them, meanwhile mines takes from the poor without thinking twice. I'm leaving this bank as soon as I can. I do not recommend this bank. This bank is not who they say they are.

name: maystarr2008
review: WOW, so I'm not sure why everyone seems to be unhappy.  Nov 2016 with fair credit score and a lot of inquiries I decided to take a chance on apply for this card and to my surprise I was approved!  Granted my credit limit was only $300 but oh well I was determined to prove my credit worthiness!  Almost a year later they increased my limit to 1,000 without me asking.  Granted, I made sure to stay low below my limit and pay on time.  Today April 2018 my limit with this company is now is 2,800!  I have never asked them for increase and have stuck to my tactics of keeping a reasonable limit and never paying late.  Needless to say, I love this card!  I only shop online and do my account management online as well. . I have NEVER had any issues with this card or company.  If I have to call Nordstrom's to schedule a return they are most polite and helpful.  Good luck and stay patient.

name: Raj Malik
review: Its service is now worse than any third world government banks. More than an hour wait before i can talk to anyone on their customer service. Not acceptable. Looks like time to move on with al my business accounts to a better bank.

name: Jacque Vander
review: This Nordstrom bank has a lots of scam, and I notice that it is the people who work at this bank, they took your information and charge your card and you couldn’t recognize most of the time. The debit card is the worst, it is debit card suppose you purchase and charge the card with the same day, but it is totally wrong method with their systems, they charge you in the time that you thought already charge and if you don’t clear about the notice, it is like they double charge you and most of the time will confuse consumers, debit card shouldn’t allow them keep charging the same amount as a 3rd party account, the way they told the consumers to open account is totally in different meaning with the real debit cards, this is a terrible way they do business and should find a way to stop them.

name: Leslie Banks
review: Very bad customers service  rude employees  clothes are to high in price Nordstrom  stores looks like thrift  shop I am so  glad I closed  my account  with them I would  never shop at Nordstrom  stores

name: sencha2511
review: I tried to close my accounts and thought everything was settled. Several weeks later, I received a letter saying I had to pay some banking fees, which is weird because I thought I closed my accounts. I went to the bank and discovered a negative balance of $120, an amount which came out of nowhere, plus +$50 service fee. Unbelievable. The staff said they will resolve the matter, and that never happen. Very disappointed. Their ATMS don't work properly either; I tried to withdraw some cash, nothing came out, and guess what? Account balance deducted. Again, they said they'll do an investigation, which didn't happen and will never happen. Worst experience ever. This bank is a fraud.In the end I had to pay them +$170 for nothing. I was such a waste. Seriously, avoid this bank at all cost.

name: cary
review: I like the 3% cash back on dining, but the minimum balance to redeem is 2500 points, and the process takes a lot of clicking around, they don't tell you to the end of it that there is a minimum so all in all its a hassle.  But probably worth it for the restaurant cash back

name: Barry Goldberg
review: TD Bank is an absolutely horrible place to do business. I opened an online account in accord with their policy to get a cash incentive, and never got it. First, trying to get anyone online is a huge hassle. Then, when you get someone you have to tell them the date of your last transaction. WTF??? If you're smart enough to have written it down, or gotten it online or by going into a branch, you still won't get a straight answer as to why you never got the promised cash incentive. Multiple customer service people didn't know, put me on hold forever, hung up on me, and transferred me to nowhere. I never got any of their employee ID numbers—they lied about why they couldn't give that to me. I couldn't get a supervisor. I couldn't even get their location and a name of a supervisor to write to. Going into the bank the people at the desks couldn't help either; they don't handle that, they said. The same happened with my wife opening ann online checking account and not receiving the promised cash incentive. All in all, it was an absolutely horrendous experience. I'm guessing hundreds, if not thousands, of others have had the same experience!

name: an_nhehe
review: I spent more than $500 within the first 3 months, but they only gave me $100 reward, not $200. They said I have to fax them the original offer letter in order to get the other $100 reward that they owe me. WTF? It’s a scam, so I closed my card today. I have Chase Sapphire and Venture One and those two cards gave the rewards that was promised. I will never apply for another TD card again.

name: karenbarrettdesign
review: Card service is not up to Nordstrom standards. #1 The statements provide NO details making it very difficult to match up with receipts, especially when purchasing online - because those charges are randomly dated depending upon when they shipped. Mix in a few brick & mortar store purchases and it becomes chaos! #2 Beware! They apply late fees early. Payments made online clearly indicate the cut-off time, but their office closes ahead of that time and that is when the fee is added to your account. I had to pursue a refund of fees charged even though I paid on time, and at no point did they apologize or acknowledge an error.

name: Wesley Ott
review: Online management is terrible and did not update auto pay and was charged with 90% of the credit limit removed. I payed off the balance immediately and called asked to have the fee removed and credit restored since I have been a customer for 3 years with no issues ever. They refused and did not care at all to keep my business.... Don't let the 5% trick you, their stuff is already marked up.

name: Richard Paguyo
review: Sounds like YOUR online management is terrible!!!

name: lisa
review: richardp_331 I hope you got a life and no longer feel the need to troll the Target Red Card review section on Wallet Hub. Putz

name: Thomas Springfield
review: I lost my job in February 2010 and fell behind in my bills. It took me to July 2011 to find a new job and with a terribly credit score they approved me in 2012 with a $300 limit. It took years before they increased my limit but it was also a difficult time for the banks. In June 2017, they sent me a letter in the mail saying that I would be moved to the MasterCard in August if my account remained in good standing. I really don't care, because I'm an Amex guy now (can't get in as much trouble with a charge card). Still for someone getting back on their feet, this was a good place to start.

name: Anonymous
review: Penalized for paying early!! My due date is the first of every month, so last month I paid it a week early on the 24th. I called and checked my balance to be notified, June payment was "missed" and a payment of $65 was due in July. I spoke to customer service only to be informed that any payment made before the due date, goes as a payment for the previous month's statement and they weren't able to apply it to June.

name: Thomas Springfield
review: Most credit cards are like that, even car loans sometimes. You have to meet her minimum payment per each statement. I would suggest Using their website to monitor your account.

name: Richard Paguyo
review: Well, you screwed that one up!

name: lisa
review: richardp_331 Wow....you really are just sitting there trolling a Wallet Hub review section. What an absolute loser. Lets hope you have better things to do in 2021.

name: Anonymous
review: Penalized for paying early!! My due date is the first of every month, so last month I paid it a week early on the 24th. I called and checked my balance to be notified, June payment was "missed" and a payment of $65 was due in July. I spoke to customer service only to be informed that any payment made before the due date, goes as a payment for the previous month's statement and they weren't able to apply it to June.

name: Anonymous
review: 1.  Real time credit card information (Charges/Payments) is not available.  You can use the card all day long and get an inaccurate amount of how much you charged for the day AND if you made a payment it will not be shown on your balance until the end of the statement cycle.

name: Anonymous
review: I love Nordstrom.  Or should I say, loved.  I have been using the debit rewards program for a few years.  A month ago I was checking out and offered a credit card and so I applied.  I was offered a 5K limit.  This was verbally stated.  I then received the card in the mail with a paper that verified this credit limit.  After using the card for a few weeks earning points to shop in their stores, i.e. using it at the market and for gas, I created an online account.  The account status also verified the credit limit.In six weeks I used almost all of the available credit.  And they did not like that.  They decided to rescind their agreement and without communicating any change occurred they simply cut the credit limit in half which immediately put my account in an over limit status.  They said the limit I was given was a clerical error.  Which is a flat out lie.In my experience businesses who respect their customer or need their customer to return will put their foot where their mouth is.  If they say the fare is $100 and it was a clerical error, they honor it.  But not Nordstrom.   When I make an agreement with someone or something, it means I will keep my word.  And quite frankly, if I do not, the bank would hold me to it until I do.  There is no path for me to force them to keep their word. Therefore this is not a mutual business relationship but a one sided taker relationship.  As far as I understand economics, the 18-22% interest is the risk payoff that they earn to keep their part in this relationship.Presently, there is a manufacturer who is producing a sofa because they thought I had money to order it.  So did I.  Nordstrom decided not to honor their word and they have rescinded the charge a month after it was previously approved.  Since I am a woman of my word, I'm going to have to scramble to pay this manufacturer.I will pay the Nordstrom card off in one lump sum and cut it up never to use their banking or reward system again.  I won't give takers who do not respect their customer my business.  They need to understand that if not for the consumer, they would not exist.  Respect your customer.

name: Anonymous
review: I opened an account with TD when I was in college and got the TD Bank Cash Rewards card.  Several years later, I am now living overseas and it has become an absolute hassle.  Customer Service is useless, I spend 45-60 minutes on the phone with them each time I call only to have my issue still present when I call the next time.  My account is constantly on fraud protection meaning I can never use the card, pretty much rendering it useless.  I can't say enough about how abysmal the customer service is for this card.

name: Anonymous
review: Don't know what happened with Nordstrom - they used to be the best. Now, I can't get a statement sent to me in time to make payment. I tried setting up online billing - still no notification of statement due. Quick to charge late fees, but slow to actually respond to customers to help. DO NOT GET THIS CARD.

name: averyphilly
review: TD Bank, the joke's on you! You want to charge me exorbitant monthly late fees for ONE payment that was a couple days late (of 30 on-time payments), and then you refuse to refund them after my respectful request. Well, I was going to purchase more furniture using credit from TD Bank, but now I won't do that. Kiss all that lovely interest good bye! I hope you are happy with the late fees, which is a fraction of the interest charges you would have seen!

name: Jonathan Zagel
review: 5% at the register is hard to beat, it really is.
