However, please keep in mind how hard you will be working for that 5%, and how inconsistently you'll be receiving it.I have had numerous issues with the card due to various technicalities on my account.  It has taken me an average of 5 phone calls per issue to their customer service account in order to resolve anything.  Yes, that's the AVERAGE number of times I've had to call.  You will definitely be on hold, the first person will definitely not be able to help you, if they can even access your account, and there's somewhere between a 25% and 45% chance that the call will end abruptly when their servicer hangs up on you.Specifically, they have an extraordinarily difficult time receiving direct payments from my bank, which is a major international bank, not some small obscure credit union no one has ever heard of, which has resulted in payments not posting and me being charged interest and fees even though my initial attempts at payment have been well before the payment deadlines.  I know this because they opened my account at a pathetically small credit limit, so I have to pay it off multiple times a month in order to keep the card operating.  The worst part about that is when I call them to request a change to the limit, they direct me back to website where there's a one-box submit form where you update your annual income.  As far as I know, I might as well be writing my annual income down on a piece of paper and throwing that paper directly into the garbage rather than wasting my increasingly limited amount of hope that some human somewhere is actually going to receive the request.So, I'm going back to paper statements, paper checks, and the acceptance that the 5% at the register discount will work probably no more than half the time I'm there.  So, go ahead and get the card, just be sure to have your back-up ready, because you can bet they won't bother contacting you if there are any issues such that your card isn't going to work.

name: Joaquin Rivera
review: I just applied for the target red card and I just love it I was approved for 300 dollars 650 EQ score so far very happy

name: Diane  Wishart
review: I've had the Target card for over 20 years and received one increase within the first five years. Nothing else since then and never been late on a payment.

name: marthadngo
review: RedCard has security hole in the approval procees?- Here is my case, someone apply for a RedCard under my brother name but using my address. My brother lives in another city. The card sent to my address. I asked my brother if he applied for the card. said no he did not apply for it. He did not have a chance to call the company since he is not around. A few weeks later I got a monthly statement from this REDcard and the balance is $976.xx (the credit line is $1000). My question is how this person can use the card while its not activated?

name: margiesims000
review: When you apply online, for the card. If instantly approved you can begin using the approved credit line imediatly.  I'm guessing whomever opened the account did just that.

name: Shane Breeman
review: I'll pre face this with that I completely love Target as a company but the company that services the Red Card is crap. I bank with an online company called Simple and they switched account numbers and I didn't realize I didn't update my Target one until I went to make the payment for this month. Needless to say I was surprised by a return check fee and called them to see if they could help me out in this situation. They refused and were incredibly rude about it. I've worked for multiple credit card companies (Citi for a long time)  and this is the first time I've seen a company unwilling to help a customer out for an honest error. Same thing happened with my Walmart card and they were more then generous enough to help me out with the fee's that incurred.

name: Richard Paguyo
review: Yes, YOU didn't update properly...and with Walmart too?!!  SMH

name: val_reilly
review: They caved to the liberal left.  I canceled my card today since they announced the discontinuation of Ivanka Trump line.  They say it's declining numbers but they started decreasing the availability of items in the store back in Dec.  It's called Corporate Bullying.  Completely political.  who else have they discontinued and written a press release about. It's perfect that Tom Brady took so much grief from the left because of a MAGA hat in his locker(for goodness sakes) ....and ends up a Super Bowl Winner, AGAIN.  I will vote with my feet.  No more NORDSTOM. Winners are Tom Brady and EBAY selling the hell out of Ivan's line now!

name: abcdial
review: Horrible customer service! They have a treat the customer like cattle policy, Lined with disrespectful overtones it is really uncomfortable. One thing I have encountered on more than one occasion is they process a late fee on your due date! So if you pay the payment on the actual due date they will still attempt to collect a late fee! Have also had other issue's with them. I have 100% payment history on all my bills... I do not recommend them..

name: Richard Paguyo
review: Take responsibility for your actions.  You probably paid your account on the due date AFTER the CST cutoff!

name: jas_hen
review: Target did not send my first statement until my payment was late. I paid only the $39 that I originally charged and I called to ask if I could have the penalty abated. Target refused to credit my account for a penalty that was not my fault.  My most recent statement shows that my current account balance is about $250.  This is $250 of pure penalties and interest.  This has wrecked my credit, but I will not give in. Let's see who will give in first. I will never shop there again.

name: Richard Paguyo
review: Its WAS your fault!  YOU know you have an account, you're even savvy enough to post here online.  Is it so hard to take a minute  (literally 60 seconds) to check your account twice a month to ensure all is well?

name: K Erons
review: I've had nothing but problems with my TDBank business checking account. This is only the latest example. I am forced to make my business's deposits by mail because 1) the closest branch to me is >3 hrs away since I moved, and 2) their mobile deposit ceiling is only $5k, which I can't imagine works for most businesses and certainly not mine. I sent a large check to their deposit by mail facility in Lewiston ME on Wednesday, and according to USPS tracking TDBank picked it up yesterday (Friday) at 7 am. By afternoon it was still not showing in my account. I called before 4 pm to ask why. All I got from the first CS and his supervisor was "We have no way to check that." They didn't even know how to contact the bank by mail division. On the 2nd escalation, to Anthony on the "Leadership Team" in Maine, I finally learned that bank by mail deposits are processed overnight, so it wasn't unusual that it wasn't showing up in my account. By that time, it was past 5 and there was no way to call that department and verify the check was actually there & not lost, but Anthony assured me I'd see the deposit in my account by this morning. I had been on the phone with TDBank CS for almost 2 hours at that point. Well, overnight is now over and I still have no deposit. So that excuse is now gone. 3 weeks prior to this, I'd mailed a separate large deposit to TDBank's Morganton, NC branch. They lost that one. This is a total of over $55k in deposits lost by TDBank in 3 weeks. I don't even know what to do at this point. I am not spending another hour or multiple hours dealing with their customer service line and the people there who don't even know how the bank works. Processing deposits is one of the most basic, essential functions any bank makes. How on earth can they not get this right, and who do I have to speak with to get this straightened out??? This isn't something I should have to worry about for so much as a second, and yet I do. Apparently I have no way of being sure that a mailed deposit will actually make it into my account. To say that's alarming is the understatement of the year.

name: aisel
review: THE WORST BANK EVERWorst costumer service I have ever received, what one says is different from others. My biggest mistake was to open a credit card with them because the branch manager lied to me that they have the best balance transfer for 4%, meanwhile all other banks had it lower then that, like Chase 2%, Bank of America 3%, etcetera. The craziest thing is that they do not have 0% APR for the first year of opening the credit card like every other credit card in the world. I have very good credit and the best they could do was 18%APR meanwhile the max others offered me was 12%APR. I don't want to write more about them and lose my time, but STAY AWAY FROM TD BANK. There were so many bad experiences with this bank that now I love and appreciate every other credit card and their costumer service, rates, quality, fees and everything else they offer that TD Bank does not.

name: Mike Carter
review: I been using TD bank for about 2 years now and it is a very great bank to use.I tried this bank after using bank america and the time there really didn't fit my needs.I needed a credit card that will help me to fix my debt that i had and at the same time build my credit back to good standards.This card did just that my allowing me to get a good credit line on my card and trusted me to be responsible and it was a great deal that really help me.I highly recommend TD bank first class credit card.

name: Kersten Pietrowski
review: As a longtime Nordstrom Visa card holder I would strongly suggest this as a secondary card. Not a main credit card. I have had several issues with it not being dependable regardless of it being paid off etc. They didn't notify me when they knew I had a chip malfunction. I found out when I was trying to buy groceries. They had known and sent me a new card out but never informed me. I was shocked that I never was contacted about this and was thankful I had a back up card! I travel a lot and need a dependable credit card and this is not it. On another note there  are many cards out there that give much better rewards as well. Do your research as to what is best for your needs.

name: Ben Shaver
review: I had to call them for a bill almost 60 days after receiving this card. They said I had finance charges and late fees. They had my address wrong and would not waive any fees. I cancelled the card and 90 days later I get another bill for 3 months of late charges. Apparently they posted that payment late and another late charge was required. So all said and done I paid over $200 for the opportunity to have their card. I would advise against it, get a credit card like capital one with points and have them send you target gift cards instead. Their customer service is actually worse than Time Warner

name: Richard Paguyo
review: Read my post above!!!  You must not care about your FICO scores based on your post.  So your method of account management is; "If I don't receive a bill for the charges I made, I don't pay!"

name: Chanel Guzman
review: Refused to return late fees after being lied to about auto pay set up. That's not good customer service Target. Keep your card.

name: Richard Paguyo
review: Targets AutoPay system is pretty SOLID!!!  Sounds like you're the liar here!

name: Tommy B.
review: In the beginning its 5% cash back which is amazing. Put massive amounts of money on it and got some nice kick backs. There was also a promo if you spent $500 your first 3 months or something you earned $100. Not entirely sure if that was time limited and no longer applies or not. Great card, have had no issues at all. TD is usually very helpful so I am not worried about dealing with issues in the future.

name: Tina Ross Earl
review: Racist company need to be close down

name: Yan Clark
review: I have 736 credit score, never failed applying any credit card. But with their agency SageStream, my score is low as 408. Excuse me???

name: Laura Skinner
review: i have been charged late fees for four months because i was lied to when i signed up for this card and NO ONE has been even remotely helpful in getting this resolved.  based on the one star reviews elsewhere online i am guessing this is a paid site with tons of fake reviews.  good work target/td bank.  youve lost a significant customer

name: Richard Paguyo
review: Late fees for four months and you're posting on Wallet Hub?!!  Do you even read the suggestions on how to improve your credit here on this website?!!

name: Francine Waskiewicz
review: Target Red Card has gone overboard in their security measures. Everyone in your family has to have an individual account number.  Red Card is able to tie the purchases together onto a single bill, but when you attempt to return an item, and you do not have the specific card the purchase was made from, they are unable to return an item and credit your account.This is painful when I try to return an item which my wife purchased through her card.  It's not worth the 5%, when you end up losing money on a return.Red Card - You really need to THINK about customer service.

name: Richard Paguyo
review: Target customer service can easily locate purchases made within 90 days of return, even with multiple card holders on your account.  After that it drops out of their system.

name: Tuli Lou
review: As a college student, credit cards are sort of "scary" and confusing to me, but I think this one is really working well! I like how there's no fees, and since I travel the low foreign transaction fee is great too.

name: Wendy Byers
review: I love my Target card I always shop there for deals and  by using my card I get an extra 5% percent off.  Money saved means money in my pockets. Forever loyal to Target.  Great customer service and are very helpful.

name: Ella Lee
review: What I really love about the Target RedCard is that I save so much money. I can order things online easily and have them shipped to my house for free, on any purchase. They do not have a minimum purchase amount to receive the free shipping which is spectacular. I also save 5% on every purchase that I make, either online or in-store. It is so easy to use the RedCard, and it saves me money on great merchandise from Target.

name: Patrick Roebuck
review: I really love my Target credit card. The credit card offers all the benefits and ease of use as any credit card I have ever had, but it also has the added incentive of getting a 5% discount at Target stores and online. And any issue I have with my account or purchases is quickly and professionally resolved with their great customer service. I highly recommend this credit card. 4 Stars.

name: DennisPt
review: I love to use my Target card when I go to the store or use online. One of the main reasons why I use it is for the 5% discount. If I find an item that I like online or at other stores, I check to see if it is the same price at Target - if it is I use this card and get it for 5% cheaper!

name: Coupon Saver
review: It was very easy to apply in store and I was accepted right away. It was smooth and simple to get the card. I just filled out all my information and the manager came over and entered it into a computer and was able to give me a card right there at the store. It was great and I also got a 10% off coupon which was nice as well.

name: Danielle Jude
review: I have had an account at TD Bank for over 2 years, and have only had one problem. The teller deposited my paycheck into someone else's account by mistake.  As a result, I overdrew my account because I thought the money was in there.  I understand errors happen, but no one seemed to want to take responsibility for it.  The manager was able to get my money credited to my account about 3 days later, and agreed to refund my fees.  In the end, the problem was solved, but it could have been done so more quickly.  It was very frustrating having my funds in limbo for those few days.

name: Kosmo Alves
review: I Love the credit card Great store

name: Lisa Gorman
review: Which store us your favorite I love the Seattle store

name: Bren Sim
review: I am a level 4 member and for the last few years I feel the "points" have been less and less.  Also, say you buy items on a tripe point or 10 point day, well the points don't process through that day if you buy an item that is online rather a few days later and I question if I am getting those points or not.  When I ask or call Nordstrom Card Services they are NOT helpful at all-AND I'M A LEVEL 4!!  Nordstrom, you need to start making sure points are going through they EXACT day you are buying items not "update" at a later time.  I think they are not giving me points I deserve and due to this, I may not be a shopper anymore.

name: Jay Narayan
review: My rate is 8.00 percent and I have used in repo India Singapore etc

name: Stephen Moore
review: Im embarrassed to own this card. My annual income is $140k and my credit is 750's. I've been a member for over 10 years and never missed a payment. Every year I call to get a credit increase and I always get the same answer, it's done automatically. MY LIMIT IS ONLY $1,000!!!!! ARE YOU EFFING KIDDING ME?!?!?! EFF THEM!

name: Tina Ross Earl
review: Well it's better than nothing  but a,credit score like you have it should be more and a member  over 10 years that's crazy

name: Frank Spellman
review: I've had the card about a year and mine is 1300 always pay before its due and you will get in increase sooner

name: Richard Paguyo
review: This is a store card, not a bank card!!!  If you've gone over limit, paid passed the date date (not missed, but late in Targets eyes), or don't use it regularly then why increase your credit line?!!  So what $140K, I know people who use their card once or twice a month, make much LESS than you, and their credit line is FIVE times yours!!!

name: Taylor Jacobs
review: I wanted to write my review because I have been with TD Bank for going on 5 years and they have been exceptional. I thought they had an extremely easy application process and Customer Service was amazing. Only issue I had was wait times for Customer Support as sometimes it can be as long as 30 minutes. But over all a really great bank I truly recommend.

name: Keisha Pollard
review: As a young adult, I have found this checking account to be very useful and convenient for my needs. There is no minimum balance, and although they do take a monthly fee, it is very small in comparison to other banks. I have not had any issues with this bank - which I found refreshing. The access to online banking is also very convenient and I have utilized it daily since being offered it. I also like that I did not have to open a savings account, but I am able to when I feel financially comfortable. Definitely a great bank, no real complaints!

name: Sai Vang
review: We use the Target credit card all the time. We are frequent shoppers at Target. We usually like to combine our coupons, the Target mobile app and the Cartwheel app to maximize our savings. We generally save 5% on our purchases. This is a must-have card for anyone that is looking to maximize their dollar. It is very easy to set up and you can have another person on your card.

name: Rodney Williams
review: I am such a huge fan of TB  Bank in general. I had a Checking Account and it was going on around 5 years when I decided I wanted to start a savings and after procrastinating on it a few days I called customer support and they were amazing. I quickly and easily set it up directly online.  The interest rate is amazing and the customer support is top of the line. I would never switch banks as they have been amazing to me. The only down side was the time it takes for transfers or deposits to hit but with that being the only drawback it still makes them a perfect choice for savings.

name: kingfelix
review: How can you say the interest rate is amazing when it's below national average AND there's a $15/month fee apparently. Are you sure your review is for the Select Savings account?

name: jamars1
review: TD banks has the worst customer service. I called and spoke with a representative to ask about my CD account. After I gave them information to verify myself They told me they could not share any information on the phone. After a couple of questions asked, they gave me false information on my account. I asked to speak to a manager,Tony, who told me he could not help me .He then told me to go to a branch location but I live in a state now where there are no TD bank branches in or around the state of Arkansas. Now I can't get access or information on my account unless I fly across the country. Don't waste your time doing business with this bank.I would not do any business with a bank that lies and tell me false information

name: Temika Rafford
review: I switched to TD Bank from a credit union last year and I have been very impressed with their customer service when it comes to my checking account. They actually care about banking problems you may have and come up with a resolution that day. For example, I had my account information hacked into and they immediately closed my account, made me a new account, gave me my money back, and I also received a debit card all in the same day! Exemplary customer service!

name: Jen Buller
review: I have had my Target Redcard for about 8 years now and don't really use it as much as I once did. The only perk that you seem to get is a 5% discount, I can save just as much by using certain coupons at other stores than the 5% will get me. The free shipping isn't really that great of a deal either because a lot of the times Target is running a special/sale to get free shipping anyway. I will still use the card on occasion but I will say I have seen better offers through other store cards.

name: Andrew Mahabir
review: Amazing bank who puts their customers first. They have extended hours so you can whenever is convenient for your schedule. You don't have to rush to the bank trying to make it before they close. They're even open on Sunday which is pretty cool. Sometimes, that's the only day I'm free to go and other banks don't offer the same option. Aside from the long hours, they also have amazing customer service. If you have any problems with your account, they will give you their 100% time, energy and focus on working to get it fixed to your liking. They don't rest until you are satisfied.

name: Taz Joao Teixeira
review: I got approved for a card and it's been 20 business days and still haven't received it yet. Highly pissed off. They had told me they mailed it but now they're giving me the runaround. Hate these bastards. Poor business.

name: Tina Ross Earl
review: I hope you got your card  I guess Target doesn't want your business

name: Richard Paguyo
review: How can you be certain its Target's fault?!!  Do you have a community mailbox?

name: Paul Annich
review: Have enjoyed this account for years without any hassles. Interest rates are so low its not worth keeping money in an account just to earn such small interest its more of a headache at tax time. The monthly fee is worth it given that I don't need to have a set amount in the account all I need to worry about is covering the checks I write. The Debit card can be used anywhere as either a debit or credit and I use it on all my transactions. I also use the automated online bill paying and have never had any issues. TD Bank is a solid reliable bank and this account does what its intended and is backed by reliable, professional customer support. The fee is a little high which is the only reason I didn't write a 5 star review. This is the only bank for me.

name: Rachel Johnson
review: I have been using the Target RedCard four 5 years now and really have no complaints.  With a constant 5% off every purchase it is definitely a must have. I have also really enjoyed shopping online with my card, I still get the 5% discount and also free shipping and have never had an issue with this.  The only thing to be careful of would be the late charge.  Before I set up easy auto pay online I forgot a payment by one day and ended up paying $25 for this mistake, my own fault of course but goodness!

name: Richard Paguyo
review: I love it when people take responsibility for their actions!  Yes, please be careful =)

name: Kelly
review: Richard you are one lifeless individual.... you my friend have wayyyyyyyyy to much time on your hands to be responding to everyones issues!!! How miserable!!! GET A LIFE!!!

name: Fee Tree
review: I like this card.  I use it whenever I shop at Nordstrom so that I can get rewards.  You can earn Nordstrom Notes pretty quickly if you shop there often.  It is easy to get approved as you can do the whole process online.  You can use the card instantly to shop online if you are approved.  You don't have to wait for it in the mail as they save the details to your Nordstrom account online.  I thought that was a nice touch and made using the card more convenient.

name: Lanae King
review: I've been using TD Bank for about two years, after I moved to Boston. Once or twice I ran into problems with high overdraft fees that piled up quickly over a few days, and once I called, the customer service representative easily helped me sort it out. Their fees are somewhat inconvenient, but at least they're relatively easy to fix. I do wish they had more locations in other parts of the country.

name: AlcoaTN
review: TD Bank was my first "adult" bank that I opened when I got my first job at 16. The customer service was extremely friendly and helpful in opening an account. They didn't tell me about overdraft protection, so I got charged $35 a few times for going over. Once I turned that off I had no problems. The online layout is good, online support answers questions in a timely matter, and the locations are convenient. When I moved to a different state, however, I found it difficult to find a branch around me so I mostly use the online portal and mobile app check deposit.

name: jessy
review: I opened a savings account with TD Bank a few months ago and I must say I am fairly happy with the overall service.It does not require a monthly fee. As long as I have a minimum amount transferred from my checking account, which is extremely convenient. On top of the money I want to save an automatic sum also goes into the account. It helps my money grow at a reasonable speed. The customer service reps are very friendly as well.There was one time when I did have  an issue with my deposit that did not go through. I was charged the maintenance fee. However after being on the phone with them for about five minutes they realized it was their mistake and they quickly resolved the issue by refunding me. Great bank and I love having a savings account.

name: jessy
review: I recently opened a checking account with TD bank and I would like to say its been pretty good so far.  I am disappointed in the fact that there is a monthly fee of 5.99. Which is small but it still should be free. I have my checks direct deposit every week and considering this it should be free. I do all of my banking online and thus far its been great.everything is set up to be withdrawn automatically and it will normally go through a few days later which works out since at times there is no money in the account. So I can determine how many days I have until its withdrawn. If there is ever an issue i can usually call them and i have hardly any wait times and problem is usually resolved quickly. Only other thing is that there are not many locations in my area so I have to go to the same bank before I go anywhere for the day. I do know that everyone has their own experiences but mine have been pleasant! I will keep this bank account for now.

name: Laura Dely
review: I noticed this week that customers were using their "chip-enabled" bank cards, but when I got to the checkout cashier, I discovered that "security" feature isn't available on Red Cards, WHICH STILL HAVE TO BE SWIPED. It's unbelievable, after Target not only had the GIANT SECURITY BREECH against customers who swiped their bank cards in store, (and that it tried to hide for months,) that Taget has not yet issued chip-enabled Red Cards to all card holders.  It's especially dumb after upgrading your in store card readers.Target has proved again that it is untrustworthy, and it cares only superficially about it customers.

name: Richard Paguyo
review: Change takes time.  In fact Target is one of the few who uses chip and PIN, the highest security available here in the U.S.!

name: Test User
review: Target is my absolute favorite store, not only because of their prices, but also because of their great savings opportunities. This card is great because it gives an automatic 5% savings every time I use it. That's on top of the Target coupons available (which I can double up with manufacturers' coupons) and the Cartwheel App. I shop there at least once a week, and since I would be spending that money anyway, it made sense to me to get that extra savings. The only issue would be the interest rate, which is higher than my other credit cards, like Discover. But I use the card, then pay off the balance every month with the money I would use for groceries anyway. That way I get the savings plus free shipping, which is awesome. Definitely worth it!

name: Laura A C
review: I had been banking with TD Bank since it was Commerce Bank about 10-15 years ago.  I was with them as a customer from roughly 2001 through 2012.  I found the bank to be less than satisfactory.  To begin with, as a student (which I was until 2008) I apparently was entitled to completely free checking with no overdraft fees or any other fees.  It was only after TD Bank had charged me over $1200 in fees over a 6 year period did I find out this little known tidbit.  When I inquired about a refund or credit for all the fees I accrued but should not have been charged for they told me it was my fault that I didn't know about the student checking.  I then proceeded to pull all my money from TD Bank as I found another bank that was more to my liking.  Nearly 2 years after I "closed" my account, I got a bill from a bill collector saying that I owed TD Bank $345 in fees due to not having the minimum balance in my account.  It became obvious very quickly to me that the representative that had "closed" my account in fact never "closed" it but actually left it open for nearly 2 years after I had removed all the money.  Would not bank with TD again.   Customer service was horrible, a lot of unclear fees and disclosures.

name: Brandy Coffin
review: Saving 5 percent isn't even worth it.   There customer service completely sucks.  The card originally got sent to the wrong address so I call to update the address with no issue, or so I thought.  Only to receive a voicemail a couple days later telling me I have to verify the address.  I call the number they provided in the voicemail only for the computer operated voice  asking me for my entire card number in order to process my call.  HELLO!  how would I have that if I never received a card in the first place!  So I google to find the correct number to call.  I get someone on the phone and of course the customer service rep was very short with me and when I said hold on I have to get my drivers license he rudely says, "helloooo" which at that point my blood was boiling.  Seriously I shouldn't have to go through such hell to update my address.   Then they want everything down to the last 4 digits of your drivers license to verify.  Don't bother getting this card.   As soon as its paid off I am closing the account and shredding the card.

name: Richard Paguyo
review: Wow!!! You are a spoiled little child.

name: annie liu
review: I love TD bank compares the other banks that I have and had accounts with. They have so many locations, friendly staffs, opens 7 days a week, this bank made my life easier when it comes to banking. It's easy to qualify for a no fee account, and there are so many options for me to pick from. The only thing I don't like is the wait at the bank, no matter what hours and which locations I go to, there's always a line... That is the only thing I don't like, but over all, I would highly recommend it because it's a very reasonable and reputable bank.

name: Andrea
review: I cannot say enough about how great my TD bank savings account has been. I previously had the student savings account which was great while I was a college student. Now that I am over 24, I was switched to the simple savings account. This account is very convenient and easy to use. The account has a monthly fee of $5 which is very low. However, they will also waive the $5 fee if you maintain a monthly balance of only $300. I think this is a great savings account they have for young people right out of college who may not have the best jobs or cannot save a lot of money. They also have very convenient hours and locations so it is easily accessible.

name: Jenny Mobley
review: I have used my Target Credit Card for several years now.  The interest rate that they gave me when I first signed up was great.  Usually I am a little iffy of credit cards, but this one has a great interest rate and my payments are very affordable each month.  Target's customer service is also excellent.  On the few occasions that I had a question, they answered me with no problem at all.

name: Joe Forte
review: I've had my TD student checking account since 2011, and I've only had positive experiences. The benefits the account offers, such as no minimum balance or fees, and over draft protection, are fantastic. However, what TD truly excels at is customer service. I've called their customer service center many times over the past four years, and I've never once been frustrated, and my problem has always been resolved within a few minutes of speaking to a representative. I would definitely recommend TD to any student!

name: Joe Costello
review: I have had my main checking and savings accounts with TD bank for about 5 years.  I can't say that their products are really any different or better than any other large bank, but that doesn't mean I'm not completely satisfied with my accounts.  TD makes it easy to manage my checking/savings accounts by allowing me to link them.  I also earn industry standard interest on my accounts.  TD does, however, have the best customer service of any bank I have a relationship with.  It doesn't matter whether I'm in-branch, on the phone, or their website/app, the support is always friendly, efficient, and very helpful.  I have never had any issues with any of my accounts that weren't solved quickly.

name: Erica Pittman
review: I am a huge fan of TD Bank. The hours of operation are great--I love that they stay open until 7 on most days and are open on Sundays as well. They really are one of the most convenient banks out there. I'ts not just the hours that make it convenient. I can be quite irresponsible and frequently lose my debit card. I love that they have on the spot debit card replacement, and the process only takes about 10 minutes. That's much more convenient than having to wait a week for a new card in the mail like other banks.The mobile app is great as well. I love that I can make mobile deposits now!I've never had a bad experience at TD bank. The tellers have all been very friendly. I usually go to the same branch (94th Street and Broadway, NY,NY) know pretty much all of the tellers there. When we run into each other on the street they even say hello! If I have questions about my accounts or notices I have received in the mail, I bring them in and they have no problem with explaining them to me very clearly. I've never been surprised by any hidden fees because it's always clearly noted either on the notices, app, emails, or in person by the teller. TD has great communication with its customers.They're also family friendly (which isn't so important for a bank, but it is nice). Whenever I have to bring my little sister, they give her TD packaged crayons and coloring pages. You also can't beat the free lollipops. The dog biscuits and water bowls are a cute idea too. I'm happy I have TD Bank. I have both a checking and savings account with them and don't plan on switching banks any time soon.

name: Marc simpson
review: I have been with many banks in my life some good, some bad. But TD bank is by far one of the best banks i have ever had. first of all they have accounts that allow you to link with your savings with your checking which is very convenient. It also helps you save! How do you ask? well this savings account links with your debit card and reward you with money every time you used your debit card. Having this account is a no-brainer, who would not want an account where u can actually save money as you make purchases. This account also has top notch security so it is very safe. the best part about td bank is that they are open late and open 7 days a week, what more could you ask for in a bank? Overall i give my experience with this bank 5 stars

name: virginia hatchett
review: It may just be the branch in my town, but every time I visit the branch, it always takes me so long to do anything. I cannot stand that there is a limit at the ATM, if  I want to withdraw cash. Also, lots of fees! Other banks that I've used before usually have exceptions that are easy to meet in order to avoid fees - TD's are insane! I don't think I would ever recommend anyone to this bank. The only nice thing is their pens, and that they give out Dog Treats in the drive through. They do tend to have convenient hours - but because I mainly use the ATM, I find it to be very frustrating when I don't have access to my money.

name: Pamela
review: This card is very convenient!  It is one of my favorite credit cards to use.  And Target is one of my favorite stores.  Something I don't like about the card, though, is the high percentage rate.  That's why I try to pay off my balance so I do not have to deal with the 22.9% rate.  I like the 5% reward that is offered by the card...that is a major plus and is an incentive to use it.

name: Justin Graham
review: Having already opened a checking account at TD Bank, I decided for convenience that I would open a Savings Account there as well. They have a multitude of locations in my area so it was beneficial to choose them for my bank. They required a low minimum and low balance to open the account and maintain it with no fees. That was a bonus as some other banks required a higher minimum to keep an account with them. They were also able to set up an automatic transfer from my checking to savings account to save money from each paycheck. Their convenience and easy website/phone application make keeping up with your balance a breeze.

name: Aneece K
review: I Would like to know if there's a fee to switching to an interest account or a savings account.And I would like to know if my deposits can earn interest on a daily or monthly basis. I have been a loyal customer for over 15 years and I appreciate everything  you guys are doing especially your prompt response when I ask question online .Thank you for your time.

name: Aneece K
review: I really like their updated security procedures. I mostly use my TD bank account via Internet log in, and recently they asked me to change my username. While I was In Europe recently, I bought another plane ticket online and it was declined. I quickly called from overseas and the matter was  resolved quickly. At one point, I never thought that was going to purchase that plane ticket, but because they needed to verify whether or not it was actual me who is making the purchase. I was really satisfied, I've been with TD Bank over thirteen years, since it was called Commerce bank in New Jersey.

name: Karl Michael
review: I had a great experience banking with TD bank. The girls that worked in there were very nice and actually remembered who I was when I went in, unlike some other banks I used in the past. They remembered the things we talked about and almost always knew what I needed when I went in, before I even asked. I had student checking which made it so I payed no fees or maintenance costs on my account. Their ATM was the first in the area that I could put cash into rather than using a drop box envelope system! They were always willing to work with me whenever I had large deposits to make, and were able to take care of overdrafts the couple of times it happened. Would recommend.

name: andrew
review: I've been using TD bank since I lived in New Jersey. It's an amazing bank with awesome customer service. This has been the best bank I've used, ever. They have long hours and are open on the weekend so you don't have to worry about rushing to make the bank. They're always open. When you walk into a branch, you're greeted right away and you just feel welcome. They help you with anything you need. Any problem I've ever had, they resolved it. I got charged an overdraft fee because someone double charged my account, I called them and they fixed it right away, no questions asked. I could've lied and made two of the exact same purchases. They didn't question anything. They reversed the fees and the double charge amount promptly. All in all, you can't ask for a better bank. Great service with long hours so they are truely there when you need them.

name: Alice Rusher
review: I can't write a review about what I don't like about the offer when I think that the credit department at Target is one of the best out there. They are understanding they give their customers a chance over an over again. They work with you if times get tough and they always treat you with politeness and professionalism. I no longer have this card nor any others but if I were to have one again this would surely be my first choice. It's a great store, a great card, and a great staff. Thank you, Target!

name: Justin Graham
review: I made a purchase using a debit card which was tied into my checking account. When the salesperson ran the total through they added an extra five hundred dollars on by accident. I immediately called my bank and was told that it would take a few days to rectify. It was frustrating because they could see the seller canceled the transaction and that it was a large amount of money to take out of my account with nothing in return.

name: Jane Gasch
review: I have had a checking account with TD for a couple of years now. I find them to always be helpful. My only complaint is that if you incur fees of any kind they seem to be non-negotiable in waiving them. The fees are also rather high, and they always re-order the transactions hoping that you will overdraw and that it will result in more fees (for example, if on Monday you make 4 small debit card transactions for which you have the money, and on Wednesday a check is drawn against your account for $800-even if you have $799 in your account they will put the largest transaction through first-so then all 4 small debit card transactions are considered overdrafts and incur large fees-it doesn't matter which order you perform the transactions in). However, if you are mindful of the balance this shouldn't be a problem. I like that once can use their ATMs to deposit cash without a deposit slip, that feature is very convenient, as is their free coin counter machine. Overall, though, I've been very pleased with their customer service and products.

name: Michael Jacobson
review: This card is terrible.  I have a 700 CC and have a 6 figure income...they approved me for $500.  I laughed at the guy and told him to close the account.  This experience has turned me off from Nordstrom as a whole company.  It sounds like there trying to hammer customers on interest rates.  I recommend going through a outside credit card company.  Needless to say i won't be doing business with them anymore.

name: Rigoberto Morales Peña
review: did you call their credit department and ask to speak to an underwriter and let him know that the credit card limit they pre selected is not enough. Then they will ask you a couple of question and go through you credit report and see if they can accommodate you with me or based on your report that's all you qualify for.

name: Kyle C
review: I have had a good experience with TD Bank. This is one of two checking accounts I have, the other being with another bank. There are occasions where I am tempted to simplify things and close one of my checking accounts down but I enjoy the customer service I get from TD Bank and that it makes me thinking twice about closing. The fees can be a bit annoying, especially the monthly maintenance fee. But, again, the attention I get from my bank makes it worth it.

name: Carleen maranville
review: We have been using TD Bank for several years now. I have always been pleased with their service, the tellers are friendly, our statements are accurate, and I love to go through the drive thru with my grandchildren because the tellers give the kids lollipops. Recently I had an issue with a product I had ordered online, the company had charged me twice for the transaction. I tried to resolve the issue with the company I'd ordered the product from but they were unable or unwilling to help. My husband suggested I contact the bank. I went in with my paper work and spoke to a customer service representative. She immediately put me at ease and within a short period of time she had resolved the issue. The customer service I received was wonderful. I am quite sure we will be customers of TD Bank for a very long time.

name: Kyle C
review: I first found TD Bank through my TD Ameritrade investing account. I was kind of shocked that they had a bank branch but this became a pleasant surprise. TD Bank is a legitimate institution that values its customers and makes the banking process as simple and streamlined as possible. The bank offers quality customer support that helps me understand what is happening with my account at any given moment but also gives me ideas on how to plan for my future. I love the fact that I can link my account to my TD Ameritrade account. I would highly recommend TD Bank to any looking for a new bank.

name: Joe Rainer
review: The Target Red Card is simply a no brainier if you shop at Target. Compared to a lot of other store cards, you actually get continuing awards in the form of 5% off everything instead of a onetime signup bonus. Now my one issue with this card is the credit limits they bestow, and the limits are some of the worst I have seen. For instance I received a 300 dollar limit while on other cards I have close to 8,000. Anyhow, besides the limit issue this card is still a good option if you shop at Target. And of course make sure you pay off this card ASAP. Store cards should be used as a charge card (pay entire balance cards) due to high APR.

name: Anna
review: I have this account for a couple of years already. First I had my personal checking account there. Now I also have a business account with them. I like that they work on Sundays, sometimes it is the only day I have time to go there. There are two things I am not really happy with. First, there are not a lot of TD banks near me. So sometimes I have to drive for 15-20 min. Plus the parking is always an issue there. Sometimes I have to park in front of the other store and then walk to the bank.But in general I am satisfied with this bank and with their customer service.

name: Alex Sarria
review: I love using my Target Credit Card for all of my in-store and online purchases.  The 5% discount is especially great when making big purchases on many of their sale items.  The APR is a little high compared to other credit cards, but I always pay off the card in store whenever I visit the store.  It is also a great benefit that local schools get a benefit from the purchases as well.

name: Lu Jackson
review: Great card, but again, I don't like to use it because the APR is so high.  Like that they give back to local schools but clearly I'm paying for it with that high ARP.  Appreciate the 5% off my purchase too that is a big bonus that makes it comparable Walmart prices.

name: Michael Ketschek
review: Closed account today. TD Banks ATM in the front of the building ate my debit card while depositing money after hours to avoid overdrafting my account. The toll free number said the branch will handle it. This was Friday night and I knew I would be unable to get to get to the branch during business hours for a few days because of work. I go in to straighten it out and the lady I sat with REFUSED to waive my two overdraft charges of $35 each. The higher up also refused. I was then told, in front of other customers, if I refused to pay it will negatively affect my credit score. It was a completely demeaning experience. The KGB like atmosphere at this branch was a far cry from the "bank human again" commercials on radio and television. I'm extremely disappointed because I feel like my family bought into that and we were duped. Don't be fooled.

name: Rosetta Powell
review: I personally have this Target Red Card, and while it has advantages of 5% off purchases which you can combine with coupons and other discounts, the interest rate charged is very, very high.  The only way I would suggest you get this card is if you are very disciplined in paying off your balance as soon as you make a purchase with it.  In other words, go straight to the service desk and pay the balance immediately.  That way you will never be charged that rate of interest which would completely wipe out any savings you may have received. Also, if you carry a balance on this card, and if you accidentally are 7 days late on your payment, they start treating your account as if it is in collection, sending nasty emails to you that "this is an attempt to collect a debt and any information..."   It doesn't matter how many years you have had the card and have made payments on time. Don't carry a balance on it!

name: Alison Berk
review: On my search for a new bank, TD was the last on my list. After being incredibly disappointed with most of my experiences with other banks in this area (South Carolina) II finally bit the bullet and headed into a TD. I had been hesitant because I'm not a huge fan of their advertising methods (they seem to spend an awful lot of money on swag). However, I sure am glad I did! Right from the get go everyone was friendly and helpful. In fact, it only took me a couple moments to get both a checking and savings account established. Also, I walked out with a temporary debit card. I've almost always had to wait and it has always been a huge inconvenience. They provided outstanding customer service and their rates were as decent as any other bank I had researched.

name: Deborah Rees
review: I joined TD Bank when I moved to NH to care for my mother who had an account with the bank.  I am very impressed with the customer service at all branches that I used.  I also use online banking with TD Bank, and on the few occasions when I had questions about something, and filled in forms online, the responses were very prompt and clear.  I have recently traveled across the country and I went to a branch to give them information about where I would be so that I would not have any issues using my debit card and the representative was very pleasant and engaging.  I am very happy with this bank!

name: Joe Smith
review: I think this card really unfairly targets their typical shopper (no pun intended). Its a very high interest rate with not much of a bonus.  The 5% off at any time is great but I have yet to get any additional bonus offers that I get on many other store cards (ie. 10% off if you use your card).   Its a very easy card to qualify for but really can get costly quick.

name: Sherese Rodriguez
review: The employees at TD are awesome.  They consistently deliver excellent, high-energy customer service.  Also, they are always willing to address and satisfy my banking needs. Many times I had major problems to resolve.  And, it did not matter what branch I went to, they listened and did their best to help me.  I am very grateful. I would highly recommend them.  And, they are kid-friendly too!

name: Melissa Goodnight
review: I love my Target Credit Card! What I love the most is the 5% off with purchase. If I use it to purchase my prescriptions from Target as well, I will get a 5% off coupon for every ten prescriptions that I have filled! So there are times when I use my RedCard and that coupon and get 10% off my purchases! Once I was able to make a large furniture purchase like this, coupled with my Cartwheel and online coupon! The 5% adds up over time and has been very handy for me and my family. I didn't know about linking my card to my son's school! I called to talk to RedCard about a purchase I had made and they informed me that I could add my son's school to my list online and they give the school a certain cash back bonus on my purchases! This made my RedCard even more valuable!

name: Jennifer Chancellor
review: I'm a longtime Nordstrom customer so it only made sense to get a card so I could get the perks. I like this card a lot, but don't LOVE it. I have store cards for two other stores that give more exclusive perks. Nordstrom already offers free shipping on all purchases for all customers so that doesn't entice people to get a card. I wish they would offer an occasional free expedited shipping option for cardholders. That being said, it's easy to accrue points, especially during double points periods, and you get one triple points day every year. The $20 Nordstrom notes are awesome to receive.

name: Chris Hoss
review: So I used to have a checking account with TD bank. I was with them for about a year. The fees ate me alive. I thought the monthly maintenance fee was a bit much, but I could live with it for the convenience of how close the bank was to me. But then I started getting charged a fee just to receive a statement in the mail. I mean that's just ridiculous. I think the final straw was the outrageous ATM fees I was charged. I soon switched over to a credit union and never looked back.

name: Lauren
review: I really enjoy my TD bank savings account. I have always had a wonderful experience working with TD bank. They have great customer service and clerks who are always willing to help. I also enjoy the low balance requirement of $300 to avoid any monthly fees. As a student, I can also avoid the monthly fees with my student checking account which is an added perk! The interest rate also helps my money grow while it is sitting in the account. I would definitely recommend the TD Bank simple savings account to someone who is looking for an easy and convenient account.

name: Raul Olivas
review: This particular store card offers a 5% off any purchase made with Target, which definitely adds up over time.  The ease of use makes it a definite plus.  Accessing information regarding purchases with the card can be followed through Target.com.  This card is my favorite one out of all the store cards I currently have.

name: Eli Caye
review: I started shopping at Nordstrom because I had heard of its unsurpassed customer service, friendly associates and generous return policy.  When I recently needed a dress I purchased at Nordstrom hemmed, the sales associate told me that if I had a Nordstrom card the alterations are free.  Along with all of the other benefits like their point/reward system, the double & triple point days, early sale access & VIP store parties, signing up for their store card seemed like the right choice.  I have enjoyed using my store card & accruing points for items that I buy and being rewarded with Nordstrom "notes".  Another huge plus is that the APR for those with good credit is insanely low.

name: Sin LnStyle
review: TD Banks savings is pretty much what everyone has come to expect from a savings account. You put money in and it slowly gains some value as time goes on. .05% doesn't seem like a lot and it really isn't if you just put a hundred bucks in there and wait. If you are savings thousands though for a trip or something big like a house, it starts to add up nicely. Have not had any issue with my savings account with TD and its been up and running for over a decade. Customer support is always top notch and easy to deal with.

name: Sin LnStyle
review: I am not even sure how long I have been with TD Bank. I joined long before the name change from TD Bank North. Their customer service is probably the best thing about them. They are always willing to help you out over the phone or in person. The hours are great and even stay open late if you show up late. This is one of their latest "things" they offer. I really have no complaints and have yet to have any issues, well, other then that whole over draft thing years ago which was solved with a civil lawsuit.

name: David George
review: This is one of the best in store credit cards to have, save 5% in store and online, and free shipping from the website is two of my favorite features about this card. There's no annual fee, and percentage is on point with what other stores offer, the late fee is fixed, and Target offers a 25 day grace period to pay your bill. Plus, you can stack your 5% savings with regular coupons from the newspaper!

name: Kevin Belanger
review: I have been with TD Banknorth for over 8 years now and I have no desire to leave. Every branch that I have gone to has had excellent customer service, and have always answered my questions. At one point I had an over draft fee for a mistake on my part, but I called them up and asked if they could waive it due to my long record with them. They waived it without any questions. I was thoroughly impressed! I also like their smart phone app, and their online checking account. I have also used their mobile app to scan and deposit checks without any issues.

name: Eric Smith
review: I am a relatively new TD customer and have had nothing but good things to say so far. I opened this account for a couple of reasons:1. I only have an internet bank account and wanted a brick and mortar account2. They offer free change counting ( for account holders) - PENNY ARCADE.The application process was smooth and they have a low minimum on their checking account to avoid a fee. Also have all the standard bells and whistles of a checking account. What sets them apart is the ability to mediate a problem most of us face. What to do with all are change? Do we sit and roll? Do we pay 10% to coinstar? Well TD solves that problem and will count all your change for free and deposit it. The pennies I have are being put to good use!This is what drew me to them in the competitive world of checking accounts haha. And I am glad it did. They also seem to have competitive credit cards, which I may sign up for. I am keeping my savings at an internet bank, brick and mortars are still not competitive on rates

name: Tim Riggins
review: I signed up with TD bank a few years ago and I was very pleased with it. Any bank that has decent customer service and no add on fees is good in my book. TD Bank served it's purpose very well when I was with them. I've since switched to another bank but I was always satisfied with their service. The main reason why I switched was because I wanted to support a local credit union. But if I was going to choose another bank I would go with TD bank again. Their no fees and overall good service really can't be beat.

name: Shelley Berkman
review: Normally I don't like any credit card, for any reason.  Typically, I feel, they are designed to rip you off.  And generally this is correct.  However, the Target Red Card credit card breaks the mold, and if you are the sort of person who pays your card in full at the end of the month, then you need to have this card.  It will save you all kinds of money.  The first benefit is the 5% off every purchase.  I love this, it's great, sign me up.  Right?  Absolutely!  5% adds up!  But personally I love this card because I can get unlimited free shipping on any order.  I no longer have to search around for deals, trying to get to the $25 that will entitle me to free shipping.  So if I want to order one tee-shirt (for example) for $7, it's 5% off and free shipping.  I love that!  Also, returns are super easy, I just waltz into Target and hand it off.  Done.  I don't care about their data breach, it never affected me, and anyway they did make good on that.  I wish other stores would take their lead and off the substantial rewards that Target does.  Walmart, are you reading this??  5 stars everyone.  Now the disclaimer ***I don't even know what the interest rate is, and I don't care because I pay my card off in full each month****  If you do NOT pay it each month, please do your due diligence on the interest rate, because those things will kill your finances.  Thanks for reading!

name: Ana-Maria Cirstea
review: TD Bank products are great, I just wish they had more stand-alone ATMs in the DC area. I like their customer service and the fact that they don't have any hidden fees. All in all, I am satisfied with their services.

name: Stephen Brown
review: I love my Target credit card, especially the awesome in-store savings I get. It really adds up and allows me to save a good bit on groceries from Target. The free shipping from online purchases is really helpful as well.

name: Eric Holgate
review: I use this card all the time to save money on things I would be buying at Target anyway. The 5% is a nice savings on necessary household items, and you can still use coupons with it as well.

name: Lauren
review: I signed up for the TD bank student checking account this year for college because the bank I use back home doesn't have branches in this area. It was free to sign up, the application process was really simple and that day I received my debit card. The employees at the bank are really friendly and helpful and since I joined 8 months ago, now know my name when I go in. I like the personal importance they place on their customers to make you feel important. There are TD bank locations all over the US and internationally which made it stand above all the other big name banks. I would recommend TD bank.

name: Chris Heinrickson
review: Back when I lived in Florida I was a member with TD Bank. For a bigger name bank they definitely weren't like the rest...in a good way! There were no fees when I was with them. No monthly maintenance fee or minimum balance amount. Another awesome thing about using them is they were open 7 days a week which I thought was really cool as I had not seen any other banks that were open on sunday. Overall if you live in the area you really can't go wrong with TD bank. There customer service is top notch as well and can't be beat.

name: Nika Turnbull
review: TD bank is what I like to call a breath of fresh air! This bank opened in Florida about 4 years ago, and I took a chance and opened an account with them. Initially, I was enticed by the fact that the bank was open 7 days a week. This is very flexible for me, as I tend to do a lot of my banking errands on the weekend. Four years later, and I can truly say that I do not have any issues with the bank. Furthermore, the customer service is right on par with the other well known banks in the community as well.

name: Adam Gingras
review: I have a Target Red Card it is decent, but i would not call it great.  Yes you get 5% cash back but depending how much you are spending you only save pennies on the dollar (pennies is better than zero however).  The good thing about it is that if you pay off your balance within 3 months there is zero interest.  With all this being said I was part of society whom was effected by the Target scam in which I had to get a new Target Card along with a new debit card from my bank, which obviously makes me weary to use it again, especially on big purchases.  If you do not have any reservations about identity theft, scams, etc... this may be the right purchase for you!

name: Chatana Krebs
review: I had a Target credit card a few years ago. I liked it a lot. If you shop at target a lot like I do it is great. The 5% off purchases is great. The extra 30 days for returns is helpful, but my favorite part is the free shipping from online purchases. Online shopping is so easy and convenient. Maybe it's just me but I always felt kinda special checking out at Target with my card. It kind of felt like being part of a club, and when you are checking out before you pay and the cashier asks if you want to sign up I enjoyed saying "Yep! I've got one!"The only problem was a personal one in which I used the card too much and got myself into a bit of trouble with debt, and had to cancel the card. But overall I think it's a great card.

name: Cason King
review: Just like any other specific-store card, the Target store card is great if you do most of your shopping at Target.  It offers 5% off and free shipping from Target.com.  However, it can be a big pain to remember to pay multiple cards every month so I tend to shy away from specific-store cards.  They do also offer a Target visa card which you can use anywhere and offers you the same perks at Target as this card does.  All in all, a solid card, but you can’t use it everywhere.

name: George Green
review: As is the case with most store charge cards, the interest rate is very high, and the return is very low. The Target charge card has a 5 percent discount on all purchases which is nice if you shop there often, but its not so nice if you can't pay off your balance every month. Its not at all worth it if you need to carry a balance. Otherwise this card is a pretty no frills, but no fees card. And not really worth the risk of having a balance for most people.

name: Tova Haines
review: I have used TD Bank for over five years now. I have a debit card with them. Once there was a suspicious fraudulent charge on my debit card for $70. I called them up and it was a simple process to deduct the charge off of my card. I was very pleased with how simple it was to do this. I highly recommend this bank for all of your banking needs. They really take care of their customers.

name: Jonathan Corona
review: TD bank is a great bank to have if you live in Florida. I have been with them for years now and the convenience of their many locations and great customer service is a plus. Any issue that you may have is settled quickly and effectively leaving me a stress free, one of a kind experience with them. The bank itself looks luxurious, making me feel safe and secure when im there. The South Beach location is a plus for people in Miami. If you are looking to open up an account with anyone, TD Bank is highly recommended and sure to serve you great!

name: Lisa
review: The Target Credit Card had some benefits which include 5% off all purchases, and free shipping for online orders.  The interest rate though is very high.  I use the card, then pay it off as soon as possible.  If I forget though, then I have the finance rate charge to deal with.  I like the card enough, but am thinking about going with the debit card instead, this way if I forget to pay right on time I will not have to worry about it since the money is debited directly from your checking account.

name: Tyler
review: I love my Target Credit Card. The card allows me to get 5% off of everything as well as free shipping for my online orders. It does have a rather high interest rate, but I am one of those people who pay things off right away, so I am never affected. I also enjoy the fact that I can manage everything online. Since I shop at Target a lot, it is definitely worth it for me. I have yet to take advantage of the 30 days extra on returns, but that is another small perk of the card. If you are not interested in getting the store credit card, I know they also offer a debit card option that takes the money directly from your checking account. I suggest that if you are good at paying bills on time, get this card and start saving.

name: Lisa
review: I Love TD Bank.   I think the people there are very professional and always very helpful.  I have never had any issues with them at all.  They do ask you a lot of questions when you need to verify something over the phone.  For instance, I needed to change my address (I tried to do it from my phone but I think you need to do that from a computer and I was not near one) so I decided to call them from my land line.  Some of the questions are hard to answer like what was your last purchase or deposit.   It's good that they take such precautions with everyone's bank account it's just a bit too much questions sometimes.  Regardless they are still great!

name: Kevin
review: I use TD for my business.  I have a checking and savings account.  It's very easy to move money between them and it's great for accounting purposes.  I can regulate the amount of money i have to spend at any time.  If too much builds up in the checking I can just move it to the savings where I do earn a little more on my money and it keeps it safe.  I also like the fact that using the savings account like this requires  me too rethink large purchases. It kind of eliminates impulse purchasing.  There is a small fee, but it's negligible.

name: Dana C Gibson
review: The Target Credit Card is Awesome!!  You earn all kinds of discounts just for using the card!  Even though the interest rate is kind of high, if you pay it off in time you can avoid a lot of that.  They don't have a cash advance option, but maybe that is just as well, keeps me out of trouble.  It's a great card for someone just starting out trying to build their credit history.

name: Joseph
review: I have had a checking account with TD bank for a long time and have been very satisfied. Their hours are amazing and have pretty much pushed other banks to start shaping up. I have had an account with Commerce Bank forever, which was bought by TD Bank and the service has only gotten better. Around my area some banks are only open til 3, which is insane! TD is open 7 days and usually closes at 7. Plus the free change to cash machines in the lobby are great!

name: Ian Goodwin
review: This is a great card for a couple of different reasons. If you are just starting out and would like to apply for a credit card, you are almost certain to be approved for this card. Additionally, if you do a lot of shopping at Target (primary store), then the 5% off bonus is also pretty nice. The downside is there is no cashback rewards (offsets with the 5% off) and the APR is quite high. If you decide to proceed with this credit card, make sure you promptly pay your bills!

name: Mark Fernando
review: This is a good card to have. I save 5% on everything on the store. I dont  know what my credit score was but I just applied and got it. Trying to build my credit to a excellent score :)

name: Andrea
review: I really like using TD bank as a college student because it is very convenient. There is a location right down the road from my college and the long hours make it easy to bank there. I had a pleasant experience when i signed up and have always been treated very well as a customer. I particularly enjoy the $0 monthly fee and not needing to keep a minimum balance. I really like my debit card because it allows me to have alot of freedom. I also like that I did not have to wait to receive my debit card in the mail, instead it was printed out at the location when I opened my account. I plan to continue to stay with TD bank in the future and I would recommend it to others as well.

name: matt jacobson
review: The thing I like about TD bank convenience checking is that it only requires me to keep $100.00 as a minimum balance to avoid paying the monthly fee.  Before joining TD the balance was much higher that I could not keep in the account and I was paying a 19.99 a month every month, this has saved me almost $240 in the past year.  Thank you TD!!

name: Lauren
review: As a college student, I think that this is a very convenient bank to use. There is a location right down the street from my campus and they have extended hours which is great. I am always very satisfied with my experience there because all of the workers are very helpful. I also think that this checking account is very convenient because there are no monthly fees and no minimum balance. As a college student, those two things are very important to me. I would definitely recommend using TD student checking account to other college students!

name: alissa kazan
review: I have been banking with TD bank for about 6 years and I have never had an issue with their service or employees. I recently lost my debit card and I was able to go to a local branch and give them my information and ID and they were able to print me a new card right on the spot! This is a great thing for me because my home branch is located in a different state, and I am still able to get remarkable service. Very friendly people and great customer service!

name: AMANDA GERRY
review: TD Bank is full of helpful people.  I have been banking with TD for about ten years now and I have always found them to be the best.  The best in customer service, rates, and convenience which is something we all need to have in our unpredictable lives.  TD is always open when I need to cash a check and if their not the ATM's have all the same tricks a teller does.

name: Nicole Williams
review: I love using my Target card to make purchases. The interest is high, however it is comparable to other store cards. But what this store card offers that others don't - it gives a 5% discount when you use the card,  it gives you rewards, as well as free shipping when you order online. These are greater benefits than any other store card I have had! The only reason I did not give 5 starts was because it was a hassle when their computers were hacked and I have some concerns about how secure they store their information. Overall, it is a great card with excellent benefits!

name: Matei Nicolae
review: I had for several months a bank account with a debit card attached at their Hyannis,MA branch. They were always helpful and the working hours very convenient. At that moment I was a student and I really appreciated the easy way of applying for a debit card with them and the very nice tellers. The best thing was that I had no fees, and could pay at any store without commissions.As far as security goes, never had any problem with them and I used my card to do a lot of online shopping.Overall it was a really good experience and I would recommend them for any exchange student working for the summer.

name: Alexa Haygood
review: I really enjoy using my Target credit card. One of my favorite things about this card is the fact that i receive free shipping on my online orders. There is not a certain amount that I have to spend to receive this feature. I also love getting 5% off of all of my purchases. I combine this with special offers and coupons and it ends up saving me a good amount of money. The customer service staff is always nice and helpful as well.

name: Sarah Bolton
review: This is by far my favorite store card. They have free shipping for all online orders, regardless of the price, no annual fee and 5% off of everything! The 5% combines with other deals and coupons so it if you're ever going to shop at Target it just makes sense to have their credit card! I shop with them much more often now because of the benefits from my card!

name: Shelley Leppert
review: The Target card is one of the very few store credit cards that I own.  The reason is simple; it saves me money in the form of a) 5% off on each and every purchase, either online or in store and b) free shipping on every order, no matter how large or small.  Typically my orders are small and would not qualify for free shipping so now that I have the card I can pick up whatever I want and have it shipped for free.  I pay the balance in full every month and cannot speak to the interest rate; my recommendation is pay your bills in full every month, or don't use your credit cards.  But you do pay your bills every month and/or the amount is negligible, definitely get this card; it's worth it.

name: JENN DONN
review: My daughter a student had "overdraft protection" for four transactions totaling $42.00 and was charged $140.00 in fees because they said her $200.00 pay deposit was still pending then (over 24 hrs). Then charged her an additional end of day fee of $20.00. THEN charged another $70.00 in fees for being a negative $2.00 after charging $162.00 for debits that she thought were coming from her paycheck.  THIS IS INSANE!!!!!! I didn't believe her till I saw the statement. So with her we called the customer service number and the woman that answered was HORRENDOUS. When she or I would ask a question the rep would continuously and without stopping recite a page of whatever fee agreement clause and when would try to ask another question she would just repeat it louder and louder and NEVER listen to a question.  When I got on the phone and asked her for another rep she repeated the same recitation AGAIN. I began asking her over and over for another representative and she wouldn't stop reciting the same script.  Finally after at least 5 time insisted to be transferred and she said okay really rudely, then all you could hear was typing and chewing for about 5 minutes. So we hung up and will go to the branch location to close out this account IMMEDIATELY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Amanda
review: I have Young Saver account and I can say I’m satisfied with what I have. I don’t have a very high interest rate but honestly I’m not too great of a saver  to have to worry about it. I like having my savings account though because I can at least attempt to try to save some money. Online transfers between my checking and saving are very easy, but might be my downfall. I do like the concept of their Holiday Fund because it stops me from transferring unnecessarily!

name: Tony Lau
review: If you are a frequent Target shopper, the Target Credit Card is excellent for maximizing your money. At 5% cash back on all Target purchases it far outpaces the other cards on the market without an annual fee. Cards like the Citi Double Cash (2% back) and Capital One Quicksilver (1.5%) are near the top in terms of rewards, yet don't come close to 5%. However, I would highly recommend this not being your primary card, because it offers no rewards whatsoever on any purchases outside of Target. The added bonuses of increasing the return date by 30 days as well as free shipping at Target.com also sweeten the rewards provided by this card.People must also be aware that it will not work oversees.Bottom Line:It is a great card for the avid Target shopper, but if you rarely shop at Target there are other cards out there that offer better overall shopping rewards.

name: Alina Rossi
review: I had an excellent customer service experience with TD Bank. I had an unexpected charge to my checking account that ended up resulting in an overdraft fee. I contacted customer service and asked if they could waive the fee since it was an unexpected charge and I never have overdraft fees on my account. They granted my request right away and asked if there was anything else they could help me with. This type of customer service is the reason I use TD Bank.

name: Johanna Hauer
review: Obtaining my Target card was very easy, and I really enjoy the discount that using the card provides.  However, getting additional cards for my family members to use (on the same account) was a tremendous hassle.
