They also won't let you change the billing address at the same time as you make other changes to the account - it just voids the card.  They don't tell you that and it is a huge inconvenience.  But I am happy to use the card because of the savings I achieve with it.  Now if Walmart also had a discount card and use of that card avoided these issues, I might switch.  But they don't, so I will stay a Target shopper.

name: Jonathan Corona
review: Hello, this is my review for one of the greatest banks in the world. TD Bank has been with me for about three years now & i can say, it really fits my personality. It is very high class, with top notch customer service, the banks are very welcoming & are available to me near the areas i need them most. One of my favorite locations so far is the one by South Beach, Florida. It is great to have a bank near the clubs available to you. I also absolutely love the posters on the windows. There is a classic one that has stayed with me for life, it says "too much is never enough", it is one of my favorite lines. Also the employees there make you feel as if they have known you for your whole life. I highly recommend this bank as it is the one i personally use & my business associates do so as well. Congrats to TD!

name: Michele Brient
review: There are a few things that turn me off about this card, but I want to point out the most obvious:Lacks Smart Chip Technology - Considering Target had a massive security breach that was all over the news last year, I am shocked this card has no smart chip. This alone is an absolute deal breaker. The crazy thing is, they didn't even bother to post a notice on their website nor temporarily disable purchases until the breach was resolved. I had to find out seeing it in the news. Bad for business. So no way I'll be applying for this card. No smart chip, no business from me. Period.

name: Timothy Steele
review: I like the Target Store Card. It's better than the Sears one I have. I like that I can get bonus points. And that I can get an extra 30 days for returns.  And if I use it with my Target Pharmacy card, I get even more bonus back. Also because I do so much shopping from home, this card is great because it lets me get free shipping from the target.com . That alone is enough of a reason for me to use the card. I am definitely going to apply for one soon. Might even cut up my Sears store card.

name: Sheena
review: TD Bank is the most convenient bank I've ever used. Their hours are great, and they're open seven days a week. I opened a checking account here in 2013 when I moved, and I was so surprised to find that TD Bank is not only fast and very friendly, but that they will print your debit card in person. It only took a few minutes! Any time I've had an issue, their customer service has resolved the problems quickly and to my satisfaction. I've never had a bad experience here. An added bonus- the fees are very competitive compared to other banks in the area. I would recommend TD Bank to pretty much everyone.

name: Kevin Belanger
review: I have been with TD Bank for over 10 years now. I finally signed up to use their easy rewards credit card about 3 years ago. While initially I was apprehensive because I thought this whole reward program had strings attached, but suffice it to say I was pleasantly surprised how straight forward it was. My first year I earned almost $200 in cash rewards, which was a breeze to redeem. I have had one other cash reward credit card from a well known company, and I chose to cancel my account with them because of how confusing it was. The only caveat is to make sure you don't have any late payment fees, as they can get quite hefty. (I had a couple, but I was able to call and they waived one for me due to my long membership with them).  Also just because you earn cash rewards, budget your money! Interest payments will eat into your cash rewards pretty quick...

name: James Polk
review: TD Bank is a solid, reliable choice.I've been with them for about five years now and have never had any problems with them.Signing up was very easy and the services have been handy and convenient. No BS/hidden fees, good rates for the account and checks, and a handy debit card that you can use anywhere you could conceivably shop.It's a checking account, it does exactly what you'd expect it to. TD Bank can deliver those services well and with a smile.

name: Roseann
review: I have had an account at TD Bank for two years and I am very happy with every aspect of their services.  The Online Banking and TD Bank Mobile APP are fantastic features that help me to keep track and manage my accounts.TD Bank also offers e-mail alerts which I find very useful. The girls in the bank have always been very friendly and very helpful. The one day I called to request specific information on an auto loan that I couldn't find on the website. It was during my lunch break, so I expected a wait time. The wait time they projected was two minutes, but it turned out to be around five seconds. The representative I was connected with in the loan department was very friendly and obviously knew her stuff. The call I expected to take ten minutes took less than half that.

name: Jaclyn Del Cid
review: I like this card but do not think I would apply for it. It is not likeany of the other credit card that allow you to receive cashback rewards. Also, the interest rate is really high compared to other major credit cards.

name: Bianca Morales
review: Originally, I had chosen TD Bank because there is a location right on campus and ATM's located throughout. I didn't know exactly what to expect. However, I began to like my account, and depend on my debit card for most of my purchases. I also have a savings account directly connected to my checking account, which is convenient to have. I like to transfer money between these two accounts online.The only thing I dislike are the overdraft fees and the customer service you receive over the phone. One time, I went over the balance on my account because of a mistake of another company, but they would not remove the charge. I paid it, and made sure it never happened again. But, it upset me that they would not remove the charge.

name: Frankcely Robles
review: My husband and I opened a checking account with TD Bank on August 2014. Overall their service is great and what we like the most is the convenience of being able to go to the bank on a Sunday since it is almost impossible for us to go any other day during the week. Although we don’t really have any complaints, the only downside is the fact that in order to avoid the maintenance fee we have to keep a minimum daily balance of $100.00, which sometimes due to automatic bill payments or other issues going below that limit can’t always be avoided.

name: Gabriel Reategui
review: What I like about this card is that I get bonus points.

name: Dbl Barrel
review: I love my Target credit card. First of all, Target is an amazing store where you can find quality items at great prices. When you team that up, with their awesome store credit card, it's a win win! The card extends your return period on purchases an additional 30 days and comes with a fair APR.

name: marilyn
review: I have been banking with TD for about four years now. I opened up an account for free over the phone and it was very easy to do. If I ever had a problem they always gave me great customer service in person as well as on the phone. I have a simple checking account and pay a very low maintenance fee every month. I also have overdraft protection which comes in handy sometimes when my account is low. Not to mention my kids always love the lollipops that they are given when they go into my local branch. This bank by far has been one of the banks I have been with so far. Thank you TD bank for being so amazing.

name: Randie Cairo
review: I've been a customer with TD bank for almost 2 years and joined with them via a recommendation from a family member.  The feature I like best about TD Bank is their hours, they are open everyday of the week which is very rare for a bank.  I also really enjoy the convenience of their mobile app, especially the mobile deposit feature.  The only negative I have about TD Bank is the fact that they don't have any drive through ATM's and that you have to park and go inside to use the ATM, however this isn't a big enough concern to switch banks.

name: Michelle
review: I have to say that I have had several banks before and TD is by the far the most convenient! The locations are always near and the hours are perfect for someone who works a lot of hours. I have never had a problem with customer service and getting in touch with someone quickly is not a problem. The fees are not high and I'm usually always in and out with any transaction I may have. Overall, TD's hours and locations are its major plus for me! If you are a busy person, this should be the bank for you!

name: Diana Hart
review: The best store credit card is the Target Red Card because it earns money for the schools around my house.  My local Target posts a little sign at each register that tells you how much has been donated to the school from you using your target card at the store to make purchases.  It feels like you're helping others by using your card.  I also like that you always get a five percent discount for using the card to make your purchases.  It really helps when you add the five percent, target coupons, manufacturer coupons and also the Target Cartwheel app on your phone.

name: Tyler Dresser
review: Hmm... Your identity would not have been stolen this way. The identity and information leak was actually by a security company that controlled the credit card scanners in all Target stores, as well as any other store that used the scanner and company. This was in 2013 though. You are actually better off with using the Target card on a scanner since the information is not available to the scanner...

name: Amber Chapman
review: As a college student, this debit card is super convenient.  There is a TD bank location located near my campus and they are usually open on holidays when other banks are closed. They are even open on sundays!  When you open up a checking account at TD, they print out a card for you almost immediately so there is no need to wait weeks for your card to come in the mail.  It is free to open up a savings account as well.  What I love most is there is no minimum balance and an overdraft protection plan which definitely comes in handy when you are a college student!

name: Dawn Strauss
review: This card comes with some nifty rewards and is easy to pay online.

name: Nancy Baker
review: With this card you get 5 percent off your purchase and that includes groceries.

name: John Porfirio
review: I've been using TD's checking/Debit account for over 10 years.  Initially I chose them because they were the only bank open late and on Sundays.  They still have great hours and the customer service is top-notch.  I would like to see them add ATM's in areas close to where they have banks so I don't have to drive to a local branch to take out money.  If you don't, like most other banks you incur a fee for using the ATM.  My debit card was stolen once and they quickly notified me and took care of it right away.  I had access back to my account in less than 5 days as well as my money.  Overall they were quick to rectify the issue and kept me posted.  The interest could be better but this is a checking account not a savings account!

name: Lauren Borosky
review: I opened a savings account over a year ago with TD Bank and have no complaints. It was easy to set up and very fast. I deposit money into the bank weekly and haven't touched it, so it is nice having an account to just save money in. I felt like I was more willing to pull money out of my checking account, so opening up the savings account was a great idea. The $300 minimum is easy to maintain if you are using the account to actually save money in. I just know I have to keep the minimum and it is fine. The first year the monthly maintenance fee is waived which also helps save money. Great bank account to start off with.

name: Lauren Borosky
review: I opened up the student checking account and had a great experience doing so. It was a really easy and fast set up. All I needed was my license and my student ID. There are no annual fees and there are locations all over, even abroad. I got a debit card that day and didn't have to wait weeks for one to be mailed to me. I frequently use the branch near my college and the employees always address me by name which is really unique I feel like for a bank. The fact that they remember customers is a really great practice. I love how easy it is to bank with TD Bank and would highly recommend it to other college students. I didn't want to have to deal with finding a bank with competitive rates, because right now I just want a place to put my money into. Great for college students.

name: Teriann Mendez
review: I love my Nordstrom card it's one of the only department store cards I can call at any given time regarding my purchases and I won't get a frustrated customer service rep ,if I ask for my July statement and I'm currently in November I know I will receive it in the mail they are  trustworthy and I feel comfortable  being a Nordstrom card holder ,not to mention the free returns through the mail. I also like to receive the 20 notes in the mail spontaneously from purchases i have made online or in the store, another perk I enjoy being a card holder there in store presale events exclusively to card holders gives me an insight to the latest fashion  handbags sunglasses cosmetics ect... They have a terrific In store lost and found service I have recently left my phone while cashing out and I checked with lost and found and there it was thankfully I don't think any other department store is as organize as Nordstrom great job you guys !

name: George Dounis
review: I've had a student checking account at TD Bank for about a year now. For the most part, it's a great checking account for students to keep their money to purchase school supplies, make online purchases, etc. , and it's also convenient to get direct deposit if you work part time. There's no monthly fee or minimum balance required which is a big plus, and their 24/7 customer service is usually very helpful. The only issues I have are that overdraft fee is very high and there are no rewards or interest on the account. Great starter bank account, but in the future I do plan on switching to something a little better.

name: Dawn
review: I have to say that I have mixed feelings about TD bank. I had a student account with them until I graduated college. It was perfect there were no fees, Their customer service was excellent, they even would give more dog treats when I brought him with me to deposit checks. Last year I switched to a regular checking account and I can not believe how much of my money is going to the bank in fees.Honestly I feel like I'm being robbed. I am currently in search of a new bank.

name: Joshua Watson
review: The target Store Credit card Has some good rewards; You Save 5% on every purchase in the store or online, Free shipping from online, and a extra 30 day for return. What I don't like about the card is the High APR and High late fee of $35. Overall the card is worth getting, just make sure you pay it off at the end of the month.

name: John Barrowton
review: Great customer service, great value, great store, great terms, I recommend it!

name: Brian Talyor
review: TD bank may seem like the perfect bank but in my opinion it's one of the worst choices a person can make. I've been with TD for years (when it was originally commerce bank) and these guys are the biggest crooks. They have penalty fees for just about everything you can imagine and have awful debit card protection for it's customers. My information has been stolen multiple times and was the ultimate reason I stopped working with this bank.

name: bob broshack
review: This is just an ok checking account. Interest is barely anything but what would you expect in this economy. The monthly fee is a little high considering I do not have 20k laying around. There are no fees for using other ATM's which is a big plus, if of course your balance is above 2,500. The free paper statements are nice as well because I prefer to receive paper statements over the online statements, which ensures that I actually look at it every month.

name: chelsea
review: Overall, I have had a better experience with TD Bank than other bank I have been a member with. Last year when my purse was stolen TD bank was very quick to close my accounts and get me started with new one that same day. I did not have to wait for a debit card to be mailed to me which is a major advantage! The only problem I have had with them is that when they opened my new account they forgot to permanently lock my account and just locked it. That prevented me from using the ATM for a while. However, I am pleased with their customer service. The employees are always very nice and willing to help. I also appreciate that as a student I am able to receive a free checking account. TD Bank is a bank and trust and will continue to use.

name: Joe Scott
review: TD Bank is a great bank to be a member of when looking at getting a checking account. They have a large number of branches that offer many ATM, and other services. I recently just applied for a checking account, and a debit card. I was able to finish this process with ease, and have enjoyed my experience so far. The customer service both in the branches, and online have been more than courteous. I have experienced a problem logging into my account online, but with 24/7 customer support I was able to check my balance anyway.

name: Mollie Montgomery
review: This card is great because it gives you 5% off all of your purchases at Target stores and Target on-line.  This is a great feature and easy to use.  The interest rate for this card is high, but since I pay my full balance every month, this is not a big  issue for me.  The Target Card credit card website is well organized and easy to use.  The bill pay feature works well.  I used to have an issue with them having different payment due dates each month, but that is no longer the case.  I have never had an error on my account, or any other issue with them.  I have had my card for years without any problems.

name: Mildred Rodriguez Pena
review: Having this card is a night mare . They put a R2 on my credit for a 25 dollars payment , They  don't care how long you have Been a costumer I have been with them since 2007. The reason I forgot to make a payment cause I thought my credit card was paid off also I never received a bill or phone call from them by the time . I found out was to late I was in the middle of refinancing my house when the bank told me sorry you credit is been damage by Target . It sucks that we take so long to have a great credit score and they don't care they don't take anything in consideration , they told me the only way I could removed the R2 is if we find out that we made a mistake . They did a mistake they had all my wrong inf no add and wrong phone number , at the end I was not able to refinance my house . Thanks to TARGET

name: Mildred Rodriguez Pena
review: My review is a o love the store hate the credit card

name: Leidiane Loureiro
review: With TD Bank, the only thing I didnt like about this account is when I first open the account I made a deposit of 1000 cash and only 100 was on the spot and I had to wait for the other 900 dollars the next day. I was so mad because it was psychical cash and I needed it to pay the rent and I had to wait till the next day. I can't believe a bank would do that to my money. I can understand if it was a check or money order but not CASH.

name: Andrew Frisch
review: The Red Card is a must have if you shop at Target.  Not only do you get 5% cash at the register Target also gives 1% of your purchase as a donation to the school of your choice.   Paying your monthly balances is very easy.  You can have the statement balances automatically come out of you checking account each month.  This means you won't have to remember to pay your bill!    Target's customer service is also top notch.   I've only had one issue in the 3 years I've owned the card and they took care of it right away.  Target also has a lot of coupons you can use with the card with (cartwheel) to get even more savings.

name: Bende Trott
review: I have had my TD savings for many years now, and just moved to a new state. I loved that I didn't have to do anything special when I moved because there was a TD bank located where I moved, close and convenient to where I am living. I have had absolutely no issues with this bank, and grew to love it even more when they extended their hours.  Now I able to get to the bank before or after work and on weekends which was not the case many years ago.  I have to say I've never experienced such "friendliness" when going into a bank before.  Everyone there is so eager to help you with whatever needs you have.

name: Theo Kaisa
review: I absolutely love TD Bank. Where else can I speak to a live representative 24 hours a day? No other bank that I know of opens as late as them. Banks usually close around 5pm but the td bank in my area is open until 8pn. They are the number one bank for me just because actions like that show that they really care about the customer. There has never been a time that I needed them and they were not available to help me. I also love the accountability that this bank has because if they got something wrong they are quick to admit it and apologize. If I am dealing with a representative that doesn't necessarily know the answer to a question they quickly get me to someone who can help me. When I was interested in joining td bank I spoke with a representative and there was a few questions that she did not understand but she quickly got me over to someone who knew the answers rather than her just making up responses.

name: Amy Hagerty-Kuehl
review: I believe if you are going to use a store credit card then it should have perks that go along with it. The Target Store card fits this requirement for me. This cart offers 5% off every purchase and free shipping when using it for online purchases.What is really smart is to pair up these incentives with CartWheel discounts and coupons. Then the savings goes through the roof.  So if you are diligent and self-disciplined it is really worth your while to use this card for all Target purchases. The thing  you need to remember and why I mentioned being self-disciplined is that you need to pay it off each month to avoid the high interest rates. Most, if not all store credit cards have the high interest rates like Kohls or Sears. The difference is that they do not offer these amazing incentives to use their card. We really got ourselves in a pinch using our Sears card for making large purchases. There were no incentives and we paid very high interest rates. In a financial point of view it just makes sense to use the Target Store card and pay it off every month. Another point to make is that  you can find almost anything at Target. Groceries, household goods, toys, clothing etc. With their prices being reasonable to begin with I really don't think you can go wrong unless you don't pay it off in a monthly manner. If you don't then the discounts really cancel each other out with the 22.9% interest rate.

name: Ashley Louks
review: Perhaps my review is influenced by my store experiences but the Nordstrom card is hands down my favorite.  The times I have contacted their customer service has been efficient and helpful.  Whenever I have returned items, the credit has been quickly returned to my account.  Also, I was late once and they were very forgiving and did not charge a late fee or attack my credit score once I called and explained my memory lapse.  The online account site is easy to use and the rewards are easily accrued, especially during their extra points events.  Regarding the rewards, I love how I can use them online without having the actual certificate that was mailed.  If you are signed into your account, you will have the option to use them online at checkout.  All in all, I have to say this is the best card I've used.

name: josjan
review: I have had nothing but good experiences with this bank. They have very helpful and friendly staff as well as minimal wait time to talk to a teller.  They also have many perks that are not offered at other banks such as free coin counting via their penny arcade, free notary services, free online bill pay, an instant issue visa check card so you dont have to wait days or weeks for a new or replacement card and a very low minimum balance to avoid the montly fee. Opening an account with them is also very easy and hassle free. I also forgot to mention that they are open 7 days and have very good hours, especially if you work odd hours.

name: Jill Gonzalez
review: TD has always been helpful -- lost debit cards have never been a problem, nor have double-charges. Just let them know and they usually remove it no questions asked. I also love their mobile banking app, so easy!

name: Brian
review: This card really fits well for me, because I do most of my grocery/electronic shopping at Target already. So the extra thirty days to return and added discount to its already low prices are a great deal. It is one of the best experiences I've had with a store card, seems like it usually just means you get added to their spam list.

name: Ashley-Nickole Crist
review: I love all the savings that this card provides to me as an avid Target shopper. I get me extra 5% off every purchase. SO paired with my cartwheel app and other coupons I am able to save huge while still getting exactly what I want! Plus on my lazy days when I don't feel like dealing with people out in the real world I can shop online without having to pay for shipping!

name: Steph
review: I have my target credit card and can not say anything bad about it. It is a great way to save especially if you shop at target a lot. You automatically get 5% off your entire purchase every time you use it. When you pair that with other coupons and cartwheel, you are looking at big savings. The other major perk to me is that fact that you get free shipping on any purchase from target.com. I like to be able to purchase right from home and shipping usually kills the deal so it's a great perk.

name: Greg Jones
review: This bank account is a good checking account for students who really only need a place for their money to be secure and available with a debit card. It is very simple to set up and only took around 20 minutes. All you need to bring is a photo ID and a student ID. The woman who set me up with the account was very friendly and helpful, and the employees are always very helpful when I go into the bank. There is no monthly balance and no maintenance fees which is very helpful for college students on a tight budget. The downside to this bank account is you don't get any interest of any kind of promotion. Your money simply sits in the account with no advantage. This is a good account for college students, but after college I would highly recommend getting a different account that offers some sort of promotion for using.

name: Melissa Lubetsky
review: This card is a must have if you shop at target.  If you are someone who uses there credit card when shopping at target., then you should be using the target credit card instead.  One of the best things about the credit card is that every time you shop using it you automatically save 5% on your bill in store and online.  When using you card to buy things you get a extra 30 days additional time for returns, and you get free shipping when ordering online.  I also like the fact that they frequently send me coupons in the mail for money off specific products, and money off my bill just because I have the card.

name: Kay Hall
review: I absolutely can't stand TD Bank. Saying that they are the most convenient bank is a total lie. The employees are so rude. I went in with my fiance to start an account. The woman who helped us gave us an attitude; I assumed this was because we were young. When she asked how much we wanted to deposit, we said $25,000. She snorted and asked how much of that money was form our trust funds. This was rude, especially since the money was earned; my fiance made some investments and it panned out. Additionally, she didn't want to register the account to both of us because our last names were different. They said we should just wait until we were married so they didn't have to "change everything once we decided to actually commit". I was beyond annoyed and wanted to speak with a manager. He came over and didn't apologize once for anything that happened. I will never bank there again.

name: John
review: This checking account is a rather good one. I have not had many problems with it. In fact, my biggest problem was when my account got hacked. There was no money missing, but I could not get access to my money. The bank was very accommodating by opening a new account and transferring the money over for me. They did not hold me liable for any of the time or resources they lost doing this, and I am grateful for that.

name: Greg Jones
review: I signed up for TD bank, because I moved out from home to the city where I attend college. At home I was using a credit union that only had two locations. One of my friends recommended TD bank so I decided to look into it. I went to the bank on a Saturday morning, expecting to have a long wait. Right away the customer service was excellent. I was greeted as I entered the bank and was asked what I could be helped with. I said I was interested in starting a bank account and was brought to one of the managers of the bank. After talking about my banking history, what I am looking for, and what services I want, I set up a student checking account. The process was extremely easy and every step was explained. I was given a very thorough and informative tutorial on my online banking, checks, how the account works, and the features of my account. I was very satisfied with the process of setting up the account. The customer service, speed, and information provided completely exceeded my expectations.

name: Sere Chao
review: Very middle of the road banking service. I wasn't happy with my experience with TD Bank though things could be a lot worse. I was a member of Commerce back in the day and it was terrific (5 stars) but ever since TD took over the quality levels diminished. Hidden fees and suspect debit purchase prioritization all over the place (if you have less than 50 dollars in your account and know that you're probably not going to get paid for another few days don't take the risk with TD). I'll give a positive mark for their 24 hour customer service who I've never had issues with and their Penny Arcade service.

name: Craig Lombard
review: This is pretty great if you are a Target customer like myself.  Why use a Visa or MasterCard shopping at Target when the Target card offers 5% off purchases both in store and online.  It has a 25 day grace period and a reasonable APR.  30 days additional time for returns and can be combined with the Target Pharmacy Rewards certificate for some pretty good deals. Free shipping is included with online purchases which if you have paid for shipping multiple items before you know can be kind of costly. Overall if you like Target like me I think this card is a great value.

name: Luis Mendez
review: So far so good with TD Bank. Opened a checking account on a saturday morning and it was quick and painless with a very pleasent bank representative. I received my debit card on the spot and was on my merry way. I did mess up and overdrew from my account but they reversed the overdraft fee without me begging so that's awesome! Treat me good TD Bank and I'm yours for life, lol.

name: Breanna Truxon
review: For being a bank, TD Bank is definitely great. I am usually not a fan of banks however I opened this checking account a year ago and definitely don't regret the decision. The staff at every branch I've been to are very friendly. I also love that most branches are open until 8 pm and open on the weekends so I can easily deposit my checks into my account.The thing I don't like about my checking account is the monthly fee. It would be more convenient if I didn't have a monthly fee. I also don't like the $3 fee for using a non TD bank ATM.

name: Michael Guiliano
review: I love my Target Red Card.  The 5% savings is great since I shop at Target frequently.  It is also nice to see my year-to-date savings amount on the bottom of every receipt.

name: dakota Pendarvis
review: The Target card is absolutely great. We use it every single trip to Target. The 5% is so great (basically takes care of taxes) and then you get the 5% on top of any cartwheel coupons or regular coupons. The free shipping on the website is so great too! You also get an extended return policy!

name: Kaitlyn
review: I really like this card -- unlike most other store cards this one gives you the rewards upfront in the form of 5% off -- no waiting for rewards to accumulate, it saves you money right then and there!

name: Matt Morgan
review: The Target store card is excellent for normal everyday usage, because it automatically provides you 5% off of everything in the store. Not many other companies are offering this automatic discount so why not take advantage of it.Because of this discount, we tend to stop here more often than other stores like Wal-Mart, who don't offer a store card with a discount. Target provides an excellent incentive for us to shop, and I couldn't be happier with their practices. I encourage my friends and family to check it out as well. You really can't beat it.

name: nate
review: At one time, I never had a problem with TD Bank. However after they merge with Commerce Bank, they started using Commerce Bank policies. Their customer service started to be poor and started charging me higher interest rates. Then, TD Bank agents started to change to inexperience tailors, so I started getting less money from the window than I was asking for. All this led me to changing my business from TD Bank to Bank of America. There service is as bad as Commerce Bank was.

name: BeBe Friend
review: I had a TD checking account until a few months ago when I moved.  Their service was OK, but nothing outstanding.  I never got that "above and beyond" feel from the bankers there.  The biggest issue I had was during my recent moving process.  There was not a TD branch near my new home, so I was not able to visit the branch to make deposits often.  I had to mail my checks into the branch for deposit.  Every time I mailed a deposit, I would receive a letter informing me that they had put a hold on my deposit.  Each time I was able to get it removed, but I had to go through the trouble of calling and speaking with the manager.  I would probably not do business with them again.

name: Matt
review: .I have had a TD checking account for almost 7 years now, and there have been some good and bad moments.  I love the convenience part of TD Bank; instant replacement of debit cards, Sunday hours, online banking site is very user friendly. But I've had issues with overdrafts that didn't seem legitimate and it's popped up many times.  It seems they reorder withdrawals due on your account based on the highest amount first.  When that happens, it's puts your account into the negative faster and thus creates more overdraft charges for each of the smaller amounts coming out.  I think this issue is nationwide and I believe there's been lawsuits about it.  And their 800 number customer service is nothing but rude people, at least the ones I've dealt with.  They all kinda have an "oh well" sort of tone to my problems.  Overall, I'd like to close my TD bank account but they make that process very complicated too.  So for now, I'm staying put, albeit reluctantly

name: Narayan Subramanian
review: The Target store card is the best store card I have among two other cards (Sears and Kohl's). The 5% cash back is the best feature I find. Another important feature is the free shipping   given for RED card members. I was little concerned about the identity theft issues during Nov2013. But other than that, the RED card makes life much easier with the benefits it provides. Also RED card members also enjoy additional warranty period for electronics.

name: Nancy
review: We first opened a business and then a personal checking account at TD Bank. I liked the hours, location, and turn around time for deposits.  There was a point where we were not doing well financially.  We kept being overdrawn and incurring a lot of feesin our personal account.  My husband finally paid off the amount we were overdrawn and decided to close the account since we had a personal account at a different bank and should we incurr any more fees, they were lower.  A few months later I got a call from the bank saying there was a hold on my business account until I paid off the balance in my personal account. I had to go down and spend an hour trying to prove to them that the personal account was closed and the overdrawn balance paid off.  All in all TD is a bank I would recommed: long hours, many locations, great turn around time for deposits and average customer service.

name: Damien Kirrmann
review: A great card if you are shopping at target regularly. However, I found myself using this store card very, very little, as I am not really a frequent Target shopper. Where this card shines is online, where it still allows for a 5% discount on top of free shipping.  But again, I don't happen to use it very often, mostly because I usually can find better prices elsewhere online, even including the 5%.  Bottom line: if you shop at Target, get it. If you don't, it isn't a good enough reason to switch to Target in my opinion.

name: Amanda Podgorny
review: I really enjoy this card. I am a frequent Target shopper, and I love that I get an extra 5% off my purchases. I am more of an in store shopper, but I do like that if I order online I can still get my 5% off in addition to free shipping. There have been a few times that I forgot to make a payment on time, and someone has called and asked me to make a payment over the phone to avoid the late fee, which is a blessing! Overall, I recommend this card if you are an avid shopper because the 5% off adds up!

name: Tony Smith
review: Every time I shop at Target I make sure to use my REDcard, saving me 5% off everything I purchase in store and online at Target.com.  I love that there is no annual fee and a grace period of 25 days, pretty good for a credit card.  Luckily for me, Target is the closet store to my home anyways so this discount will add up pretty well over time.  The free shipping at Target.com offered when purchasing with this card is also a nice added benefit.

name: Rose Katerina
review: I shop Target quite frequently, for various different things. I go to a Super Target near my house, and I often save quite a bit of money on grocery, so their store card is very valuable to me. It saves me a whopping 5% every time I make a purchase, which really adds up - -and fast! They're also very generous. About 1% goes to my old high school for funding; that place really needed it. The extra month for returns has also gotten me out of hot water on numerous occasions. I'm very forgetful with receipts, and the store card automates everything in their system. As an added bonus, I now get a ton of Target coupons because of the card. Once you're a "member," they really take care of you. My only gripe is the higher than normal APR, but the benefits outweigh the costs.

name: Jackie Lage
review: If you shop at Target a lot, then I suppose the Target Store Red Card would be a good option for you. However, the fact that there is no introductory rate APR and the regular APR is so high is kind of a slap in the face to their customers. I only shop at Target for a few select items, so I see no reason to ever get the Target RED Card. It is nice that they give consumers an additional 30 days to return, but I think this is just a reflection on how poor their return policy is in the first place. They would need to improve this card quite a bit for me to consider giving it a spot in my wallet.

name: erin
review: I opened up a checking account with TD Bank recently. I also have a debit card connected to this account. My experience with them so far has been excellent. When I got a new job, I needed a direct deposit form and the woman at the bank was helpful and nice. In addition, when there was suspicious activity on my card and my account had been frozen, the phone customer service team helped me. While it did take them a little while to resolve the issue and I did end up having to come into the bank to resolve it, my frozen card situation was eventually fixed. I have found the experience I've been having with TD Bank has been superb!

name: David Spinosa
review: My wife and I have a savings/checking account at TD Bank (which we will be closing shortly). The experience has made us want to never do business with this bank again! We tried to open a safe deposit box and the woman who was helping us could not even manage to print the application out! She then proceeded to blame everyone including us for this "experience" we were having.The TD Bank website is often unusable and not working. How do you expect your customers to manage their finances if they cannot use your website?And lastly, the lines at the drive-thru are absolutely ridiculous. We've waited in excess of 20 minutes at times. This is totally unacceptable to us. If TD Bank cannot manage a drive-thru properly then they should not have one. Train your staff and hire more staff!

name: ken vale
review: I have had my TD savings account for a couple of years now. At first it seemed like a good idea made by the clerk at TD Bank to put a side fifty dollars a pay into savings. Due to many different bills and costs I found it difficult to continually hold the three hundred dollar minimum in the account. I always did because I could not justify paying the fees. But for now I have stopped the fifty dollar automatic transfer, because I would just end up paying a fee to transfer it right back to my checking account. I wish I would have known more or researched a little more about the different fees that came with opening the account.

name: Jiuxu Zhang
review: I have recently opened a TD Bank Checking Account in order to save money for my son's college tuition. I am really impressed by the overall customer service and the checking account overall. I am not charged annual fees or interest for opening the account. I also received $100 bonus for using my new debit card five times. The customer service representatives are very helpful and informative. Additionally, I love the online customer service. This service is available 24/7 and the representatives resolved my problems efficiently. Truly a reliable and trustworthy bank for checking accounts!

name: Sam Morgan
review: I have shopped at Target for Years and have found their shopping experience a bit more pleasant than other stores. It wasn't until a year ago that I got my Target REDCARD. It offers 5% saving and Target also donates 1% or so to the school of your choice. The Target App makes it really easy to pay your bill and they do send reminders to pay your bill on time which I appreciate after almost destroying my credit history with standard Visa, Amex, etc. cards in the past. I have yet to return an item to their store but I'm sure not having to hold on to a receipt forever and the extra 30 days will come in handy someday. The 5% savings shows up on the bottom of the receipt too so it's pretty cool seeing how much you saved.

name: Kimberlea Rodriguez
review: Target is a great credit card with many wonderful advantages and rewards. Somethings many other cards do not offer is the extended return time as well as being able to stack your savings. No other credit card allows you to do that. These savings add up especially when you compare to Walmart or Kmart. The way to go is Target.

name: Keith Cich
review: We have had a great experience with our Target REDcard. The main reason we signed up for this card is the 5% off on every Target purchase. Target is the main store we shop at so we save a ton of money every year. The interest rate is fairly high as with most store credit cards, but we just pay the balance off every month and have had no issues. I would recommend this card to anyone who is a regular Target customer.

name: Sarah Cook
review: You have no idea how much I love this card!   I am going to shop at Target anyway, so why not get cash back!  I have my red card linked to my Pharmacy rewards and ever three prescriptions I get an additional 5% off.  So that's 10% off of what I was going to do anyway.  I love that you can pay the bill in the store.  Also, I get more coupons from Target through the mail now that I have a RedCard.

name: Nicole
review: Every time I go into TD Bank I love the atmosphere and good vibes I get! From the moment I walk in I'm welcomed with a friendly greeting and if I'm confused about something there is always someone to explain things to me in a way I can understand. My daughter loves when I say we have to go to the bank, I'm so glad TD is kid friendly. I would never go to any other bank but TD Bank because they have treated me very well. At other banks I would feel like I'm going to a funeral and I have to make sure my daughter is quiet, not at TD Bank! Not only does the location offer great customer service but so does their customer service via telephone. I have had any problems I encountered dealt with quickly and in a way that made me think "wow this bank is really trying to help its customers." I'm highly satisfied with TD Bank and will definitely be banking with them for many years to come.

name: Andrew gillespie
review: This bank account is great for convenience , but that's about it. I have used this bank account for about 7 years now even though I am no longer a student, and it has its advantages and disadvantages.  On the plus side , it has no monthly balance and no maintenance fees so if your looking for an easy bank account you don't have to think about this is a good choice. The main disadvantage though is it really offers you nothing in terms of interests or perks. It also has a high fee structure for atms when not using td banks atms. This account will do if your like me and just need a place to have your money sit

name: Tammy Estevez
review: TD Bank might be convenient because it's open when a lot of other banks are closed, but I feel that it lacks in a lot of other areas. Their overdraft policy fails in a lot of ways; even with overdraft protection, it still happens. The thing I will admit is that the customer service is helpful and pardons a few of the charges one can acquire with overdrafts. They are pretty versatile and have a lot of different account options. I started with a student checking, and am soon being switched to a convenience checking. I also have a savings account. Pretty easy online format to sift through. Very easy to make internal and external money transfers.

name: ken vale
review: I've had TD Bank for almost 15 years, back when it was Commerce Bank. I have always loved the hours and that it is open seven days a week - it really is the most convenient bank. It is the only bank I can also find in Canada and use their ATM free of charge. The Penny Arcade has always been one of my favorite things about TD. Who doesn't have change and want to cash it in for no cost whatsoever (if you are a banker with them)? The customer service is always spectacular even when there is a long line (which they cannot control). The only thing that has gotten worse with the bank is the new fees they are beginning to charge - raising the ATM fee from nothing to $2 to $3 in a two or three year period. Hopefully they don't start adding more fees or I might have to start thinking about switching to an online bank. I'd recommend TD Bank, especially if you work hours that make TD the most convenient to you.

name: Matt Kleinman
review: The Target card is fantastic if you're a frequent Target shopper. 5% off all the time is a great bonus. It's also nice to have all your Target purchases in one place. I think it also gives free shipping from target.com, but I have not used that yet so I'm not positive.

name: Dan Gemelli
review: I love collecting cash back.  I have been using the card for 4 years and I have over $100 earned in cash back that I am saving in my account.

name: Wynn RIchie
review: I opened up a mutual funds account at TD after it had been recommended to me by the clerk that I was dealing with at the bank.I am fairly young and I have been saving my money because I want to buy a condo. I didn't know too much about banking so I was just letting my money sit in my checking account. I was very happy that mutual funds were recommended to me. The process of acquiring them was very comfortable to me. I sat down with an advisor and he talked to me about the risks were and what the profits could be. He let me take a test online as well to see if mutual funds were the right choice for me. He took a lot of time with me to make sure that I was comfortable with what I was doing. He also took the time to explain everything to me as this would be my first time investing.I gave TD a good rating because the mutual find has been doing great and instead of my money sitting around doing nothing I am not making money that I would not be making before.

name: Adam Silber
review: I have had a great experience with this card and have had one since 2003..  they unlike other banks have done their best to please me.  I do recommend  their card.

name: Jackie Medina
review: I love that my target credit card offers 5% off on all purchases! The interest rate is pretty high, but if you pay off your card every month then its worth it.

name: Courtney Geary
review: The Target credit card is a decent card to own if you shop at Target often, but it doesn't appear to have any added benefits anywhere else. You can save 5% at Target and get an extra 30 days to return items plus free shipping at Target.com. Most other cards don't offer such rewards and if you are an avid target shopper this card is perfect for you. There's no annual fee, which is awesome, and there is a 25 day grace period to pay your balance. If you are wanting a card to use for other stores to get cash back, or other rewards, this may not be the best card.

name: Tyler Dresser
review: Don't forget the 5% applies to the pharmacy as well! Also, 1% of your spending goes to a school of your choice!

name: Loretta Bruce
review: I am enjoying the personal touches of TD Bank. Every time that I go into the branch the staff is friendly and always willing to help and solve any problems that they can, that don't go beyond company policy. They would have received a 5 but the fees are a killer. I do understand that I acrue them by not paying close strict attention but 35.00 overdraft fee on gas for a direct deposit customer seems a bit much,I would change bank just for that alone but the people that work at my branch are what keep me loyal. Plus, I like banking in the branch on a Sunday morning after a cup of Joe.

name: Josh Dermott
review: The Target credit card is an excellent card for me. I shop at target on a weekly basis so it just made sense. The 5% off is a great perk as I spend a considerable amount at Target stores. I have previously used other credit cards but they did not have the perks that the Target store card does. Saving money and budgeting are very important to me and this card helps me do both! I also love that you can get an extra 30 days on returns. I am notorious for forgetting to return unwanted items and this extra 30 days comes in very handy!

name: Jimmy Vajdak
review: I have been a TD bank customer for the last 8 years, and initially had their student savings and checking account.  Last year i applied for their secured credit card, and the people i worked with were very helpful and nice.  I was supposed to go to a store to submit my application, but since i was at school i was 150 miles away from the nearest one.  After speaking to a representative on the phone we were able to work out a solution to my problem.  Overall i would recommend this service to a friend.

name: Nichole Corbett
review: As a young woman beginning to develop credit, Target's credit card has been an excellent card for me. The major benefit being the fact that ordering things online is free. I'm a college student in a small town and my local Target doesn't carry everything I need and it's nice to be able to order things I want online without worrying about the cost.In addition, the 5% off on purchases really helps me conserve the little money I have. Which I appreciate as a student.

name: Jamil Alexander
review: It's not a bad card honestly. As a skeptical person I usually steer away from these however I gave this one a chance hearing mainly positive things and I like it. It's pretty convenient to have as I am one that doesn't like shipping at all, and the savings aren't bad, you don't think a lot about when you hear 5% until you add it up over time. Only issue here is the insane APR, don't let it get to the due date. Be disciplined or it can get costly.

name: erin
review: I used this along with my friend in the past. It was very easy to manage and we loved the fact you can bring in your dog to the bank and the bank tellers give them doggie treats! My money did not 'grow' as they say, by being in this bank. However, if you are just looking for something simple, a place to safely keep your cash, cash your checks, use direct deposit, etc. then this is a good option. Customer service is about average, maybe a bit above average, nothing too significant there.

name: Sarah Slazer
review: The card is nice, but the late fees are absolutely ridiculous. If you are even past 5 p.m. in submitting an ONLINE payment ON the due date, you'll still be charged. As if that makes any factual difference. I love the discounts at Target, but before you apply, do know that you can and very well may be charged a late fee ON the due date if you pay after coming home from work. The unnecessary fee cost us more than we've ever saved with this.

name: Andrew Smiley
review: I've had a checking account with TD Bank since they bought out the previous bank about 3 to 4 years ago. As far as customer service goes, it can be very slow. I've been the only person in line, and I would still have to wait for ten minutes to do my business. I currently still have this account, but I rarely use it as I now have an account with MidFlorida. Nothing about the account I have with TD makes me want to return there, I will most likely close the account soon.

name: Cederick
review: TD was my first bank when I got my first job. That was back in 08. Since then I have never had a single problem with them. We actually built quite the rapport. Their customer service beats every other bank hands down. They are always very willing to work with you given certain situations. They have no problem handling an overdraft rather than making you pay it. This bank understands its customers, which is why I will always use them.

name: Stephanie Apruzzese
review: I have been using TD Bank for a long time, and while it is a bank that I feel like I can trust, there have been some situations that I have not been happy with.  Firstly, there is a $3.00 surcharge fee that TD Bank charges you when using a non-TD ATM.  This is a lot of money that adds up very quickly to a college student, and while I am traveling I do not always have access to a TD Bank location.  Another time I was unhappy was when I was using my mobile banking app and I was charged a $9.00 fee twice for transferring money from my savings account to my checking account too many times, which I was never told anything about when signing up for these accounts.  Hidden fees really bother me, but besides these events TD Bank has good hours and great customer service and is always a pleasant bank to go to.

name: Ryan Marshall
review: TD bank has been a reliable and trustworthy banking source for me for a couple of years now. The most serious issue I have faced with TD bank is that they do not have enough locations around the country. Even though they are close to my home and work locations, while traveling I have sometimes had a hard time finding a TD Bank ATM. Their customer service is generally pretty good, and overall I would recommend this bank.

name: ANDI LORENSON
review: I became a customer of TD Bank through a merger. I was happy with my checking account prior to the merger, but after that everything changed. My checking account which was once free now required me to keep a minimum balance. I started getting fees every month. When I called the branch to complain, they would not refund my fees and told me that I have been notified through a letter in the mail. I had never been overdrawn before, nor had I ever had a fee refund, and still I was denied this courtesy. If the bank employee had simply given me a courtesy refund and discussed other options with me, I would have been happy. Instead, I ended up closing my account in going to a different bank. I found out when I got my next statement that the bank employee did not actually closed my account properly and I was still getting fees. So then I had to call customer service and repeat the process. This time, they did refund the fee because it was an error on the bankers part that it did not get properly closed. Overall, my experience with a TD checking account was not positive.

name: stephanie silva
review: I have had my target credit card for 8 years now and love it! Its the only one I have kept of all my other store credit cards. I love that with it you get free shipping online AND 5% off your purchase. Mine also has a visa logo so I can use it for whatever but I try to use it mainly for target since I get the most benefits from there.

name: Andy Garcia
review: I love my Target Red Card! I've had it for three years now and I use it every single time I shop at Target stores or on their website. As a cardholder, you get 5% off of every store or website purchase as well as free shipping on all online orders automatically. You also receive exclusive coupons at the register after checking out. Only downside is you can't use it at any other stores.

name: Dan Kim
review: I like the Target Store Card primarily for 2 big reasons.  The first is the 5% discount on all Target and Target.com purchases.  I go to Target a lot and this helps me save more on my day to day purchases. Secondly, the 30 extra days for returns is such a godsend. Absolutely love this card and would recommend this card to everyone.

name: Joe Ferguson
review: So far I have been pretty satisfied with TD Bank. They have been reliable, easy to work with, and provide decent rates for their savings accounts. There are also branches all over NYC which is convenient. Compared to many other larger banks, they are pretty good. Much better than Chase was, or than Bank of America or Wells Fargo. As far as NYC banking goes, I would definitely recommend them.

name: Yesenia Rodriguez
review: Just opened an account at TD Bank....yeah!  Loving them so much right now.  Always see the commercial where they clearly say they provide  you with a  debit card at the moment you open an account, well it is true. They make it right in front of you, not having to wait 7-10 business day to arrive in your mail.    Everyone so friendly and smiley, so wish every store was like this.

name: Ryan Wackerly
review: I love that the Target Store Card gives you an extra 30 days for returns.  This is much better than another store card I had at a competitor that did not offer these extra return days. One thing that I do not like about the Target Store Card is the max late fee, I do feel this is a little high.

name: Amanda Jo
review: I really do love TD Bank and I have been banking with them for years now. I remember my first bank, when I was in high school, was a BoA, and it was just the absolute worst experience, especially compared to TD Bank, so that's when I switched over to TD and I have been banking with them ever since. Since I am still technically a student I don't really have much to say about their products other than the savings or checking account, but I would like to say I find them to always be extremely helpful and super QUICK with everything. Even if I lose my bank card I know I can go in, they will see me immediately, and print out a brand-new card for me right there. Super convenient hours and I am very happy with them in general.The one thing that does bother me, and this is half my fault, is their overdraft policies. Now, when I first started banking with TD I never had these issues before (they obviously had a different overdraft system in place) but it seems like all of a sudden, in the last year or so, I'm getting hit with overdrafts left and right for charges because of the way they will charge debits before credits. I know there was a class action about this (I was awarded money) and I'm sure they fixed some things, but I still see it happening, more or less. Again, I am still in college, not really "established" in a career yet.

name: erica
review: I've been a TD bank user for about 4 years now and have found them to be pretty convenient overall. I have never had any issues with their employees and they have done everything they could to help me when I needed it. I find it very comforting to know that I have a good bank that is committed to helping me manage my money. They also have great operating hours which seem to be much more convenient than other banks I have used previously.

name: Jessica
review: TD Bank is the worst bank I have ever done business with. Their customer service is severely lacking, and worst of all, their policies are suspicious. Once I looked at my checking account and was completely dismayed to see that I was in the negative by about $100. When I contacted them, I was informed that I had gone a couple dollars overdraft with a check, but since it was their policy to clear the biggest checks first - rather than the order in which my debits and checks went through - I received 3 overdraft charges instead of 1! Customer service did nothing about this, and I have heard similar complaints from others. I strongly do not recommend this bank. I feel they value profit over members, and are not above questionable practices.

name: Chelsea Haigh
review: I have had a savings account with TD Bank for about a year now. Since enrolling for a TD Bank savings account I have had no complaints. The customer service they provide is outstanding and their convenient hours make getting to the bank a breeze. I had my account numbers stolen out of my purse in November. I called TD Bank customer service in a panic. They assured that my accounts would be frozen and checked to make sure no theft had occurred. The next day I was able to go into a branch location and set up new accounts in less than 30 minutes. In addition to 24 hour customer service over the phone, there is also online banking, and a mobile app. You can easily access your savings account information from all three of these locations. I am very happy with my choice to switch to a TD Bank savings account.

name: Griffin Emerson
review: It still bugs me that I haven't received A new Target card with a Chip in it. You would think that given the negative publicity regarding the Target data breach would light a fire under their rear ends, but I guess PR about security is better than actual security.

name: Tyler Dresser
review: It wasn't just a Target data breach, it was a security breach on the card input that would process payment at the registers which were used by customers. If you shopped in any store that used these card readers then your information was likely leaked.

name: Shalaeha McClintock
review: I have had this card for a year, and i absolutely LOVE it. I am a frequent shopper at Target, so this card just makes sense for me. I love getting my 5% off purchase, especially if the item is cheaper online, and i get my discount AND free shipping! Don't even get me started on if I have coupons! 10/10. I would recommend!

name: John Hoe
review: The Target Store card is a great card and being that I shop at Target all time, it makes sense to get one.  They offer free shipping when you use it on Target.com which is just sensational because shipping cost is so high these days.  Well worth it.

name: Michael Reed Markham
review: The 5% off all purchases is amazing . Combining that with Red Card discount and coupons. I have saved so much. If you shop at target you might as well get this card. You will save money using the target store card it's smart.

name: Katie Hales Smith
review: I love my Target card and I use it all the time. It is easy to qualify for the Target card, you can do it right there at the register. The 5% off all purchases adds up quickly. It's also convenient to use- at checkout you don't even have to sign for transactions that are less than $50.

name: Amie Butchko
review: My new bank is TD Bank, which I recently visited in an effort to add my name to an existing account my husband has had since his childhood.  I was pleasantly surprised at the excellent level of customer service that was displayed throughout the process, which was surprisingly involved considering we had to both add my own name and remove his mother's name from the account, with all three of us present.  The teller could not have been more informative, patient and kind.  Her pleasantry made the situation easy, put us at ease, and resulted in the comprehensive delivery of all information we will need in order to manage the account from here on out.

name: Jerry Berg
review: I woke up one day and found that TD was acquiring my old bank, Carolina First. I was skeptical at first, but the transition was smooth, and I have kept my checking account with them. Their hours are longer than any bank out there, as well as being open Saturdays and minor holidays. When I was in Miami Beach, I lost my debit card, I was able to walk into a TD Bank branch, and have one printed right there and then. So if you travel like I do, it's a good bank to have a relationship with as they are everywhere it seems, and their hours are great.

name: Dawn Maupin
review: This Target Store Card is one to have! It gives 5% off all purchases at Target Stores and Target.com when you use it. The card is not hard to qualify for, you don't need perfect credit. The terms are pretty good and all with no annual fee.

name: Robert Hayward
review: A TD Bank was just built one half a block away from me. It was very easy to open an account, and with a 500 dollar balance I will have no fees. I had a Bank of America account once and they were very fee happy. That is why this is important to me. The customer service was excellent, but they did get my address wrong on my checks. That took a couple weeks to straighten out, it was a minor error, St. instead of Ave. The web site is quite good, and it has only been down perhaps once in the last year. They have a change machine in the bank if you need to get rid of a few years' worth of pennies as I did. They are also open in the evening which for a bank is quite unusual. I have yet to go after 4:00 pm, but it is nice knowing it's open. My banking needs are simple, and TD Bank has made me feel I am important enough regardless of my limited use.

name: Dave Curry
review: TD Bank is a great place for me.  I can access accounts 24 hours a day.  Moving money in and out of accounts is very simple and can be done with a few clicks.  The site is secure and feels very safe.  I can also find help at my local branch when I need to see somebody in person.  The only downside is that if I am traveling I cannot just hit the local branch as they are not as plentiful as some big banks.  TD has a great staff that has helped me with questions.  They are courteous and knowledgeable.

name: Dan Harrison
review: To put it simply, TD bank is pretty awesome. I opened an account a few years back due to their longer hours (at least compared to some of the other bank chains in my area) and have been very pleased in that time. The workers there are super nice and I feel safe knowing my money is secure. Perhaps one of my favorite aspects of TD bank is that you can purchase a prepaid debit giftcard at no additional cost. So when I want to give a money giftcard to a family/friend I don't have to spend the $6/$7 fee that many other institutions charge. I really appreciate that from TD!!

name: Cleo
review: While the 5% bonus might seem minimal at first, it seriously adds up if you frequent Target like I do. Buying some groceries and clothing here seriously pays off and makes Target such a value. Their customer service is great as well. The security issue does worry me a bit since Target had a problem with that recently, but I trust the company to fix everything in case that does happen, and doubt another breach would occur soon.

name: Zoe Maroulis
review: So the 5% bonus is a life-saver, 5% off everyday and the prices here are pretty much already the lowest in my city with the best selection. Obviously there is the worry of security, but Target would not let that happen again and I would have to imagine this is the most secure card out there.

name: Jane NIPPER
review: I recently opened a savings account with td to transfer my mortgage as we are unhappy with where we are now. I must say they are awesome in helping with the transfer and refinance. However the only problem I had that made me not give them five stars is they are not clear in their paperwork and contracts. The wording seems to go on and on and talk in circles so I had to have someone sit down with me and go over every bit of it which was very time consuming. Other than that they are the nicest people they remember our names and they remember my kids and they even give me a dog treat to take for my dog. Their rates are great and they are very understanding of every need one could have financially. They are a bank with the courteous gestures of a credit union.

name: Jackie Farace
review: I love my Target RedCard! The 5% off all purchases can't be beat. Combining my RedCard discount with Target's coupons and Cartwheel app, I have saved so much money on groceries and household items. Additionally, the free shipping I receive when shopping at target.com with my RedCard is awesome. I give this card 5 stars because it's an awesome money-saving tool when it's paid off every month. I wouldn't want to carry a balance on the card due to the high APR.

name: Allie Bentley
review: The Target store card offers an excellent discount and extras like free shipping that are great money savers for Target shoppers - because everyone knows, you can never buy just one thing at Target!  The regular rate is much better than my Capital One platinum card.

name: Benjamin Rosenfeld
review: I took out a personal loan from TD about a year and change ago, perhaps maybe seventeen or eighteen months. I chose them, because I've held a checking account with them ever since they acquired Hudson United Bank. They also offered a discount of, I think, 0.25% or 0.5% when you sign up for automatic payments from your TD checking account. I took out the loan to consolidate credit debt and improve my credit score. Which was good, because I ended up taking out a mortgage for a co-op purchase less than a year later. I didn't take the mortgage out from them, though. They don't do mortgages for co-ops where I live, or at least that was what they told me. Anyway, that loan is not what this review is about. The personal loan was easy to take out. Approval was timely and service was fairly decent. Not the best, but probably better than average. Everything was explained to me and any questions I had, the best I can recall, where answered adequately. To date, with both the personal loan and my checking account, I do not believe there is much to complain about. They did do away with their third party ATM fee reimbursement program some years ago, and that is something that should be held against them when considering how well banks are supposedly doing in this economy, but at least they aren't like some other banks who I shall not name here. All things considered, I will likely take out another loan from them if I ever need to do so in the future.

name: Jane M.
review: I have had this card for awhile now and am overall satisfied.  I use it as a back up for groceries when I just don't have the extra after rent and fuel.  I also use it a lot at Christmas to build up extra points.  The return policy is also a plus, having an extra 30 days to return something.  I only gave it 4 stars though because of the massive credit card hack they had a couple of months ago.  It was a major headache and I hope to never have that problem again!  At least customer service was great when helping to resolve the issue!

name: Nicole Thorp
review: I have had my Target store credit card for about four years now and I use it very frequently. I shop at Target about once a week at least and I always charge my purchases to my credit card. At the end of my billing cycle for the month I pay off my balance as I always have my maximum available credit ready to use. I have been very happy with my card and with the customer service. I have not run into any issues using my card, making my payments, or anything. I am careful to pay on time every month so that I do not incur any late fees. I do wish there were some "perks" available for being a loyal customer but so far I have not seen any. Otherwise I would recommend this card to anyone who is already a Target customer and satisfied with their stores and their service.

name: Ittu Mehta
review: "I'm not fond on overly detailed reviews so this will be an executive summary.Online Chat help either doesn't have the tools they need to answer simple questions or are illiterate. Site indicated products were available, but Chat said, "Not in stock" and when challenged about the discrepancy said, "There's a problem with that page." Duh.BTW, Chat was wrong; products *were* in stock. Duh.(I know that because I decided to believe that naughty page rather than Chat.)Fulfillment of order was OK.They charge a "Handling fee" if you use the provided shipping label but mention that only in the very fine print. Duh.We will not order from Nordstrom.com again and after this experience we're less likely to bother with their overpriced stores either. There are much better choices out there."On the other side fsession.com is far better from them.

name: Rob Logan
review: I have had this card for over 8 years and use it every month. Only once have I had a problem with them charging a late fee but a simple call in and it was removed. Great customer service and the savings is an even better bonus!

name: Marquise Jones
review: This is a great card and it's awesome that there is a rewards program in place to benefit from. Target allowing for free shipping online, discounts and much more is definitely a great perk. Cards that I've had in the past usually don't have perks like this and the interest rates are usually sky high.

name: Crystal Lynn
review: I have had a checking and savings account with TD Bank for 9 years now.  I love their online banking and how conveniently close their banks are (there are two within 15 minutes of my house.)  When I got married, we decided to open a joint checking account and TD was our pick.  It's so easy to transfer money from the joint to the single account or vice versa.  Overall, I am very happy that I use TD Bank.

name: Ermine Vita
review: I like having the Target Card because it's a great savings with the 5% discount. I am overall disappointed in the overall APR being so high. The website is easy for paying the bills, however, I find it a little frustrating that the store cannot look up the account if you do not have your card with you.

name: Kwame Yeboah
review: I recently opened an account with TD bank after leaving Bank of America. Can I just say, Wow?! TD bank is so much better at customer service it's ridiculous. They are open longer, are open on Sundays, and they make life so convenient  for their customers. While they are not yet in all U.S. states, they make up for that with their quality features and services. Fees are a little high, but i'm willing to pay them and I avoid them whenever possible. I can honestly say I'm so much happier after switching; it was definitely worth it.

name: Karina Chresler
review: I love having and using the Target Store card.  It took just a few minutes at the register to sign up and my purchases were immediately covered under the card's balance! I loved being able to add my two 18+ kids as members to my account because they had their own cards in their name and could use them in a case of emergency.  That's definitely peace of mind for a mom!  Taking care of the balance and payments could not have been easier.  The online site is very easy to use, but very secure.  You can also make payments at any Target store's customer service counter.  I never had a single problem with this card and found their customer service to be top-notch every single time I needed them.  The only caution I would give anyone is that the percentage rate is pretty high, so make sure you are able to pay it off each month, rather than let it go over into monthly payments.  Otherwise, you'll find yourself with a hefty balance that you may not be able to pay off easily.

name: Mel Wa
review: TD Bank is a very convenient and professional bank. They have many branches throughout the Metro- New York area.  They are open until very late(and also on weekends and holidays) compared to other banks.  They have a branch that is open with full service until 11:00pm. TD Bank offers a very efficient online phone app for the iphone or android devices.  With this app, you can check balances, deposit checks by taking a picture, and also transfer money.  Very professional 24/7 phone support is also a plus.  TD bank is definitely a very good bank and the way to go!

name: Brianna Byrne
review: I just recently moved to New York City and was looking for a bank that would suit my needs, since the bank I had didn't have any branches in the city. TD Bank, thus far, has been a great choice. One of the things that I love is that they're all around the city, so it's usually easy to get to a branch. Their check-cashing services, one of the primary things I've used them for, have also always been very pleasant and efficient. Also, the banks rarely seem very busy, the staff is always friendly and courteous, and, at the risk of sounding juvenile, I love the free pens and lollipops at the counter. Otherwise, it's been easy to sign up with them, and I've had absolutely no problems or unexpected fees. So in general, TD Bank seems a good choice, especially for people in a metropolitan area with many different branches like New York.

name: Theshack Ofsin
review: The Target Store Card is very fun for me!  There isn't a Target in my hometown, so when I want to go to Target it's a road trip, about an hour or so.
