That is always fun, and then once in the store there is so much that isn't in my local town that by having the Target Store Card I'm able to buy exactly what I want without hitting my debit card.  I always pay it off within about 25 days and it's smooth sailing.  I've never had a problem with their store or their credit service.  I totally recommend the experience!

name: James Kirk
review: I love using this card when I go shopping at Target! The Target Store Card really helps me save money since I shop there so much, and I like that you get 5% discounts for the Pharmacy as well as the normal 5% REDcard discount, because I live close and like to be a one stop shopper, haha.

name: Taylor Launchart
review: I love using my Target in store credit card.  I applied for it right after I bought a home, so my credit was not that great, but I was still approved.  The APR is rather high, but I pay it off before I incur any interest charges.  Even though Target has that fraud scandal, the 5% off and free shipping definitely came in handy this Christmas.  So many stores didn't have what I wanted in the actual store, but so many products are available online, so Christmas was a breeze.  It will also come in handy for the extra 30 days I have to return items.  I'm always late on those!  Overall I give this card a 4 star review.  It would be nice if it gave points or something for every time you use it, but it has still come in as a life saver!

name: Ashley Marshel
review: I signed up for a checking account at TD Bank because I had heard such good things about them. However, my experience was mostly negative. I found that there were so many hidden fees that I had no idea about when I signed up. When my balance went under the minimum amount required for less than a day, I was charged $15. When I signed up for a credit card, I was promised reward points. I had to call several different people for about a month before they gave me the points I was promised. They advertise themselves as being different but I found them to be just as greedy as the average bank. The one thing I like about TD Bank are the free coin counting machines. I think I'll be looking for a new bank.

name: Nicole Bedard
review: Nordstrom is one of my favorite stores to shop at. I can always find something there for both myself as well as for others. This card was a great choice for me because of that. There is no annual fee, and you also have a 25 day grace period when you sign up, which is amazing, not a whole lot of cards offer grace periods like this one does. You get an initial $20 credit just for signing up for the card- you don't even have to use it in order to get the free credit, which is really good, and something that not a whole lot of credit cards have to offer. A huge perk to me is the complimentary alterations. I am very small and am often finding myself having to make alterations on clothing so that they fit me properly. Additionally, you can get great customer service with this card, and points when you spend that can be used towards purchases. If you are a frequent shopper at Nordstrom, then this card is a seriously great card for you!

name: Chris Seidl
review: I have had a good experience with my TD bank checking account. Money from checks is deposited and made available instantly whenever I make deposits, which is a very convenient feature, and there are many TD bank ATMs in my area in Philadelphia, PA, which makes for convenient money transactions whenever I need them. The online banking system and phone application are also very secure and convenient, and make checking my balance easy either at home or on the go. I would recommend TD bank to anyone in the Philadelphia area or anywhere else where the bank has a noticeable presence.

name: Shayla Guthrie
review: I absolutely love TD bank! Every time I enter, I am greeted numerous times. Service is fast and personal and they even remember my birthday! The location is super convenient, and the hours are awesome! My dad is handicapped, and they always go way out of their way to cater to my parents. Even when the lobby is crowded, all is calm and everyone is still smiling. There is never at least not in my experience any negative energy around. In a small town, customer service is pretty personal, and you develop many friendly relationships with the people holding those positions.

name: Ryan Look
review: As a shopper of Target, even through recent publicized issues and other financial hardships, this card is wonderful. The never diminished 5% off on every purchase is great and a life saver. I have always shopped to save at Target and this card lets me save even more. Using this card I can save more money and time, as I no longer have to shop around for great deals as Target carries practically everything that you will ever need for everyday living. Best deal there is. Everyone should get this card.

name: Wendy Durbin
review: This card is super convenient since we are always shopping here.  I get what I need, pay with the card to get 5% off, walk over to the customer service desk and pay the bill.  Easy peasy!  I can also use the card for online orders with in store pickup.  It's not the lowest rate around, but if you pay your balance, no worries! The only thing I don't like is trying to access my account online with my smart phone.  Otherwise, this card is a keeper!

name: Gabe Benjamin
review: TD Bank is an absolutely great bank.  Their products are not necessarily anything super unique, but what definitely puts them over the top is their customer service and convenience.  For starters, this specific banking company has most of its branches open seven days a week.  If you have ever done any banking at all, you will know that this is an extremely rare, but extremely useful, characteristic for any bank to have.  Additionally, their Saturday hours usually go until mid-afternoon, unlike most banks that close around eleven or twelve on Saturdays.  Another really great thing about TD Bank is that they can create a bank account for you in a matter of thirty minutes, including giving you your debit card right there on the spot.  As if this wasn't enough, they also are quite good at helping you out with any specific problems you may have with your account.  Overall, I would say that I am very satisfied with this bank and definitely recommend it to others.

name: Chip Song
review: For the people who regularly shop at Nordstrom, this credit card is extremely useful.  Because the price point at Nordstrom seems to be higher than other stores, the rewards points will build up extremely fast.  You receive 2 points for every dollar spent and for every 2000 points earned, you receive a $20 gift card for Nordstrom.  You also get the benefit of earning 1 point for every dollar spent that is spent OUTSIDE of Nordstrom.  Therefore, you can receive even more benefits for gift card credit points.  Overall, this store card is most useful if you shop at Nordstrom a lot.  If you don't, it would be better to look elsewhere.

name: Sandra Dragon
review: I opened a Target Red Card when I was shopping on line and found a kitchen set that I wanted to purchase as a house-warming gift for my son who has just moved into his first apartment.  I was tipped off by one of Target's customer service people that if I opened a Red Card, I would get free shipping (my son lives in another state), plus I would receive 5% off the price which pretty much covered the sales tax.  I plan on keeping my card because I know I will be making future purchases at Target.

name: Denis Vegas
review: My wife shops a lot at Nordstrom so the Nordstrom Store Card was a no brainer. The double points on Nordstrom purchases are perfect for my wife since she spends a lot of money at that store. Plus the points can be converted back to cash which my wife uses to buy more clothes at Nordstrom.

name: Lindsay Whitehead King
review: I have this credit card, and I enjoy it.  5% cash back on all purchases all thetime is definitely a plus.  I love hassle free rewards.  The interest rate isn't greatat 22.9%, but if you don't typically carry a balance, the interest rate won'tmatter much.  I also love the free shipping option at Target which saves me evenmore money over the long term.  My capital One MasterCard did offer me a 12 monthintroductory interest rate at 0% which is great.  I would have liked to have gottena similar offer from Target when I first got the card.

name: Beverly Holland
review: Starting with the negative: The interest rate is high although not out of line with similar cards. Everything else is positive: Saving 5% on each transaction both in-store and online with no cap on how many transactions qualify for cash-back is a great feature. Free shipping is a wonderful draw and saves on purchases and gas for those who are used to picking up in-store in order to save on shipping. Receiving 30 extra days for a return is a plus as well.

name: Moriah Korey
review: I shop at Target very frequently so the Target Store Card is a definite must have for me.  If you use the card at Target or Target.com, you get a 5% discount on your purchases.  If you use the card online at Target.com, you can also get free shipping which is amazing and very convenient as Target often has sales and clearance items and coupons which can only be used online.  I hate paying for shipping so this card takes care of all of that.   Overall, I am very happy with my Target store card as I get pretty much all my groceries, electronics, toys and gifts at Target.  Sometimes I buy clothes as well so the extra 5% off you get for using the card can go a long way.

name: Andrew Lopez
review: All of our home shopping for groceries, cleaning supplies and everything is else done at Target, so it naturally made sense to get the Target Store Card.  This card provides very good discounts on select item purchases.  Another benefit is the extended return period.  One big complain I have with this card is the very high interest rate, but of course you can always go around that hurdle by paying monthly and not carrying balance to get slammed with interest.  Shopping at Target is a pleasure and using the Store card would be more fun if they offered decent APR, but I guess you can't always have too much of something good.

name: eric
review: The Target store card is probably the most useful credit card I've had yet. I frequent Target and the 5% discount off any purchase is a huge perk. There is no intro period, but as I frequently pay my full balance promptly, the 5% discount more than makes up for this.  I also love the convenience of being able to pay in the store. The card also makes returning items without a receipt a much less stressful undertaking. The billing statement is very detailed, and this makes it easy to really monitor my spending. I have not yet used it on Target.com, but it will be perfect to use for Christmas shopping, as it gives you free shipping. All in all, I am more than satisfied with this card.

name: Braden Blaettler
review: Target is my choice of big box retailer, so it is nice to see a decent store card offered by them! With the Target Store Card, you get 5% off you entire purchase every time you use it. It does not sound like much, but if you are a frequent patron of Target, then think of it this way: say you buy the majority of your supplies from Target and it costs you a total of $10,000 a year (hypothetically). At 5%, that is about $500 for that year. That is an extra $500 for whatever you might need it for. Not only that, but you also get an extra 30 days on returns and free shipping on the Target.com website. That is a pretty good deal if you ask me.

name: Cody DeLong
review: I have been banking with TD Bank for over two years now.  I originally switched over from another bank because I moved and needed to find one quickly, they had a great promotion going on to sign up so I went with them.  I go into my bank maybe once a week, but it seems like almost all the tellers have come to recognize my face and know be my name.  I like that feeling when going into a bank and they for sure provide it.  One issue I have with TD Bank is the ridiculous fees on checking and overdrafts.  They charge $35 per overdraft, $10 more than any other bank I have ever worked with.  They also have a fee every month on any checking account that doesn't have a minimum balance.  I think that is kind of ridiculous to say the least.  Another problem I had was when an International wire came in they were not able to tell me how the exchange rate was calculated or what the rate was that date.  I had to call customer service myself while there and then they were able to tell them directly.  All in all I can't complain about the rest and I'd recommend TD Bank to someone who wants to have an ATM no matter where they go in the North East.

name: Jeremy Stephens
review: Target is one of the few retail stores where I live so I naturally do most of my shopping there. As a result, the 5% discount I receive using my target card adds up to big savings each month.  The free shipping is nice if I can't find a particular item in the store. There is one ugly drawback to this card, unfortunately. Like most store cards, it has an interest rate that is much higher than that of other cards (almost 23 percent). If you are the type of person who wracks up large balances, this is not the card for you. On the plus side, the card does offer a 25 day grace period if you are late on payments.

name: Dwain Coufal
review: I love the Target Store card!  Who wouldn't want an extra 5% off ALL purchases - including sales and clearance items - every day you shop?  Plus, if you love shopping online, you'll always receive FREE shipping from Target.com, plus the 5% discount and any number of other discounts that might be available online!  The interest rate isn't the best in the world; but, it's about the same as almost any other store credit card.  Just pay it off each month and it won't be an issue.  So, if you shop at Target, it's worth it to use the Target credit card to save 5% off your purchases -- it adds up over the year!

name: Scott Bryant
review: The Target Store is a must for a frequent Target shopper or consumer. 5% off each time you shop at Target may not be a big deal, but think about it as basically shopping sales tax free each time you shop. That alone can save a lot of money over the life of the card. Additionally, with free shipping at Target.com, you're looking a lot of benefits over a rather basic card. The APR isn't outrageous compared to some cards, and if you remember to pay it off, the benefits are even better. Basically, if you just shop at Target even sometimes, this card is going to be worth your while

name: Andrea Leonard Targonski
review: I love my Target card! I use it all the time, you can't beat 5% off for buying things you'd buy anywhere. I love that I can use it online to get the discount AND free shipping. The interest rate is comparable, but I mostly use it and pay it off. I was hesitant to get this card and I'm so glad I did, I feel like I was wasting money for years before I had it. If you shop at Target regularly, you should really consider getting this card.

name: Anthony Polakos
review: I first got a basic checking account with TD Bank about 10 years ago (they were Commerce Bank then) when I had moved away from the area that my last bank served.  I signed up for a free checking account and still have the same account that I use as my main account.  It's a rarity these days that you can still find free checking accounts that aren't full of ridiculous restrictions.  In all the time I've been with TD Bank, I've never had a fee applied to my account...and that says a lot for banks these days! Recently, I decided to associate a basic savings account with my checking to keep emergency funds in (I have an online brokerage account elsewhere). I just wanted to keep an account that was liquid and allowed me fast access in case of an emergency (my car breaks down, etc...).I started the application for the savings account online, but because I had recently made an address change, it needed to be completed over the phone.  I called TD Bank's customer service line and was on the phone with a representative in minutes.  Imagine that!  I didn't have to wait for a half hour!  The very friendly representative had me set up with FREE savings account in a matter of minutes that was associated with my FREE checking account.  The requirements were very minimal and easily met my needs. In a nutshell, TD Bank is one of the few financial institutions that still seem to cater to a person as an individual rather than as a number.  From their AMAZING hours (7 days a week!) to the fact they have dog biscuits at the drive through window for your canine companions, they really take customer service to an entirely new level.

name: Amanda Villano
review: TD Bank has been my bank for about a year. The checking account options are very varied, and all a little cheaper than the competition - that's why I chose them! As a recent college grad, I knew that I wouldn't be able to afford high monthly fees for an account, nor a high monthly minimum balance that many other bank companies required. So, after doing research I decided on TD bank. I was able to easily set up my entire account online, at home. When I did run into some slight problems creating my online checking account, customer service was fast and helpful. They set things up for me in a short period of time and explained anything I didn't understand. After my first check took awhile to clear, they even waived the monthly fee for my balance dropping below $100. Great bank!

name: Destiny Camire
review: TD Bank is the best, most professional bank I’ve ever dealt with. They are always friendly and warm whenever I do business with them, and they really make me feel like a valued customer. Whenever I’ve had issues with payments that shouldn’t be on my account, TD Bank has always taken care of my problems promptly and always completely resolved whatever issues I might be having with my checking account. They are more than willing to sit down with me and help me with any issues I might be having. I am extremely satisfied with their high level of customer service and look forward to banking with them for many years to come.

name: Scott Bogle
review: If you live near a Target, like I do, you'll notice yourself shopping there more and more often. That's why I signed up for a Target store card. The Target REDcard's biggest benefits are definitely the 5% discount on purchases (basically like instant cash back) and the added benefit of free shipping when shopping online at Target.com. However, you definitely want to watch your balance because it has a high interest rate of 22.9%. So if you carry a large balance or let your shopping pile up, you're going to be paying off a ton of interest. But you definitely can't beat the 5% cash back for any Target purchases!

name: Joshua Wood
review: I signed up for a Target card when I was a Junior in college. I started taking advantage of that extra 5% off. This is where they got me. It was very quick and easy to not only sign up for the card, but also to continue using it. I shop at Target regularly, and I still use this card frequently, as the 5% off is still too tempting an offer to pass up. The interest rate on this card is more than fair, and I've never had a problem with making payments. Their customer service for cardholders is also very helpful. Overall, I've been very happy with this card.

name: Stela Gemes
review: I finally signed up for the Target store card about ten years ago while I was in my freshman year of college. I had put off doing so for years but finally did when I had a particularly large purchase and wanted the 5% discount. Signing up at the register when they asked me was very quick and easy. Using this card and paying it every month helped me establish my own credit as I got out on my own in college and after graduation. I still shop at Target regularly and use this card every time. I’m sure over the years I have saved quite a bit with the regular 5% discounts and always paying on time, just for buying regular things that I need.

name: John Richard
review: I really enjoy the Target Red Card Visa card, especially since it gives me 5% back on all Target purchases. Target is one of my most regular retailers, and they have an excellent array of merchandise, from clothing to electronics to groceries. The downside to this card is that at over 22% APR, the interest is too high. I once made an error of using this card for a cash advance, and I wasn’t able to repay the debt for many months. Also, the 5% offer is only on in-store purchases. There’s really no reason to use this card outside of Target.

name: Jeff
review: One of my favorite benefits of this card is the fact that I get an additional 30 days to return items to Target.  It is also nice that I get 5% off of all of my purchases with Target and Target.com.  Speaking of Target.com, you also get free shipping when you check out using your target card.  We buy most of our toiletries from Target and the 5% savings really comes in handy.  You can also stack your 5% every day savings with your 5% pharmacy rewards certificates and really save money on your prescriptions.    All in all, this is a great card to have in your wallet.

name: Verity Cushman
review: I've had my TD Bank checking account since 2012 which is a student checking account that  has worked well for me. I am currently a college student and needed an account that wasn't going to have too many fees. I have been pleasantly surprised at how much TD Bank has worked for me. I've had little problems with them and any I have had, have been resolved rather quickly. One thing I like is that there are so many TD Bank ATM's around where I live which makes it very convenient. My fiance and I also go to Canada a lot and there are many TD Bank's which means taking out money is awesome. Also, any time I've been out of the country, TD Bank has alerted me if any suspicious charges have come up. They are quick to call and will tell me directly what has occurred in case it was something I was aware of. I would highly suggest using TD Bank especially if you are a college student and need a reliable bank!

name: Gloria Jean Carlson
review: I have had the Target Card  for  about five years. I originally got it for holiday shopping and have continued to use it for not only holidays but also everyday shopping.  The 5%  bonus for everything bought is a great feature, but the best feature is the free shipping. I shop on line frequently and have saved a lot of money by using Target.  The prices are comparable to  other online stores and the selection and quality are top-notch. So choosing Target on-line is a no-brainer- you save in two ways- shipping and a 5% discount. Payments are easy. You can pay on-line, the way I like to do it, pay at the store, or mail your payment in.      All in all the Target card is a great deal.

name: Jon Fuller
review: The Target store card is the best on the market in my opinion. If you regularly shop at target, this is the card for you. It allows you to put all your purchases on one card, with no annual fee and fairly reasonable rates. You also get free shipping with online purchases from their website, which will save you a lot if you order things through Target normally. The 5% discount on purchases with the card is just icing on the cake. I much prefer this card to the Walmart store card, which has almost no benefits attached to it. This is an excellent card if you shop at Target a lot, and will save you a ton of money.

name: Val Milliron
review: The Target Store credit card is one of those things you purchase for one reason, and one reason only. The free shipping. I love to shop online, and with a little one at home find it to be the easiest way to get things done. So when I got a gift card to Target I went to purchase a few necessities online, and saw the CRAZY price for shipping. Though I did not need another credit card, I broke down and signed up. I appreciate the 5% off, though it doesn't make a huge difference to me. Also I always pay off my full balance so I don't pay to much attention to APR%.

name: Gregory Stancil
review: I've had a checking account with TD Bank for several years and I really love it.  They call it America's "convenient" bank and I definitely agree with this description.  First, I live in New York City and they have many branch locations, including one within walking distance of my house.  Second, they are open early and late which is really convenient.  One of of the things that I do not understand about banks is that most of them are only open during the business day which is a problem because most people are working during their regular business hours.  I like TD Bank because they are open before and after my "9-5" job as well as on Saturdays and Sundays which is really awesome.  Lastly, I love their coin collection service which allows me to throw all of my loose change into their machine and turn it into cash.  For all of these reasons and more, I really love TD Bank.

name: Jasmine Henning
review: I have been a customer with TD bank for over a year now and I have not had any problems so far. I have always had an excellent experience, and its always a happy atmosphere! Sometimes the lines are a little long, but they are always trying their best to help people , and as fast as they can! Setting up all my information at first was a little difficult but they were more than willing to answer any questions I had and explain things to me. I'm very happy with their low interest rates, and any banking I need to do online is really easy! Overall it has been a great experience with TD, and I will continue to use if they can keep their hard work up, it's really paying off, and their customers appreciate it!

name: Richard Thompson
review: The Target Store card offers a fairly standard but unremarkable 5% cash back when used at Target, with a middle of the road APR rate of 22.9%. However, where the card shines is in the free shipping offered when using it on Target.com, and in granting you 30 more days to return an item beyond the normal return policy. If you frequently shop online at Target then the savings from using this card would add up quickly. I can think of very few other store cards that offer this type of policy, and I'm hoping it's something other companies pick up on.

name: Bill Sweet
review: My experiences with TD Bank have been bad and good. Overall I would say they are a decent bank, just like the rest I guess. I opened an account with them about 4 years ago when they had the "No ATM Fee's" promotion. They have since taken that away...that is my only gripe with this bank. I left BOA for TD because they had ATM fees and it would cost me upwards of $5 to take money out because of the fee at the ATM itself, then the additional non BOA fee. Now TD has the same thing so i'm very displeased with this, especially since they do not have a lot of locations around where I spend my time and money. Doesn't make sense to leave now since its the same as every other bank. Just don't agree much with the "most convenient bank" slogan. It's not very convenient to spend $5 extra to take out $20...Their customer service is very good however so I guess it's an average trade off.

name: Hailey
review: I have been using TD Bank for about ten years now, and overall I've had good experiences. Customer service is always great, the facilities are clean and comfortable, and even as a full grown adult I always grab a lollipop on my way out of a branch. The problems I have with it are probably similar to most large national banks. First of all, I have a $14 monthly fee for keeping a checking account open. This seems ridiculous to me when other banks and credit unions charge nothing. And there have been times that I've over-drafted because of slow pending charges (my fault, most likely, but still...) and been charged $35 per transaction after the overdraft. If I were to use my debit card several times, even for very small purchases, on a day when I hadn't noticed my account had overdrafted, I could rack up $200 in fees quite quickly, with no sort of forgiveness or reimbursement from TDbank (believe me, I've tried!).

name: Joshua
review: I've been with TD Bank for several years now. Originally I opened an account with them when I was a student, and their student checking options were painless and fee free. Now that I'm no longer in school I have a regular checking account(TD Simple Checking) which has a low maintenance fee($4.99 with online statements only.) Customer service has always been fast and responsive, especially when my debit got stolen last year  and someone overdrew my account. It took a few days of dealing with their fraud department but the issue was quickly resolved once the process started. Their online banking system is one of the best I've ever used, and isn't confusing at all like the ones some other banks have. All in all my experience with TD has been just about perfect.

name: Silver Ghurka
review: The card is pretty handy. The %5 off on purchases adds up quick. I bought a bicycle and that ended up being an almost $10 savings which I really felt at the checkout! I haven't used it for mail order , but they advertise free shipping. I'm really cost conscious as it is, so %5 adds up in my book, as long as the balance is paid every month.

name: Amy Maney
review: The Target Red Card is one of the best store credit cards you can get.You do not need good credit to qualify for this particular card.They will approve you for a smaller credit limit if you have poor credit.The best thing of all is that every time you go into Target and make a purchase you automatically save five percent at checkout.I always look forward to Christmas and birthdays because i can save extra money going to Target and using this card and simply paying the bill off as soon as i can afterwards.This is a very useful card and i would strongly recommend it if you want to save a little money.

name: bob bolaown
review: TD bank formerly Commerce bank has been my bank since i have moved into the area with these banks, i have been with them for about 16 years now and couldn't be happier. Signing up with them was virtually painless and quick and easy as pie. I opened up a student checking and a savings, the student checking was great, no fees on anything and when it was done you just had to maintain $100 dollars to avoid the fee (every bank does this now a days). The checking was great and easy to maintain with some good interest rates. Every time I called about a weird transaction or fraudulent transaction they assisted me immediately and got it taken care off. 10/10 bank!

name: Kenneth Roberts
review: I love using my Target Red Card. It has been a great way for me to get extra savings at a place I already shop at. I continually save 5% every single time I go to Target, you just cant beat that! If you shop at Target I would highly recommend you getting this card. If you dont shop at Target you should start shopping there and get this card! It is easy to apply for too. I bought my TV at Target and instantly saved 5% it was amazing. I will never get rid of this card! I love it, go get it!

name: Jason Mercer
review: I have used the Target Red card for many years for Christmas shopping. Its great because most of the electronics and video games are the same price as other big box stores and the card gives you 5% off all of these things that you buy. I usually make my purchases and pay it off at the end of the month. Its a great way to do some early holiday shopping and pay if off when you have the money. I have also used this card in the past to buy a television for myself. The interest rate is high but its no more than any other store card that you get. If you shop at Target enough it is worth it to get this card.

name: Devan Parker
review: I have been a member of TD for about 4 years and only recently have I started to become disappointed with this bank. However, it is enough to make me want to leave. If they make a mistake, you get the blame. Recently, my boyfriend (this is not hearsay, I was with him through this entire process) was overdrafted multiple times for a charge that he did not take part in and when he complained, they took away the initial charge but refused to get rid of any of the overdrafts. I recently had an issue with my billing address and had a few accidental declined charges because of this, they were not helpful and frankly rather rude when I called for help. They only ended up helping me out when I threatened to leave the bank, as was the case with my boyfriend's situation. I really feel that they have become greedy and are making it difficult for people to budget when they leave pending charges in your account for days and days, or don't show a charge on your account until you've forgotten about it and then they overdraft you for it. I'm ready to get rid of my account there and move to an online bank like simple or gobank.

name: Justin Scott
review: The Target Red Card has been great for me. I have been using the card for about 6 months while shopping at Target roughly once a week, and it has saved me about $20 so far. It's nice to have for those larger purchases because it basically acts as an instant 5% off coupon. As a college student I have not needed to buy those big ticket items yet, but I know I will be needing some basic furniture and accessories for the apartment I plan on moving into next year. The regular APR of 22.9% is fair enough, considering that they allow you to make $35 minimum payments. If you think it's too high then be sure to make regular full payments. I have a few other credit cards, but I got a Target card to continue building my credit score. As an avid fan of Target (and an adamant hater of Wal-Mart) the 5% off feature is quite nice, and I certainly intend to continue taking advantage of the benefits while shopping at Target.

name: Avonn Tate
review: Three years ago I applied and received my Target card. It took around 3 weeks for it to arrive. I initially had a $500 limit and it has been increased since then. Some advantages of having this card is the 5% discount you receive on merchandise. And sometimes they have special coupons just for card holders. It's a good card to have but their customer service is horrible. I've had several problems with my bills, and needed someone to fix it. I called customer service and spoke to some of the rudest agents imaginable. Not only rude but incompetent, because they could not fix my problem. And the monthly interest rate on the card is high. It's a great card if you are a loyal target shopper, and can put up with rude agents.

name: Anita Garcia
review: The Target credit card did not really have any use for me until recent years. In the past, I did not shop enough at Target to often qualify for the percent savings card that I would receive in the mail. And when I did receive it often the time was limited to use it so it would often expire. However, recently they started a program where by using the card, you get five percent off every single shopping trip. So I started buying essentials there like the Target brand baby formula. Still every so often I do still get extra savings cards in the mail which sometimes come in handy.

name: Kyle
review: There really isn’t a reason not to sign up for a Target credit card.  There aren’t any fees and the 5% discount on anything at Target in stores or online is a great bonus.  This discount stacks on top of any promotions or sales that are going on and can really add up over time.  Another benefit is the free shipping for online purchase which can make online shopping much more convenient and cheap.  Be careful of the interest rates and be sure to pay off all purchase on time, because it can really add up.  Overall, this card is great and as long as you don’t carry a balance, the benefits are definitely worthwhile.

name: Nick Martocello
review: Amazing bank! I've been using TD bank since 2000 when they were Commerce Bank. They offer great services such like the basic checking, the student checking (up to age 25) where you get no charges on balance or ATMS. The credit card they offer is awesome as well as the point and cash back system. The customer service has always been prompt and polite (online, in person AND on phone). I lost my card on week, they canceled it and sent a new one and I had it within the same week! TD bank is definitely a great bank to use if you have one in your area.

name: Corey Schain
review: I absolutely love the Target credit card. 5% off everything from Target and target.com is incredible! Target sells everything from tv's to housewares and even groceries! The card also gives you an additional 30 days on targets return policy. Pretty nice. Free shipping from target.com is a great money saver as well. The APR is a tad high, but still lower than some of the other store cards I've had. If you are responsible and are able to avoid paying the interest, this card is a big winner.

name: Dan Diciaula
review: If you enjoy shopping at Nordstrom's like me and my wife do then this is the perfect card for you.  Initial sign up gets you $20 bucks credit on just a $100 purchase.  Plus for every dollar you spend you get 2 Nordtrom's points which translates to $20 dollars on every $1000 you spend.  Might not seem like much, but if you are going to spend $1000 there anyway over time you might as well collect the free $20.  With no annual fee and a 25 day grace period there is no reason not to have a Nordstrom Card if you do shop there.  Quality product, quality card.

name: Andrea Leonard Targonski
review: I have had a simple checking account with TD Bank since they acquired Commerce Bank a few years ago. It’s been a relatively average experience. We used to not have ATM fees but they started charging $2.50 per ATM transaction (not at a TD Bank ATM) a little while back. But the hours are great, there are bank locations practically on every corner and there are no other fees as long as we maintain a  $100 minimum balance, or overdraw our account, which we’ve never done.  There are other perks to being a TD Bank customer: they have free coin counters at many locations, you can purchase Visa Gift Cards at no extra charge, etc. Overall we have had a good experience.

name: Sam West
review: One of my first credit cards was the Target card.  I was young, and had a limit of something tiny like $200.  The interest rate was nothing great, and there were very few perks.  I found myself using it for daily items, like toothpaste, toilet paper, etc.  I would pay it off at the end of the month.  The one time I had to return something outside of the standard 30 days, the REDcard saved my butt.  The perk that I wasn't aware of was the extra 30 days that they allow for returns.  I would sign up for this card again.

name: Tatiana Joseph
review: I think the card is really good because I like to shop online at Target.com and it gives you free shipping so that's a really good thing and plus I get a %5 discount so that way I can at least save a little bit of money. And also if I need medication this is good to use at their pharmacy. If there is something I want or need to return this card is also good for that.What I don't like about it is they don't have any bonus  you can earn.With the Wal Mart store card they have a $25 bonus so that's really good also you can use it to save on gas

name: Amanda guillette
review: I just recently opened a second bank account. I have an account with a credit union as well, but wanted to open an account with a big name bank as well, so when I'm ready to buy a house, there might be more options for me. So far, TD Bank seems to be acceptable in most areas. the application process was very simple, even though my name popped up in that awful Chexsystems thing. However, I had fixed that issue a while ago, and TD Bank was very amiable working with me and sorted out the issue right away. The only thing I have to say is, that like many big companies, customer service is terrible when you call. I refuse to call the 800 number and just call the branch I use instead, as they actually know my account and know what they are talking about. I don't know how long I'll keep this account, but so far, so good.

name: Jameson Smith
review: I'm a new member of TD bank but so far I really like what they have to offer.  Their hours are far superior to all of the other banks I have ever used before.  I get so irritated at big banks working such specific hours and it makes things difficult when you have a problem that you need to take care of.  I don't experience that nearly as much since becoming a member here.  Their customer service is very good and I have been pleasantly suprised when I had to talk to their customer service over the phone.  I enjoy banking with them but my only complaint is I just wish there were more locations around my home town but maybe if they continue to grow there will be.

name: Lily He
review: I love the Target RED card. My mom and I each have our own. My best friends all have one because we hang around Target (college kids, you know how we are) and shop for our dorm needs. You get 5% back on purchases compare to 1% of Wal-Mart Store Card. The return is 30 days and it's easier with a RED card because it makes you seem more credible rather than the cashier giving you the stink eye because they think you just brought to try out. This is not my main card but I do use it whenever I am at Target.

name: Lori Rogers
review: Target RedCard is great because 5% is taken off purchases at Target immediately. All of my other credit cards are only 1% cashback rewards. Also, Target returns are the easiest, without a receipt, simply providing the Target RedCard and merchandise, the amount I paid for item I am returning is applied back onto my credit card. Very easy! Target was the first to make returns this easy. The Target REDcard also offers all of the online conveniences such as bill pay, shopping, and free shipping. I pay the bill in full monthly, so the interest rate really doesn't apply to me. I am very satisfied with this credit card!!

name: Jay Freiheit
review: My wife and I both have a Target REDCard. They have a nice discount that you get right away off your purchases at the register. The card is relatively easy to attain, we've had ours for awhile and it was before we had much of a credit history. It is very easy to manage your Target card online and make payments or check your balance there. Applying for the card online is a very simple process as well. The interest rate is the one thing about this card that I don't care for much (it is 23%) but it's still a useful card, especially considering how many different items one can purchase at Target. I would recommend the Target REDCard to anyone that is considering applying for a store credit card.

name: Veronica
review: I have very mixed feelings about TD Bank. I currently do have a savings account still with them, but I haven't been 100% happy with them. For starters, their customer service is horrible. Whether I try to get in touch with someone on the phone, or go there in person, It's always a hassle. No matter what branch I go to, the lines are always ridiculous, probably due to the popularity. However, there has never been a serious issue with my money being in a savings account with them, and they do offer me a students savings which is extremely convenient for me. They do what they are supposed to do, the only main problem is hoping that I never have an issue because It's impossible getting in touch with anyone there. I'd probably recommend using another bank.

name: Stephen Marth
review: I am a huge fan of the Target REDcard because it's a great tool to use to save money at the store. The 5 percent discount on items at the store is a huge perk, especially when I intended on using a debit card to begin with -- I can simply pay it off immediately and reap the discounts. They also offer it to people that might not have the best credit, which you don't see much these days. Another great feature is that there are zero fees and no point systems that will confuse you. You use the card, you get the discount. It can't be any easier than that.

name: danielle
review: When I had a checking account with TD Bank its was a simple and very featureless account. The customer service was very good, and when I had to travel internationally it was very easy to access my account when told them I was traveling. However, compared to other banks the checking account may as well have been a shoe box under my bed. Absolutely no interest or innovative features to be found. Otherwise, the customer service more than made up for such no thrills banking. It was also very easy to replace a lost or stolen card. You just walk right in and they print it up for you, my only complaint about the card was that it was flat with no raised numbers.

name: Michael Staino
review: Compared to its competitors, the Target REDcard is a great credit card option.  Wal-Mart only offers 1% cash back, and Amazon only offers 3% cash back.  The REDcard gives you a 5% discount right at the register.  No waiting, no nothing.  Simply swipe and watch the total drop.  If I was a Wal-Mart shopper, I may just switch stores.  And if you use your Target credit card on their website, you get free shipping on top of the 5% discount.  This card is a must have for any Target shopper.  Obviously, if you are not a Target shopper, you don't need this card.  But with all of these savings, maybe you should become one!

name: Sarah
review: The Target Store Card is one of the better in store credit cards available, especially when you consider it against cards from similar stores. You get 5% back on purchases right off the bat, as opposed to the pitiful 1% maximum that the Wal-Mart Store Card offers. The card is also available to people with "Fair" credit scores, making it much easier to get approved than similar store cards. The rewards come in really handy, especially if you already get a discount at the Target pharmacy, and the card has a decent grace period for late payments. Overall a really worthwhile card to sign up for.

name: Gary Cazorla
review: I really like shopping at Nordstrom, and getting rewards to shop somewhere I would anyhow is great!  Typically I go to the Nordstrom Rack that is near me, I really love the deals there and love their selection of shoes and jeans especially.  It is very easy to gain points and sometimes they offer days where you get double or even triple points for every dollar spent.  There are also other perks such as $100 of free tailoring every year which is great for me, since i always tend to need things cut just a bit.  If you like superior clothing, and like to shop at Nordstrom, this card is a no brainer!

name: Laura
review: This card is great on principle if you shop at Target much, since you get a 5% discount on all purchases made in the store with it. Since I have a Target near my house, I find myself using my Target RED card frequently. It's fairly straightforward and easy to understand the basics, unlike some store cards that opt to use a point system. The Target card is easy- there's no membership fees, you save money on purchases, and get free shipping online. The minor inconvenience of having yet another card is worth it, overall. Highly recommended for a regular Target shopper!

name: Ben Matthews
review: The Target RED Card is one of the best store cards out there.  Mainly because Target has so many things at great prices, and they offer 5% back just by using their card.  There are other perks too such as 30 extra days for returns, and free shipping at Target.com too.  But the main way this card shines is the 5% back on all purchases.  You can also get an additional 5% back for a total of 10% back at the Target Pharmacy.  Every little bit helps, and with the Target RED Card you'll be seeing some additional savings at Target that you can't get with any other card.

name: Telise Maquaire
review: Target is a fine niche store in my opinion. It's higher end than Walmart but doesn't bust the budget. I use my Target Red card for most of my purchases and have done so for 20 years. The discount, applied at the register, of 5% is a great deal and effectively negates most of the tax charged in Florida. I have had the same card for a long time; with no expiration and never have to worry if it is "good." I pay my card online at the Target site, automatically and have not had an issue with the payments. Although, sometimes I pay cash at Target, it's nice to know I have my good Target card in my wallet should I wish for a discount and always have it available!

name: Sam Madison
review: I  have owned a Target Red Card for a year and use it weekly. The extra 5% is the main reason I own and use the card. Because of the extra 5% discount, I purchase my toiletries and household cleaners at Target. The sales tax in my area is also 5%, so it makes me feel good to save that money on items I was already going to purchase. Another benefit of the card is I have used is the free shipping for target.com. Target sometimes carries video games on target.com that they do not feature in store, so I've used the free shipping a few times for those items. Overall the so the card has been hassle free, so it hasn't required me to call customer service for assistance. It's the only store card I currently use and I don't expect that to change.

name: Alexis Beth
review: The Nordstrom Store Card is the best card I've ever had. Perks, bonuses, and rewards, oh my! I'm honestly surprised by the mixed reviews here. Nordstrom, to me, really knows how to take care of their customers and this card just bumps it to the next level. Complimentary alterations are a huge perk, especially for women like me who are petite and don't fit right into jeans off the hanger. Their point system is great and earning is very easily done! Their discounts and special shopping days add even more appeal to spend and use the card; it's a total win-win!

name: Brian Moon
review: This card offers a discount on things at Target, so that's a good thing. This discount stacks on the pharmacy discount given on another customer-appreciation card, so that is also good. They don't charge an annual fee; recurring fees are generally a bad thing, but you don't often find those on store cards, so this is a wash. The grace period is a so-so, iffy 25 days on purchases before interest is charged, and the interest rate is a relatively high 22.9% APR. But if you buy a lot of things at Target this would be a decent card to have, if you don't have access to any other, better rewards credit card or are just starting out in the world of credit.

name: Hero Herroo
review: We shop at Target fairly often. We go for groceries, clothing, Kids items, school items and some home items. Saving 5% every time we go there adds up pretty quickly. We'll often see if we can find something at Target before we get it from somewhere else to see if we can save money on it. Our other credit card is a Capital One rewards card and we only get 1.5% back on that card. We've never had to return anything but the 30 extra days return policy is a great to have should we ever need to. It's also helpful to be able to see how much we spend at Target each month and then you really see what you are saving with that 5%.

name: Aaron Fung
review: I've always been a regular shopper at Target, so getting a credit card here with a 5% discount was a dream come true. You wouldn't believe the savings 5% makes after a years worth of usage. All of my purchases, little or small, I use this credit card when shopping at Target.So whenever I go looking to buy something, I always factor in that 5% discount Target RED card users get.Its a discount you cant beat!!With its easy to pay online, I never have to call their 1800 number or e-mail my payments. It doesn't get better than that!Another plus is getting FREE shipping on all online orders. And that is on top of the 5% discount you already get!!It honestly pays to be a Target RED card holder.Really secure and well worth it. A+++

name: Mike Ashley
review: I do NOT leave reviews for any products or services online. I just don't. But after leaving Target today i was compelled to come online and share some insight for those who might not know. The Target RedCard is awesome. Today, my bill at the register was over $400 and with one swipe of the Redcard, it was cut by over $20! And all I have to do is come home , go online, and pay my balance, and I am done! This year alone, I have saved almost $300 and I have not spent a dime in interest! And not to mention how simple returns are when you pay with the Redcard. No matter what the item is, you do not need a receipt when you return it if you payed with your card! No waiting in long lines like at Wal-Mart, Just  a simple, I want to return this, swipe card, refund issued. As simple as that! I love the Redcard!

name: Donald Pinckney
review: I do love the Target Store Card for frequent shopping at Target. The 5 percent cash back on all purchases  in store or online is nice for some of the larger purchases that I have to make. Also they include free shipping online which is just an added bonus including everything else. Target also price matches most other stores which makes the purchases cheaper when you include using your Target Store Card.

name: abigail lee
review: The nordstrom credit card only gives you $20 initial bonus when you spend $100. The bonus is low compared to all the other credit cards out there. For a big department store, I would expect nordstrom to give at least $100 bonus for signing up. The good benefit of having this card is that you get a special sneak preview of the annual sale that they have in the summer. Other than that, it's just an ordinary credit card. Not too big on discounts besides the annual sale. The customer service at nordstrom is great and you can't really beat that. If you shop at nordstrom a lot, then this is a good credit card for you.

name: Sheryl Papageorgio
review: The Target Store Card is an absolutely must have if you frequently shop at Target.  Even if you don't shop their often, it's still good to have in your wallet.  You get 5% back on all purchases every day both in store and online.  No other card can come close to competing with that kind of savings.  While there are some nice additional perks such as the extended return day window, I primarily use this card for the 5% back.  I have other cards that give me 5% in some categories during select quarters (which I always forget to activate!), but the Target Store card offers 5% back all the time which is what I love about it.

name: chris
review: The Target Store card is a great card to have in your wallet.  You get 5% off of any purchase made in store or on the website, making it a great way to save some cash on pretty much anything, especially if you have a target with a grocery store near you.  The free shipping from the online store is also a nice bonus, as those costs can really add up.  The downside to the Target card is that the interest rate is not very competitive, so your savings can vanish quickly if you're not on top of making payments.  Still, the flat 5% savings is a step above comparable stores, making this a great credit card to have.

name: Megan Makaylia
review: We LOVE our Target card!. We signed up for it on a whim when my husband was working at Target Mobile, and then once we started using it, we realized it was such a smart choice. We love the 5% off, and the free online shipping. We have never had any issues with the card at all. There have been so many times where I've been looking for something, found it at WalMart, but bought it at Target because of the discount and the free shipping. We also enjoy using the extended return period. With having a newborn, its great to buy diapers, and then return unopened boxes once he moves up a size. We completely recommend the RED card!

name: Nick
review: I've had TD Bank for years now.  They always have great customer service, and are always very helpful when I visit a branch.  I only have a couple of gripes, the first being the wait times.  They have the capacity at most branches to have 6-10 tellers at once, and I rarely see more than 2, no matter how busy it is.  This is especially annoying when I try to go the bank after work or on my lunch break, but thankfully they are open late so I can at least get my banking done by the end of the day.  My other issue is the ATM fee.  If I don't use a TD ATM, not only am I charged the ATM surcharge, but TD charges me a surcharge of I believe $3.00. It might be $2.00, but I've avoided non-TD ATMs like the plague for the past 3 years.  Regardless, it make an ATM transaction $3.50-$5.00 on top of what I am taking out.  Other than those two things, the bank is very convenient and quick.

name: Sarah Conroy Bordeaux
review: I like this Target credit card a lot! I just got it and compared to my walmart credit card it saves me more money. Since Target and Walmart are about the same store, it really doesn't matter to me what store I use. It just matters which one is cheaper. The Target credit card gives me 5% off everything in the store and the Walmart credit card gives me 1% cash back. Which isn't even close in comparison. All the other feature are about the same. So, for me the easy decision is the Target credit card because of the great bonus in savings.

name: Faque Phaek
review: I really like that this card has no membership fees AND it doesn't require some convoluted points system (e.g., the Walgreens card) in order to enjoy savings. I also really like the face that it extends your return period. As someone who shops at Target regularly (there is one much closer to my home than a Walmart or any other "box" store other than a Walgreens, I can't believe that I waited as long as I did to get the Target card. I just assumed, as with many store cards, that there was some hidden gimmick or that the terms would be too complicated to actually be useful. I was wrong!

name: Jack Buck
review: Having used Target as the main 'nip to' store for years I finally succumbed to the usual clerk patter of 'why not sign up for our red card.' I can honestly say it was the best decision I could have made. Despite being a regular at Target, I did not realize it gave a 5 percent discount on almost all my purchases. I combine this with instore Target coupons and manufacturer coupons and quite often I end up paying almost nothing for my household supplies. The other great benefit is the Target Red card also allows you to donate up to 1 percent of your purchase price to a K-12 school of your choice. So now I can stock up and help our daughters' schools. With 3 children that is the least I can do for their education.

name: Nick
review: I had a very bad experience with this card.  I used it one time for a purchase of some groceries and general goods. I paid it off within a week and thought that was fine. I get an e-mail about a month later telling me that I never paid it and they're trying to collect a debt from me.  I call in and they told me the debit card I used to pay for it had the wrong information (I had saved it and it did not).  I ended up having to pay the bill over the phone, and I still get a monthly e-mail telling me to pay my balance of $0.00.  Irritating, frustrating, and awful customer service.  I'm in the process of canceling mine.

name: Stephanie Hughes
review: My Target store card is the only dedicated store credit card in my wallet.  The benefits to the card are incredible.  With 5% back on purchases, it's great for everyday shopping (those everyday needs like batteries, light bulbs, cleaning supplies, etc.)  I always purchase my necessities from Target with my store card and pay for them at the end of the billing cycle - it's like getting some of my necessities for free, and who doesn't love free?I'm also at a time in my life when all my peers are getting married and having children, so I'm buying a lot of wedding/baby shower gifts, and being able to find their Target registry online, shop for a gift, and get it shipped for free thanks to my Target store card makes things so simple when trying to juggle all life's obligations!The extended return window (you have an extra 30 days on purchases) is great come Christmastime when I may shop for clothing only to find out my husband or daughter needed a different size in something.  With a growing kindergartner, this is a true blessing.I would recommend the Target RED card to anyone who does any amount of shopping at Target - the benefits make this card a must!

name: Michele Garofalo
review: Target credit cards are awesome. I’ve had my card for about 3 years now.  It’s a very easy and convenient way to pay for all my purchases.  They offer 5% off all items when you use the card.  They also offer free shipping when you purchase items from their website using the Target card.  I use it for all my purchases from groceries to clothing to electronics.  It’s great!  Returns are also super easy.  If you don’t have your receipt,  just hand them your card and all the information is stored.  Quick and easy returns credited right back to your card.  This is a must have if you’re a Target shopper like me!

name: M H
review: The Target store card has great benefits that are comparable to most other store cards..  I have other store cards such as Walmart and Gap cards, and their terms and rewards are similar to Target.  The cash back rewards of the Target card are preferable in my opinion as I tend to prefer that type of reward system.   The interest rate is a bit lower than most store cards as they usually are for the subprime market.  I would consider getting this card and would recommend it to someone who shops at Target as the rewards are excellent for this card type.

name: John Smith
review: Target has always been one of my favorite stores for everyday shopping needs. When I saw that they offered a credit card with a 5% discount, I jumped on the opportunity, applied and was quickly approved. Over the years I have saved thousands by using my Target store card and still use it on a regular basis. In addition to the amazing savings, I have been able to build my credit using this card, and it has boosted by overall credit score. I would recommend this card to anyone who shops at Target, whether just occasionally or on a regular basis.

name: Philip Nguyen
review: I have had the Nordstrom credit card since 2005. I love this card. It is very convenient. I can use it online or in store without annual fee. Unlike a Visa or Master card, I can only use this card at the Nordstrom store or online so I can control my spending.  I do not pay any interest on this card since I pay my balance off every month. I like customer service. They are available to answer any questions you may have. They are very friendly and knowledgeable. I am highly recommended to anyone to look for a Nordstrom credit card.

name: Chris
review: Back when I was trying to build up my credit, which I had neglected for years and years, I went and signed up for the Target Store Card, which surprisingly I was approved for. The card is fantastic if you purchase anything from target. It offers no annual fee and really no fees at all. The best thing about it though is the high 5% cash back on all purchases at target. This makes this card very attractive and if you can buy a lot of your household items there, you can save so much. I used to use this card all the time until I got approved for regular rewards credit card. I highly recommend this card if you shop at target a lot.

name: Kathleen Morris
review: The Nordstrom credit card seems to be a decent card for people who regularly shop at Nordstrom. The best perk of having this card is the point system, that eventually gets the card holder a $20 gift card after they have earned 2000 points (or spent roughly $1000 to $2000). This card is also a VISA card, which means that it can be used wherever VISA is accepted.This card seems to have the same terms as another card I have, the GAP card. The idea about having the points is the same, although GAP gives points for every $50 you spend.  The negative aspects about both the Nodstrom card and the GAP card are that if you have bad credit or if you make a late payment, you will have a very high interest rate. Overall, I would only recommend getting the Nodstrom card if you shop there regularly. Otherwise, it serves no purpose for you.

name: Edward David
review: Nordstrom Credit Card is nothing really special but its your average store brand credit card. It gives you double points when you shop at Nordstrom, one point per dollar when you shop at other stores. Every 2000 points accumulated gets you a pretty standard gift card bonus. Apparently theres promotions or gifts they send you throughout the year which seem to make the card pretty worth your while if you shop constantly at Nordstrom. They are an expensive store so points will accumulate quickly anyway. APR is decent and might be better than average cards, so its definitely worth it to pick up if you shop frequently with Nordstrom or Nordstrom rack.

name: David Bishop
review: Like most store cards, the Nordstrom Credit Card is quite limited, this one in seemingly random ways. It does offer those with great credit the opportunity to have a good rate, so it is somewhat usable as a reward card/regular credit card. However, balance transfers aren't allowed and there are no introductory interest rates. Also, the Nordstrom Credit Card has a pretty weak reward plan, but unlike something like the Valero Card, it's at least useful for something. This card is ok if you like Nordstrom and shop there frequently. Otherwise, I'd go for a more bare-bones credit card with a good rate and no fees, like Slate by Chase.

name: Alexa LaMontagne
review: The Nordstrom Credit Card seems to be no different than many other credit cards in the market. While I do like the $35 maximum late fee, the rewards system leaves a lot to be desired, especially since the only reward is a Nordstrom Note. Earning the points seems rather straightforward (rather than having to remember which percent goes with which purchase) but at a 1-1 dollar/reward dollar ratio, it is low compared to other cards. Personally, I would look for another credit card that offers more in terms of rewards, and is more flexible in the rewards given. Not a bad card, just not for me.

name: Lamp Lampington
review: Target is a fantastic store to have one of these specific store cards. Not only is target the best store in my area to go to for a variety of products, including basically everything from produce to electronics, but they also have this awesome savings card to make it even better shopping there. This card not only gives you 5% off every in store purchase, but also give you free shipping on all purchases from the target website. I really haven’t seen a store card that gives deals as good as this. Honestly, if you are going to get any store card this should be the first one you consider.

name: Rick Smith
review: As a college student, I enjoy having the Target red card as it saves me 5% on all my purchases at Target. 5% may not sound like a lot, but it really does add up. It saves me money on simple groceries, clothes, and schooling needs. Plus, on top of the 5% off, you get free shipping when you order things online! That alone saves me a lot of money! The APR is kind of high, but most reward cards do have a high APR. As long as you pay it off in time, it's absolutely no problem. I've been using this card for a half a year now and haven't had a problem yet with missing a bill. If you're one who shops at target a lot, definitely look into getting this card!

name: Mara Lovelace
review: I love my Target card.  I love getting the 5% cash back bonus on everything in the store, which – since I’m a new first time mom – is a LOT of things!  I can get diapers, baby wipes, my cleaning goods – all at 5% less than even Amazon would charge.  It’s also easy to manage your payments on the website, or even on a mobile device – which is what I typically end up doing because I forget to pay until the very last minute.  I’ve never had a problem with any payments going missing, which has happened to me at other box stores!  I think the Target card is a great tool that helps me scrape a little off my budget each month – I highly recommend it to anyone.

name: Tim Clodfelter
review: "I Laughed, I Cried! It Was Better than Cats! I'm going to see it again and again!"

name: Peter Gibson
review: I love the Target card, and all of the benefits it has provided. It is one of the absolute few store credit cards that I feel comfortable owning and using. When I had initially signed up for it, I was surprised at how easy the whole process was, and how quickly I was approved afterwards. The extra 5% discount on all my purchases whenever I shop at our nearest store is a great feature. Online purchases benefit from the card as well, as it has provided free shipping. It isn’t all sunshine and rainbows however, the interest rate on the card is higher than most other credit cards. So use it at your own discretion. That said, I do recommend this card for anyone looking for amazing savings who can manage the interest rate.

name: Sheryl Greiner
review: I love using the Target red card for a couple of reasons.  First of all, you save 5% on all of your purchases at Target simply by using the card.  None of my credit cards give me that much cash back, especially at Target.  I also love that it extends the return window to 30 days which I have taken advantage of a few times before.  Other than that I pay off my balance every month so I don't have to worry about paying any interest charges for the purchases I make.  If you shop frequently at Target, getting this card is a no brainer.

name: Mary-Lou Jenkinson
review: I love this credit card almost as much as I love Nordstrom.  I have shopped at Nordstrom for years but never had their credit card.  I was offered an application about a year ago while shopping at Nordstrom.  I applied for it and am pleased as can be.  I was approved quickly and the interest rate makes me a very happy shopper.  I am usually able to pay off my credit cards monthly but when I can't you can't beat the low interest rate for this card.  Keep up the good work Nordstrom.

name: Daniel Barakh
review: For me personally, I really needed this card and loved it. But, it is not for everybody. Some people who have really good credit can get a better card that has a higher return percent and lower interest. But for those with bad credit, like me, this card was a life saver. Again, it does not make sense to get the card in terms of pure rewards back potential. But, the basic store only version of this card has lower credit requirements than a major credit card otherwise would. So, it really helped me build up my credit when most other companies wouldn't. Also, I really love shopping at Nordstrom, especially with their return anything anytime policy. So for me personally, it made more than a ton of sense to get this card. I got it 2 years ago and still use it to this day and never once regret it.

name: BCfan Border
review: Target is one of my favorite stores and using their card to make my purchases not only gives me money back in the way of discounts, it helps me when I need something that I just don't have the money for at the time, such as groceries.  I have used it to replace a vacuum cleaner that stopped working.  If I had to wait for the money to buy it, my house would have been a mess but I was able to go in to Target, get a new one and save 5% on my purchase.  The Target card terms are very fair and I am able to pay off balances fairly quickly.  Target has everything I need or want for my home and having the Target card makes it possible for me to get what I need when I need it.

name: Jonathan Phillips
review: I've use my Target card weekly for the last couple of months.  It's great because I was already doing my shopping there but now I just get an extra 5% off.  Every penny counts!  I really like how my local target has expanded to have groceries as well.  The less places I have to drive to on the weekend means more time with my family.  The pharmacy at my target is great too, and with the stacking 5% off that makes a huge impact on the cost of our medications.  Being able to pay your credit card bill in the store is also convenient if shopping at target is your weekly routine.

name: Daniel Lopez
review: I picked up my Target RED card about 2 years ago and I’ve used it the most for my household needs.  With this card, I not only support my daughter’s school but I also get 5% off any purchase I make with it.  This alone comes in handy around the holiday season when most of my larger purchases are made.  If I have any complaints it’s that making payments on the website are a hassle for me because sometimes it won’t post and it seems like I’ve skipped a payment.  The customer service on this issue is always a big help and instead, I just pay directly from my bank account or pay in store whenever I remember.

name: Somer Adams
review: I have had my Target credit card for 6 years now and I have to say it has to be my favorite.  I love that for every purchase I make I will get 5% off automatically. The fees are not that bad either for a store credit card.  I also love that a percent of all the purchases I make with my card goes directly to my sons school.  Target has made it so easy and convenient to shop at their stores due to the flexability of payments.  They also offer the same 5% off if you sign up for their debit card as well.  This way I am able to split my purchases if I want and still be able to get the savings all around.  Yeah!

name: Chu Filson
review: I started using the Target Red card when I was about to make a rather large purchase of 6 bicycles and several other Christmas presents.  When the cashier asked if I would like to get 10% back on my purchase if I signed up for the card right then, I couldn't pass it up.  So, I did and saved quite a bit.  Now, I use the card when I buy my groceries and other regular purchases because it is so convenient.  I do pay it off each month, however, because I don't like paying interest to anyone. Target is a great store, and having their Red card is very convenient and easy!

name: Estela Rounsville
review: I’ve used the red Target gift card many times in the past. I notice at different times they’ve done innovative things with their card.  I remember one card version had a computer chip right on the card!  I have had no issues with using Target’s card, and I love shopping there.  I would definitely recommend them in the future, and pay attention to specials on interest rates.  Sometimes you can get a deal.  I’ve had no worries with the purchases I’ve made there, and they seem to goes right through when processing payment.  Target “generic” brands tend to be pretty good quality, especially their cough drops and picnic supplies. Thumbs up!

name: Barbara Felice
review: I've been using a Target RED card since 2002 and I honestly think its one of the most convenient cards there are. It not helps with gift and home furnishing purchases but now since they started selling groceries, If I run short on cash for the month, I can buy my groceries at Target. They are one of the only ones around me that even carry Tassimo cappuccino. I have to drive a good 20 minutes but its worth it because they carry a wide variety of it. The RED card that I have has a limit on it (by choice) to keep me in line with my allowed budget each month.

name: Marla Singer
review: I finally gave in last week when the cashier offered the Target RED card after refusing hundreds of times, and I am so glad did.  We shop at Target all the time, so the 5% off our purchases will be a great help.  The main perk that grabbed my attention is the free shipping for online orders.  I don't like crowds much and find better selections online in this day and age.  Much of my gift shopping is done on the internet, but I tend to stay away from sites with shipping fees.  Thanks to the RED card I have a whole new online store with some of my favorite brands to shop from!

name: Rebecca Hampton
review: I love saving 5% every time I go to Target. This card does really feel like free money. When I worked at Target, it was nice to have 5% on top of my already 10% employee discount. However, even 5% makes a difference. Using this card is easy, and getting 5% off instantly for each purchase is easier than keeping track of the complicated rewards systems that other store credit cards use. However, as with any store card, opening a new credit card lowered my credit rating. I would not recommend this card if you are planning to get any loans, buy a home, etc. in the next year or so, because the 5% discount is really not worth the short-term damage to your credit score overall.

name: Mindy
review: I'm a starving college student. That is, I need to save as much money as humanly possible. The Target RED card helps me achieve that! There's a Target right next to campus, so it's no hassle at all to walk over there whenever I need to. I shop at Target all the time now, so it made sense to get the RED card and save 5% every time I buy something. It especially helped at the beginning of the school year, when I bought things like a mini-fridge and a new TV, because 5% off of those items was quite a lot! Thanks Target!

name: Bernadette Prall
review: I really like using my Target RED card because I get 5% off my purchases at the register.  I also get a lot of coupons from Target because of it.  Sometimes there are pharmacy coupons as well.  The card can help track pharmacy purchases.  I don't use that much but I think it is a great added bonus.  I think this card has also helped me improve my credit.  Instead of paying for my purchases at the time I pay when I get my credit card bill.  Additionally it helps me see how much I'm really spending at Target.  It can also be helpful when you haven't gotten paid yet and need something right away.  I ran out of printer ink on the tax deadline and Target was open and had what I needed.  I didn't have to figure out how to pay since I had my card.

name: Lyndsay Deadwyler
review: I found out and signed up for this card when I was shopping at a Nordstrom Rack. I’m happy that I decided to sign up because it’s a fun ‘Fashion Rewards’ card. You rack up points on every dollar spent and then receive Nordstrom’s notes in the mail to spend anywhere in the world, even online. You can even set up your own special points day where you earn triple the points on all purchases made, but unfortunately the triple points don’t work with Louis Vuitton purchases which is where I was hoping to make a big savings.  There are also other bonuses you get with the card such as comp alterations and concierge services.  If you shop a lot at Nordstrom’s you might as well take advantage of some of these offers and start earning your points.

name: Brenda Reyes Najar
review: Using the Target RED Card has been a real pleasure. The RED card is wonderful, every time that I go grocery shopping or to buy anything else in the store, I can use it and get a 5% off in everything I buy, isn't that awesome?
