And when I buy online I get free shipping on everything I buy and I love that. The Target store card application is hassle free and I was able to apply at the register and it  the process barely took a couple minutes. If I ever need to exchange something I can also track every transaction made with the RED card without having to save receipts. The target store card is amazing, I have recommended this card to anyone, I really enjoy using this card that keeps me motivated about shopping at TARGET.

name: Brent Eickhoff
review: As a college student, it's very important for me to save money. Now, yes, I do like to spend money on more frivolous things--video games, movies, etc--but, living on a budget, and especially now that I'm renting with two of my friends, I'm trying to be more fiscally responsible. While "fiscally responsible" and "credit card" may not always go in the same sentence, I must say that I'm very happy with my Target card. It basically eliminates tax where I live, by reducing 5% off all purchases. This was incredibly appealing when we first moved in to our house, as we were buying more expensive things, such as entertainment units, dressers, etc. It's also nice when shopping for groceries, because it allows you to splurge just a little bit and get that ice cream or bag of potato chips. I'd assume that it's nice to have on electronics purchases as well, but I haven't actually done much big electronics purchasing, yet. The APR is definitely high, but part of being fiscally responsible is learning to pay back credit quickly. I've been setting aside a piece of my budget towards such payments, and have so far not run in to any issues.

name: Amanda Martin
review: The Target card is one of the very few store credit cards I have ever opened.  I opened it because of the discount you get on the purchase when the card is activated.  I was really pleased with how easy the process was.  I was also very pleased with the discounts provided.  I opened the card because I had a very large purchase and the discount ended up being substantial.  While I was very pleased with the card, the interest rate is higher then my other credit cards, and I didn't find myself using it very often.  For this reason I ended up canceling the card once that initial purchase was paid off.  I'm pleased to say that the cancellation process was also very quick and easy.  If you can commit to keeping the card paid off every month then I think this is a very good card to have.

name: Katherine Pharis
review: To be honest, I only got the Target Card, because at the time I got a percentage off of my purchase (it was around Christmas and the savings was very tempting). I try not to get too many store credit cards, because their APR is pretty high, and Target is no exception. My APR is around 22%. However, I do get 5% off purchases, so if you need to make a big purchase anyway, you can save money if you use the card and pay off the balance as soon as possible. But that's all I use my card for (Christmas, birthdays, etc). I've never had to call customer service, and my bill has never been late so I've never had to pay a late fee.

name: Kimberly Boyarski
review: The Target card is one of the few store cards that I have opened and kept active.  I opened this card five years ago when it was offered to me at the checkout counter in electronics.  My favorite thing about this card is the 5% off an all purchases.  This basically covers the cost of sales tax on purchases, and allows Target to stay competitive with online retailers that do not charge sales tax.  The process of opening the card is simple, it was done right at the register with a driver's license.  I have used the RED card several times to make purchases online at Target.com and gotten free shipping for using the credit card.  Of note:  the interest rate on the Target credit card is high, I believe north of 20 percent, so if you carry a balance, this is likely not the card for you.  However, if you pay in full monthly and like to shop at Target, the benefits are worth it, in my opinion.

name: Will Crowley
review: About a year ago I went to one of the Targets here in Phoenix by my home they had the best deal on a 55 inch LED/LCD combo, and I had been saving up for several months to purchase a new TV so, that's where I went. When I was about to pay for the TV using my debit card the cashier asked if I wanted to sign up for their in-store card, if approved I would get 10% off my purchase and 0% interest for 6 months. (guess it was a special promo. So I said yea, why not. Well I was approved for the card, got 50 bucks off the TV I was going to purchase and didn't have to pay right away as long as I paid it off within the 6th months. No problem! I saved up for the TV anyways. Needless to say I was very happy with Target that day.I don't do a lot of shopping at Target, especially big ticket items, but from time to time they do specials with cardholders that I try to take advantage of.

name: William Reyes
review: I really enjoy being a customer at Target using the RED Target credit card. The application process was simple (License) and fast, approval within 3 minutes. I was given a receipt (temporary card) that I could even use for that same purchase when applying. It gives me an extra 5% on all my products every time I shop, not just the first time. In addition to that, I can use it along my other offers and coupons which makes it even more attractive. I can even use it on clearance items! As a bonus I use my Target RED card online to buy products with free shipping, and I also get the discount online, and I can return any item at any Target store without having to ship it back. Overall, I recommend this card to every friend and family member due to the amazing savings, and easiness of use.

name: Laurel Stuart
review: There is a Target store just four blocks from my house and I go there at least once a week.  Typically I'm there twice: once for groceries and then again to pick up 1-2 small random items I need or we've run out of.  I love the convenience of the store card and the discount really adds up.  I'm amazed by how much money I save from both using my store card and shopping at Target in general.  This is the only store card that I consistently use.  I've never had problems in the 3-4 years that I've been using it.  It is just one more reason why Target really is one of my favorite places to shop.

name: Lisa Baer
review: I think it's really common nowadays for stores to offer their own credit card and I really love/hate it. It's great to get the additional discount but I think I purchase a bit too much! This card isn't the best in the world, the discount in a bit too little (only 5%!) but it's nice that it can also be used with the pharmacy...I didn't even know that I got a 30 day extension on returns, but that definitely sweetens the pot! Be careful- the APR is SUPER high so don't get a late fee and make sure you pay it off every month! If you're responsible then this can be seen as a nice little "coupon" when you shop instead of a heavy weight in your wallet!

name: Tasha Heart
review: Having the Target card has been great.  I became a Target cardholder a few years ago while shopping online late one night.  I do love the extras that come with being a cardholder, especially the extra savings on my prescriptions.   My experiences have been great and the few times I have had to contact customer service, I have received helpful information and my issues were quickly solved.  (I should add these were issues of my making.)  I rarely recommend cards to family and friends because I am afraid they will have a bad experience and somehow blame me, but I will gladly recommend the Target card.

name: Author Wolff
review: I really love my Target card and it's probably the one store credit card I will always have. The fact that I get a 5% discount eery time I use it is a big plus but the convenience is a great thing as well. I can use the card in store or online for specials you can't get in the store. It's always good to have a card like this because you never know when you may need clothes, kitchen stuff or something else when you are short cash or it's a few days until payday. The APR is high on the card but if you are responsible and pay off the balance every month, matter of fact the high APR is a good thing as it gives me the incentive to make sure I pay off the balance every month.All in all the target card is a great card to have if for nothing else than the great deals, the 5% discount and the huge variety of items that they carry in store and online.

name: Barbara Felice
review: I acquired my Target Red Card about 5 years ago. At first, I tried not to use it much but after a few trips it was hard not to use it. I am on a limited budget due to not being able to work full time so when they added groceries to the store I started using my card more. At first I thought it was a bad idea but then I realized if I just paid it off each month, I wouldn't have to pay interest on groceries. I also like having the card because Target offers everything in the world you would need from food to cat litter to car products. The interest seemed a little higher than normal so after a year or so I ended up canceling the card. To make up for that, my family sends me Target gift cards for holidays so I can still buy the products I enjoy at Target.

name: Kristan Mushett
review: My Target RedCard has some cool features, such as a 5% discount in the store and for online purchases, as well as free shipping. I use my RedCard quite a bit when shopping, especially for immediate needs since I can use the check stock feature and then pick up my purchase in a nearby store. I have also made a number of larger purchases with the card and then immediately gone to customer service and made a cash payment just to take advantage of the RedCard discount. I'd recommend the RedCard to anyone who frequently shops in Target stores so that they can save a bit of extra money. The 5% discount is better than dealing with some other card's cashback BS. That discount is a "Right Now" sort of thing!

name: Ashley Hickok
review: I love the Nordstrom store card! You get a certain number of points for every dollar you spend either at the store or online, and once you reach that amount, they automatically mail you your Nordstrom Note that you can use right away.  It also shows on your monthly bill how close you are to earning your next note.  Nordstrom also has certain days where you can earn double or triple points on every purchase, and this will get you rewards even faster.  They also have special shopping days and discounts just for card holders and they will send you an invitation for these in the mail. This is a great card with great benefits.

name: Diana
review: This Target credit card is the best. It's an immediate five percent discount on everything you purchase. The discount applies both online and in store. If you do order online, you get free shipping which is great because sometimes there are online-only deals that you couldn't get in store. The APR is very high (as it is for almost every single store credit card ever), but if you pay off your balances immediately then that shouldn't be a problem! I also think I get better coupons from using it, but I can't say that for certain. Another great benefit is that when the cashier asks you, "Would you like to sign up..." you can just flash your card instead of having to feel bad for saying "no not today" every time, haha.

name: Nicolasa Munden
review: I had a Target store credit card a few years ago, but didn't really use it all that often. I think I first purchased it because it gave me some amount off for groceries. So, for example, I spent about $80 in groceries and I believe I got about 10% off or so. After a few years, I realized I hadn't been using it very much so I canceled it. I can say that canceling the card was no problem, which was nice and isn't always the case. I'm not sure how opening and closing store credit card accounts affects your credit score, but I don't think it does, but that may be something to consider when thinking about a store credit card. Note that a poster below indicates that you continually get 5% off every time you use the Target card, which may also be a consideration.

name: Michelle Allen
review: A few months ago I was redecorating my house and needed quite a few things, so I went to my favorite store, Target. The cashier noticed how much I was buying and offered to open a Target store credit card for me to help me save 10% off this purchase. Normally I would decline such an offer, as I tend to stick with my two main Visa cards and avoid store cards. However, I was buying almost $1000 worth of items that day and I ended up saving almost $100! I thought I would stop using the card after that day, but I found out I now get 5% off every time I use my card at Target! It has now become my favorite card to use.

name: Karine Gaviria
review: I've had a Target card for about 2 years now because it was convenient to have for sending kids off to college. One of my daughters works at Target and got 10% plus the 5% plus a few coupons you get by being a loyal Target card user. It is so easy to pay off and they give you great random Target only coupons. The 5% is nice too because it is usually half our tax, which tends to run high at our store. Plus you can always just head over to customer service and pay off your debt. Overall if you are responsible with credit, the Target credit card is a good choice for you and can save you tons of money in the long run!

name: Katlyn Eppes
review: I signed up for and begin using my Target card a few months ago.  They do seem to relentlessly push those cards on the customers at each visit.  It can be too much, but then again I did give in and sign up.  So apparently their tactics do work, at least in this case.   They approve quickly and it has helped me work on getting my credit rating back up.  The limit on the card is small but sometimes that is a good thing so I don’t go overboard.  The APR is slightly high but most store cards are this rate or even higher, so over all it’s not a bad deal.  It’s very convenient to buy your everyday items with the card and in the process work on your credit.  Definitely the most convenient store card I’ve ever had.

name: Mark Ornelas
review: The Target credit card is a must have. Especially for my family and I. My wife loves this store and so do I. We finally decided to apply for the Target card because we shop there so much. The savings with the Target card sure do add up – we’re a family of four so this is a huge deal! We’re into saving as much as we can when spending our hard earned money and the Target card is a great way to save over time. If you’re a Target love like I am, sign up, apply, get the card and get the savings. You’re welcome

name: Sung Rumpel
review: This is my second favorite credit card after my Costco American Express Card. I use this to make purchases at places that do not accept American Express. The card itself is gorgeous. The nordstromcard.com interface is well organized and easy to navigate through. Viewing your balance and making payments through the website is fast and easy. The customer service representatives for this card, which can be contacted at 1-866-491-7860, are incredibly patient and helpful. The reward system is also great. I received a $20 Nordstrom reward upon opening my credit card. I earn 1% in Nordstrom reward cash for every purchase I make outside of Nordstrom. If you make purchases at Nordstrom, you receive 2% back and on special days, even more.

name: Julie Petersen
review: Having a Target Superstore so close to me makes it all worthwhile to have the Target Store card. It’s amazing that I get 5% off my purchases and usually get nice surprises in my email for special offers. Not only is it saving me money, but it is also helping to restore my credit. I was approved immediately but was only given a $300 limit which is fine by me. This is by far the best store card I have since I get the 5% off any purchase. The card is highly useful for clothes, food or any high end electronics. Highly recommend this card for anyone wanting to save some money!

name: Cole Difiora
review: I just recently got a Target store card after talking with an employee. The employee's had a habit of constantly asking with every purchase if I'd like to sign up for one but I was very reluctant to get one and didn't know I'd get 5% off every purchase. After learning about the 5% off every purchase, I decided I'd take a few minutes out of my trip to apply for one and was approved. I shop at Target at least 3 times weekly and this has saved me a lot on my purchases. I haven't had any problems paying it off but then again I try not to carry a large balance on it as it has a semi-high interest rate for a store card but it will save you in the long run if you are a weekly Target shopper like myself. It's also helpful because Target seems to have every item imaginable so therefore you can save 5% on mostly everything. Like I said before, great card but avoid leaving a huge balance on it as you'll pay very high interest rates.

name: Lisa West
review: I used to have a Target store card that I used religiously for about 2 years. I really enjoyed having it and if I remember correctly the interest rate was very reasonable. It was the one card that I never had any issues with paying the bill because the fees were not completely outrageous every month. I loved that it could be used on anything in the store and that you always get 5% back on your purchases. I would mostly use it for home goods and little extras I might not normally buy, but if there was ever a week I needed a little help with groceries, it was nice to have it available as a back-up. I learned recently that they also now offer a debit card that still gives you the 5% back but helps keep your spending in check. Overall a great card to have on hand!

name: Vickey Singh
review: I have just opened an account with TD Bank. Account opening was very simple and very less paperwork involved. I was very happy to get my debit card and checks right on spot. However after reaching home I realized that they got my name wrong on the account. So I called the customer service, who asked me to visit the store and get the issues resolved. I went to the store and asked them to fix the issue. They took my request and told me that the back operations office has to do the corrections. So I had to wait for a week for them to update my name correctly on the account. In the mean time I received my checks by mail which had the incorrect name printed on them. I again visited the store to get a new debit card and checks. They issued me a new card on the spot and told me that I would be getting the checks by mail. Its been more than one month, but still I haven't received my checks. Really very disappointing and very poor customer service.

name: Lisa
review: I have been a customer at TD Bank for 5 years now and have been very pleased with their customer service. Several times we have had our debit card hacked into and have had to get a replacement and charges removed from our account. The staff a the 800 number are very knowledgeable, alert security and insure your card is shut off and they refund your money appropriately. The only complaint we used to have about this bank is that there were no drive up ATMs, however over the last 6 months we have gotten drive up ATMs in the drive-thru bank lanes, which has been great!

name: Crystal Boulton
review: After coming right out of a nightmare experience with Wachovia, I went to TD bank. I only opened a basic checking account because I was moving to the other side of the country and didn't want to carry a couple thousand dollars in cash. It took about 20 minutes, tops, to get my checking account in order and the people at the branch could not have been nicer. There was no minimum balance, no fees of any kind and the best part is, that if some entity tries to take money out of our account… (let's say, an identity theft court settlement that you had no idea about) they won't release your money. They call you, have you close your account, give you your cash and then let you battle it out with whomever. Wachovia let a fraudulent company completely clean out my bank account and screwed me financially for the next 7-10 years. Anyways, using my TD card cross country was excellent, I had no problem checking in from all over the US to keep an eye on my account. And, sadly, when it was time to close my TD bank account because I had reached my destination, I was able to do it very easily over the phone. They even mailed me a check for the .37 that was left. I wish that TD had branch offices in Oregon, I would have stayed with them. Best basic banking experience, ever.

name: Jonathan Ferrell
review: This is by far the best bank I have ever banked with in terms of friendly and speedy service. When I went to open my account, I was greeted quickly by a man who genuinely appeared to love his job. We even exchanged names and handshakes and had a short conversation before proceeding with the account creation process. He explained my options and gave me suggestions, and the process of opening a new account was quick and painless. What really impressed me though was how quickly check transfers occur. I had most of my money in another bank and wanted to move it to TD bank by using checks. When I did, I was told that $100 of the check would be immediately available, and the remainder of it was in my account within a few days. This was very convenient and better than I expected. Overall, I have enjoyed my experience with TD bank so far, and I know that I can count on them to take care of all my banking needs.

name: Lynn Larsen
review: This bank was extremely helpful during the setting up of my account. The person that waited on me was immensely helpful since I hadn't had a bank account in a long time. But she walked me through all of the different offers that they had and helped me to select the right account for what I needed. When she explained things I never felt any sense of pressure to take anything that I didn't want so that was immensely helpful and made me want to do more business with them in the future. When I had problems with my online account to set up online banking, the lady on the other end of the line was extremely helpful and patient since I didn't have all of my banking information in front of me at the time. TD is an excellent bank with wonderfully helpful and friendly customer service.

name: danielle
review: I really liked my time with TD Bank. It was definitely an easy bank to get along with. The customer service was great, and at the time I really liked that you could get your card printed right in their office. I did like the hours though. That was probably the best part of the experience, they were always open past seven, which was amazing. However, when I had a problem it was so hard to get any resolution. They have this phrase called kicking it up to the next highest person which means it takes forever to get a simple consistent answer to anything over the phone.

name: Matty Matt
review: I recently move to the North Boston and opened a new account with TD Bank. I had some doubts since I was unfamiliar with them. I have to say that the service was very good compared to my BOA experiences. Much better actually. Since opening the account I have had only good experiences.After opening the account I realized that I needed to add my long time girlfriend to the account for signature purposes. The process was quick and easy. We were able to sit down with one of their reps, sign a few pieces of paper and we were back on the road in less than fifteen minutes. I know the whole keep the pen thing is probably silly to most people but I have noticed plenty of servers, bartenders and local businesses in the area with them. Hey, its free.The only downside is the high ATM fee I got recently. I was at the grocery and used the ATM there and when I checked my account online it was $5 in total fees. I called them and they actually refunded it without much consideration but they basically told me not to use other ATMs in the future if I want to avoid the high costs. So, there is some major fees associated.

name: Denise
review: TD Bank just updated the look and feel of their online payment section. It does take a little longer to load this page now however some of the new features I do like. When you initiate a payment from one of your saved Payees you can see on the right hand side a history of your recent payments to this Payee. It saves a lot of time doing research. An additional change is that you need to enter payments one at a time where prior I could enter multiple payments for different Payees at one time. Now with the new method you enter each Payee separately and there is an addition screen before you approve payment to add any notes. At first I did not care for this new method but I have found that I am now putting more notes than I did before. Overall I am very satisfied with the changes.

name: Richard
review: I can’t say I’m thrilled with TD Bank. Yes, they have a lot of locations in my area which is convenient. Their weekend hours aren't terrible (well, for a bank). But honestly, that’s where the positives end. The ATMs are often buggy and a pain to work with. Customer service rarely makes me feel welcome – they do their job competently, but you never get the vibe that anyone is actually happy to be there. When I made a purchase with my debit card and had issues with the retailer, TD was unable to help me and do a chargeback or any other form of purchase protection. To be honest, the only reason I haven’t switched to somewhere else at this point is sheer laziness.

name: Kerri D. White
review: A woman in town stole my new box of bank checks out of my mail and proceeded to write large checks from my account and forged my name on them. This woman has actually been convicted of doing this before and has a court record. I discovered this was happening about three days after it started and she had already cleaned out my bank account. And the bank never questioned a single check that she cashed in person at the Royersford branch. Even though it was an unusual banking activity on my account. They never even bothered to contact me to double check that the checks, which the woman wrote out to herself and should've had to show a photo ID to cash, were legitimate even though they were out of sequence from my previous checks. When I tried to resolve this with customer service, they were completely unhelpful. They couldn't do anything for me over the phone, kept me on hold for close to 10 minutes at a time, and when I demanded they refund the money to my account said they couldn't do that until the investigation by their fraud officer was complete. Their bank branch wasn't open because it was Easter. And as I was flying out of the state before they opened on Monday, I'm going to now have to wait a week before I can resolve this issue ,because they refuse to take reports or help customers over the phone. It's like being robbed a second time. On top of that their customer service rep had the gall to tell me I was ruining her Easter because I was getting upset that they wouldn't do anything to help me, after they basically assisted someone in stealing all my money. They are the worst bank. The worst. And I've dealt with some awful banks in my day. This is the first bank I've dealt with that wouldn't refund fraudulently drawn money from a personal checking account.

name: S Pearson
review: I became familiarized with TD Bank through their investing affiliate TD Ameritrade. Although this won them my business, I remained a customer because TD Bank has both U.S. and Canadian branches, and this made banking during graduate study abroad very easy. In fact, for emergency funding during a three-month student stay, I was able to apply for and receive a TD Bank credit card while in Canada. This was my lifeline for groceries and books because my small private American-based student loan did not get approved for foreign study. TD Bank will be especially useful for people based in New York or the upper New England states that do leisurely or business trips to Canada. It's helpful to know that in a foreign country your banking will still be easy and familiar.

name: Robert
review: I recently opened a savings account (Convenience Savings) at my local TD Bank, and I must say, the staff and process were absolutely stellar. I have always been a loyal Capital One customer, but I figured I would shop around when it came to another savings account. I settled with TD Bank because of a family recommendation, and I'm glad that I have.First off, the manager spoke with me directly and was extremely thorough with explaining all options available to me. What savings account would give me the best yield for my budget, the drawbacks, everything. I was treated with absolute respect and they made sure I didn't misunderstand anything along the way. The way customer service should be!The services offered as such are great; I don't even have to pay any monthly fees and I get a debit card. I'm happy with my decision to use TD Bank for this, and I'm sure you will be as well if you stop by your local branch.

name: Michael Sanislo
review: TD Bank took over for my old bank, Commerce, a few years ago. Even since, I have had nothing but great experiences with them. A few times I have had issues with transactions they have been quick to act and clean up any problems that came up with them. The branches I go to have extremely friendly staff and are very clean.  There are sometimes small lines during peak hours but the tellers make sure the customers get taken care of quickly and efficiently. The branch manager always says “hi” to me when I make my business deposits. I will stick around with TD for as long as they are in business.

name: Heather McGraw
review: I just joined TD Bank a few weeks ago, and I absolutely love them! I joined specifically so that I could use their Penny Arcade, which is free to customers, since I tend to save a lot of coins and I HATE paying fees for getting them counted. However, even though my goal was very utilitarian and I wasn't expecting TD Bank to be anything special, it turns out that they won me over right away and I have very positive feelings toward them. First of all, I think their customer service is excellent. Before I went in to open my account, I called my local branch on the phone and spoke to a very nice and helpful customer service rep. Then, when I went in much later in the day, that same rep remembered me and my needs, and instantly got me taken care of. Second, I really like the atmosphere in the bank. It is bright, open, clean, organized, and attractive. They have restrooms for customer use (I just thought that was worth mentioning, since it seems to be kind of unusual for banks to have them), and they have great hours too. They're even open on Sundays! I'm very pleased.

name: Shan C
review: TD Bank has been part of my life for over five years now and I couldn’t be happier with a bank like theirs.  From day one they put a smile on my face because of the excellent service I received at one of their branches in my area. I went in to open a checking account and to my amazement the process was quick and simple, totally the opposite of what I was expecting. When I walked in I didn’t wait more than ten minutes to get service, I simply told the representative that I was here to open a checking account and request a debit card. She was very nice and professional, told me about the benefits of having a checking account with TD Bank, gave me an application to fill out which took me only five minutes to complete and within the next ten minutes, my account was open and my debit card was given to me the same day I opened the account. That is something I was very impressed with compared to my experience with opening an account at my old bank, where I had to wait several weeks to get my card. This totally surprised me. My account was open and ready to be used the same day for all my needs and I knew I would be very happy with this bank and will be banking with them for many years to come.

name: Katherine Berger
review: My experience started out great; they seemed overjoyed to have me open a simple savings account with them. However, as time went on and I wanted to open additional accounts, there started being random charges placed on my account and I didn't understand the reasons behind them. I felt like each monthly statement was a surprise. Many of the changes made to my account were made without my knowledge. Once questioned, sometimes the tellers couldn't even tell me the reasons behind some fees. It was on the whole frustrating. For the moment though things seem to be staying stationary as far as fees go. I also went in to inquire about an auto loan and the woman that helped me was very uninterested and unenthusiastic so I left with a sour taste in my mouth. TD handled the replacement of my debit card when it had been fraudulently used very quickly and professionally. I will say that one of my favorite things about this bank is the Penny Arcade; it comes in handy and is one of the perks of being a TD bank customer. TD's banking hours are great and very convenient – I just wish they had more ATMs dispersed around town.

name: Mark Bacon
review: I've had a Target store card for several years, almost 5 now I think. I really like that I get 5% off of any purchase when I use it. It's not much, but since I mostly opened it to raise my credit score, it's a nice bonus. I loved the easy application and instant approval. It was nice to know right then and not wait on the dreaded rejection letter in the mail. I've never had any problem with it. In fact, the few times I've had to call customer service, they've been absolutely wonderful. I couldn't ask for a better store card.

name: vana Ross
review: I joined TD Bank about two years ago after an issue with one of the more well known banks in our area. They had just opened one close to my home, and I wanted to start out slow, so I moved 2 of my 3 personal accounts and my son's small savers account there. From the moment I walked in, I felt welcome. It may seem small, but the comfortable furnishings and trendy decor was inviting. The one issue I had was the waiting time. I waited for around 45 minutes in order to be helped. However, after sitting with them, it was easy to understand why. They take so much time, and dedicate it only to you during your sit down, that they make you feel wanted and welcome. They do not intimidate, scare or shame like at other banks. They are real people and they are there to help other real people. I have had some issues with a stolen ID in the past and since the person tried to go in to that particular branch, they knew it was not me. They immediately called me, and since that person had also stolen money and other items from me, the police were able to get back some of my items. I cannot say enough great things about TD bank. The only sad thing, and the reason for 4 stars, is that they just do not have enough branches. I have since moved, and the closest one to me is a 15 minute drive. Too many times I have had to go to another bank to get cash and spend $7.00 in total after all the fees from both banks. Since I have moved to this bank, I went ahead and made the leap to also switch all my business accounts. I am very happy with those accounts as well, and they have been there for over a year.

name: Justine Edmonds
review: I recently switched from Citizens Bank to TD Bank. I had been a loyal customer of Citizens Bank for my entire life, but encountered a situation in which I was completely dissatisfied with the customer service and the cooperation I received from them. I am extremely pleased so far with my decision to switch to TD and with the service I have received from them thus far. The customer service representative that I dealt with made the transition from my old bank to this one very simple and painless for my husband and me. They explained in full detail the terms and policies associated with our new accounts and I found that there are no hidden fees to deal with. I am also pleased with their online banking system and the way their website is set up makes it customer friendly and easy to use. Every time I have gone into the branch near my house, I have been greeted with smiling, friendly tellers, and prompt service. I wish I had found this bank earlier. I feel that I would have saved a lot of time and hassle if I had. Very satisfied!!!

name: Matthew Beal
review: Where to begin with this card? I have been using it for about a year now, and it is fantastic! I will start with the only drawback. I have stellar credit but the credit line I got when I applied for was not that great. But it is only a store card, so you can't expect too much. Now on to the positives! First, applying is a breeze and you find out pretty much instantly if you get approved. The customer service is on par with what you would expect from target, excellence! The 5% cash back on all purchases is hands down the greatest thing about this card, however. It is an amazing deal, especially if you coupon, and catch deal items! Finally you get free shipping on anything from target.com which is awesome if you do a lot of ordering from there, because shipping can really add up to bite you! This is a fantastic card for anyone that frequents target!

name: Alex
review: My first bank account was at TD Bank. I have never had trouble with them. Despite frequently spending all the money in my account, I have never had trouble with fees. Recently I signed up for their online banking, and it is incredibly convenient and speedy. Typically I deposit and move money from my Pay-Pal account into this bank account, or vice versa, and the flexibility and speed of these digital transfers is really helpful. Lastly, I'll go over their in-bank transfers. Regardless the time of day, the weather outside or even my sour mood, the people who work at TD never fail to help me get done what needs to be done with a smile on their face. And I always know exactly what is happening to my money and who is handling it. It's a real comfort to feel that your money is in good hands, and that accessing it is so easy.

name: Tamara Harris
review: I have been a member of TD Bank now for only 3 years but, overall it has been a pleasure. I love the warm welcome you receive from every teller the moment you walk through the door and it doesn't matter which one you go to for help, they always make you feel special by giving you the personal attention you need from the time you walk in until you walk out. They truly are America’s most convenient bank, with access to your accounts 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. This service allows me to have extra peace of mind.  If I wake up at 2 o’clock in the morning wondering if I have the necessary funds to cover my transactions for the next day, I don’t have to wait until eight, I can call right then or later and speak to a real person for as long as I need to.

name: alex J
review: I have been a member of TD Bank for over 6 months now. I know that’s not a long time, but it’s long enough for me to realize that they are a great institution. They have been nothing but perfect when it comes to dealing with my banking. The tellers are really nice and personal. It makes me feel that they actually care about what happens with me and my money. Most banks nowadays aren’t like that. It’s very refreshing. I also like that they have extended hours in the area that I live. It makes it very easy to do banking at hours that aren’t normally available to me. I feel that I have made a great decision when it came to choosing them to keep my money safe. I haven’t had any problems arise, but I’m sure if I do they will handle them right away and with great care.

name: Bryan Haskins
review: I've been a member of TD Bank at the branch local to my college for 4 years now. As a credit union, they have always left me satisfied; when any problem arises that impacts me negatively I truly feel as though they are on the case and resolve it in a quick, timely fashion. Even in the situation of my Debit Card being stolen, their response time was bar none, the best around. There was one instance where my account was improperly billed for someone else's cell phone bill (entirely on the end of the cell phone company!), and they took care of the problem for me. I didn’t have to do anything. They called the company and me to keep me updated. This (to a college student!) large sum was refunded to my account and everything was taken care of. Thank you for years of great service!

name: Tamara Montgomery
review: I have been a customer at TD Bank for over a year now, and I have had nothing but great service from them. Since I usually do my banking in person, it is nice to know that the bank tellers know me, and even know my dog (who also loves going there because they give him dog biscuits). Any time that I have had a problem or made a mistake, they have gone the extra mile for me. I also like the fact that I can easily find my balance and records online. All in all, I highly recommend TD Bank to my friends and family.

name: Cherry Moon
review: I am a fairly new customer of TD Bank. I needed a secondary account available in more than one location and so far TD is a really good fit for me. Not only do they have locations in more than a handful of states but they also have great online services too, so I have access to my funds anywhere I happen to be. I am very happy with the customer service so far as well. They have been available to answer all of my questions and concerns in a timely manner. They also have a large variety of personal and small business investment programs for those interested in CDs, along with their own name brand credit card. I am even considering using them for my primary banking needs rather than my current institution...So Far, So Good!!

name: Gina
review: I have been a customer of TD Bank for about eight years. I actually moved to this company from KeyBank, because I was feeling like I wanted a smaller “atmosphere” in order to deal with my financial needs, and at the time, Key was too corporate. Hence, I made the move to what was then TD Banknorth, and for a couple of years, I was extremely satisfied. Most of my problems were able to be handled in-house, with a friendly customer service representative, behind the privacy of a comfortable office. Being from a somewhat small town, this was something that made me feel good about the people holding onto my money, and I was happy to make the move. Recently, I have become more and more upset with TD Bank. I have found more hidden fees than I even knew possible. For example, I used an ATM the other day at a convenience market. Not only did the convenience market charge me $3.00 (which I knew about), but then the bank also charged me a NON TD ATM FEE of $2.50. This brought my balance down to $99.73 and under the new $100 minimum rule they were then able to charge me a $25 fee PER DAY. The tier keeps climbing, and those faithful customers who began such a greedy business just get poorer, and poorer. Now, when I went to the local branch to try and sort out this mess, I was greeted with a somewhat empathetic smile, and told that the only thing I could do was call the customer service number. So, when I called the customer service number they could hardly speak English and told me to try the local branch, otherwise, I could borrow money from someone to get my balance up. Unbelievable! I am extremely dissatisfied, and this is only one example explaining why.

name: Simon Cook
review: I have been a TD Bank customer for 16 years and opened a joint account with them when they were Commerce bank. My experiences with them have been mixed over the years.I like the fact that they are open on Sunday as it gives me the option to bank all week around if needed. I had no major complaints when they were Commerce Bank. Once a charge appeared on my account for several thousand dollars that was in error and they removed it within hours.When they became TD Bank and the banking industry started to look for new methods of gaining revenue I began to encounter problems. Firstly, they introduced a charge for using other banks’ ATMs. Thus, while I had been used to getting free ATM withdrawals from my local Quick Check or Wawa, I was suddenly charged every time. I complained about this but basically was told that I had to find a TD Bank ATM. The nearest ATM is several miles away from my house. Therefore I opened a PNC Bank account and now only use TD Bank to pay bills.Overall, I am mostly satisfied with my experiences with TD Bank, however, as the industry begins to get more aggressive with revenue generation I suspect I may end up closing my account and transferring everything to PNC. That is a shame.

name: Tim McLarney
review: I've been using the Target Red Card for about 6 months, and I have been very happy with the whole experience. I have poor credit, but they started me with a $300 line of credit. Use of the card at Target gets you 5% off the total purchase price, including items that have been marked down already. The on-line access is great, and I’ve never had a problem with the account. After 5 months of paying the balances off immediately, they bumped the credit limit up significantly. The card is, as far as I know, good only for purchases at Target; but if you shop there anyway, it makes sense to get the card and save an extra 5% on all of your purchases. I am very happy with the Target Red Card!

name: Rich Kray
review: I have recently gotten the Target Red Store Card again after many years without one and I had forgotten how truly convenient this card is.  Getting 5% off on every purchase is an unexpected added bonus.  I especially like the large variety of merchandise available through Target that the Red card can be used for.  Decisions on large ticket items have been swayed to this card for me because of these reasons.  The sales staff has been very helpful, as well, should I by chance have a need to return an item that I purchased with my Red card.  They readily credit my card with any return, no questions asked.  I love my RED card!

name: Brian Smith
review: I've been with TD Bank for 5 years now, since they were Commerce bank. I initially started banking with TD after applying for an auto loan in 2007. I was immediately approved and they set up a checking account to deduct the funds each month. I paid it off 2 years early in 2010 and have been satisfied with the level of service I've received throughout. I was late on the payment by several days a few times and they had no problem reversing the late fees every time (even though they were only allowed to do it once throughout the entire loan). The best thing is they have a 15 day grace period, so if you needed 15 extra days, you could take it no matter what. In regard to the “banking” part of TD, their checking account is fantastic and their customer service is up to par and always willing to answer a customer's call. I've been completely satisfied and now bank with them on the regular.

name: andre
review: The initial reason that I opened a TD Bank checking account is because I was fed up with the lackluster customer service from my previous bank as well as its unnecessary monthly fees. Another reason I joined TD bank is because they have excellent hours that cater to my needs. I work Monday through Friday 9am-6pm and then I have a part time job on Saturdays from 8am-3pm and most banks are closed during those times. When I checked online and found that TD bank was opened on Sundays I was absolutely ecstatic!Not only are the hours incredibly convenient, but their customer service is second to none. Every time I go into a branch I receive friendly, helpful assistance in a very timely manner. If I have any questions about transactions or investments, a banker is always available to give me a hand. TD banks online banking is also very intuitive and not clunky like some other online services offered by banks. I can transfer funds, balance my budget and pay my bills with nothing more than the click of a mouse.I am beyond satisfied with my experience thus far with TD bank and see myself being a customer for a long time to come!

name: Danielle Ross
review: I've been with this bank for a couple years now and I can honestly say that it is the best bank I have ever joined. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this bank. Every time I go into a branch I am met with smiles and fantastic customer service. Whenever there's a line, they apologize and offer candy! The best thing is when I accidentally overdrew my account, I called their line, requested a fee removal because of my great standing history with them, and they did just that. I plan on staying for as long as possible.

name: Amanda Campbell
review: I have had a target store card for many years now and I love it! I love it especially since I have had my daughter because we get all of her baby supplies and clothing there.  Getting 5% off when shopping online is a great bonus because of the amount of money I spend at Target.  I really enjoy the larger purchases because of discount and when buying big ticket items that can really matter. Overall, the customer service has been excellent with the Target card as well.  I enjoy the appreciation from Target staff for being a Target card customer.

name: Lizz Hudman
review: I absolutely love TD Bank! There have been a couple of times when I have accidentally overdrawn my account by a few dollars and they are always quite understanding and I never have had to pay any obnoxious fees or anything. One time, my father (who also has a TD Bank account) got his debit card stolen. Someone in Florida had spent over $2,000 of his money. He simply went to the bank and explained his situation and they fixed the problem right away with no penalty whatsoever. His credit is completely intact and he was refunded every single penny that was spent by that thief. They are always friendly, convenient, and fair at TD Bank.

name: Cindy Robinson
review: I have had the Target credit card for a number of years. Its great when you get the 5% off all purchases made with the card in store. It came in handy when I bought my last big purchase on Black Friday when I bought a TV and got a little extra off of the low price. Not a credit card that you want to carry a balance on as the interest rate is a bit ridiculous, and the late fees can add up also, but if you shop there a lot and can pay the entire balance off each month, I would highly recommend getting this card.

name: Quentin Williamson
review: I have been banking with TD for about six years (since they acquired the local bank that I had been using for several years before that). I have two checking and one savings account with them, and they have been pretty good. I have not had too many issues with them, and the issues I had were fairly easily resolved. I got kind of annoyed a couple of years ago when they started charging ATM fees. Previous to that they didn't, and they also reimbursed the fees that other banks charged. It was probably the best benefit I have ever had with a checking account.

name: Tanya Ray
review: I have had a Target store card (red card) for years and have never had anything but EXCELLENT customer service from them!  I love that the card can be used in the Super Target stores where I can find everything I need off my weekly shopping lists.  Sometimes I use the card to buy a larger item and then make payments on it until it is paid off * this works really well when Target is having a great sale on an item I need!  The Target card is easy to use and easy to pay.  The interest rate is competitive and you get special offers for being a Target card holder.  The discount that I am eligible for when making purchases just add to the long list of benefits of having this credit card account with Target. I highly recommend applying for a Target red card!

name: Ajay S
review: I've been with TD bank before it was even TD bank – when it was originally Commerce Bank. It was one of the few banks that I had near my school that I could also find back home. Since I started, they have been nothing short of excellent. Over the years, the few issues I had (having separate deposit slips depending on area to name one) have been resolved and essentially eliminated. Now that I live in Vermont, it's the only bank that I have access to both here and in NJ where I do go occasionally. Also, the coin counter is great and not having to pay any sort of fee is a huge plus. I can't recommend this bank enough.

name: Erik
review: I have been a customer of TD bank since 2009. They gave me the loan to purchase my new 2009 vehicle. Overall, I have been impressed with their level of customer service and their truth in lending practices. They have worked with me several times to remove late payment fees – they will remove one per year officially. Their late fee is reasonable as well – only ten dollars. I have always been able to get someone I could understand on the phone to help me. The one drawback I have is their immense size. It makes me a bit leery after seeing the whole “too big to fail” fiasco.

name: James Thornton
review: TD Bank is a newer bank in my area. They bought some other banks and I was curious, yet skeptical, of going into the office to check into opening and account. I was totally shocked when I went in. I went to the branch in the Bluffton, SC area. As soon as I walked in I was greeted, this is normal for most banks, but the atmosphere was so much lighter and easy going at TD bank. I opened a savings and checking account here for one of my small businesses in the low country of South Carolina. I have not had any problems but I give the problem resolution five stars because I am confident that they will go out of their way to satisfy my customer service needs. The application process is cut and dry. Give them name, social, license and money and you are good to go. I highly recommend TD Bank for any one and for all banking needs. I look forward to trying out some of their other services.

name: Myana Geem
review: Avoid this store card at all cost. True, it is easy to apply for this card but so are with the other store cards. Target's late payment policy is excessively stringent. Whereas other store credit cards (and even the high-end ones such as Lord & Taylor) will simply slap you with a reasonable late-payment penalty which is usually in the range of $25 to $35 when you are a few days late, Target will start calling you in a few days after you have missed your payment due date. For example, Target pestered me with harassing phone calls daily when I knew that I was just a few days late. I ended up paying them but also asked them to cancel my card. Avoid, avoid, avoid.

name: Traci Carson
review: The best thing about this bank, hands down, is that they're open on Sundays. I love having the option to do my banking on a Sunday while everyone else is in church. It means less lines and less people to deal with, and that is always a good thing. Some of their rates are a little high, so I had to rate the bank itself a little lower, but their customer service is top-notch and they're always very helpful and friendly to you when you visit a branch. The branches themselves are neat and easy to navigate, but they're a little sterile and make me a little uncomfortable. Other than that, this bank is great!

name: Kathleen Morris
review: I have a target card and I love it. I applied in the store and was approved on the spot and was given a temporary card. I was also given a coupon for 10% off my next purchase, which I was also able to use online. Target is a good card to have for me because of all of the things they sell in the stores, like groceries, baby supplies, and household items. I have been low on cash and needed emergency items, so I go to Target and use my card. The best part about having the card is the five percent discount at Target stores and Target online purchases. This card really comes in handy for me and my family.I have never had a problem with my bills or with customer service. The people on the phones are always polite and kind and are willing to help, which is nice. I would recommend this card to anyone who shops at Target on a regular basis.

name: Stacy Spradley
review: I just applied for received my new Target credit card. The application was very easy and fast. I had approval in minutes. I got this card to save me the 5 percent off on purchases. I also do a lot of my shopping online and this card gives me free shipping. I would recommend this card to anyone that does any shopping at Target. You do not have to have the best credit to get this card either. My credit rating is average, but this is a great way to build credit as well. The savings from shipping and percentages off is a no win situation.

name: Lucas Neuffer
review: I have just recently gotten the target red card and I have had no trouble with it so far. I love that it saves you five percent off each purchase that you make. I go to the website that is very easy and pay off the amount right away and I have never had trouble with the site or payments. The application process was very quick and easy as I did it in the store, I was approved and accepted right away. As soon as I got the card in the mail, which didn't take long, I was able to use the card right away with no problems. Overall I am very satisfied with the target card and I am happy that I got it.

name: Megan Vincent
review: I have been using the Target card for about 6 months now, and I honestly love it. I have the credit card version, but you can also get a debit card. I really love the perks of the card especially the 5% off all purchases! I shop at Target for groceries, my prescription, household items, clothes; you name it so it really helps. It also helps because with the credit card it’s easy for me to see how much I am spending there each month. It’s fairly easy to view your balance and pay off the card online so I appreciate that feature too. It was easy to apply for the card and as a college student it helped me to build my credit since it was only my second credit card I had ever used.  It is also good for getting free shipping at target.com. Used with the prescription deal (you can link your Target pharmacy card) you have the opportunity to get a 10% off shopping trip after filling a certain number of prescriptions. Overall I would recommend this card to anyone who shops regularly at Target.

name: Kristin
review: I had TD bank for nearly 10 years before I moved out of the area they serve. I signed up for a checking account when they were Commerce bank and I was 16. Commerce bank was a 5 star bank, no question about it. I loved them, and they loved me. When TD rolled into town, at first everything was OK....then the fees started. One thing I LOVED about Commerce was that there were no ATM fees on non-Commerce ATMs. TD kept that for a while and then trashed it. Slowly other fees and charges started popping up. As a longtime customer, they would occasionally remove fees and were generally flexible – hence the 5 star customer service rating. The people in the branches and on the phone are great. But the policies of the bank often irritated me or made me feel like just a number (a feeling I never got with Commerce. That may be cheesy but I mean it!).

name: Ashley Morgan
review: TD Bank is the best bank that I have ever decided to belong to, and for a few great reasons. This bank has the best hours that you could ever find, always open late, and even open on Sundays! The only negative thing about stopping by my local TD bank is that the service is extremely slow, but it is very friendly and accurate. I originally had signed up for a TD savings account (in college). I had so much money in my account that I did not know that they actually never signed me up for a college account and had been charging me $4 for the account monthly. Upon realizing my mistake, they immediately reimbursed all charges to my checking and closed out my savings, no questions asked. I was disappointed to find out that TD Bank was no longer supporting a free checking, which many banks no longer have. However, I love the bank so much that I have decided to stay. It's only 2.99 a month for a paperless statement, until I have 100 dollars in my account, that's nothing! Thank you TD, for being the most convenient bank around town!!

name: Jason Lavigne
review: I have had a TD Bank checking account for over 10 years now and I've been very happy with it, overall. Some downsides are the minimum $100 balance and the $15 fee that is charged. Also, you will still have to pay ATM fees if you use an ATM at another bank and there is no reimbursement. I feel like some of their policies, like the minimum balance, are kind of hidden even though they advertise free checking. TD Bank has also had its fair share of stolen data as most banks have. Some of the great things are the ATM debit card which is very useful for me because I don't like to carry too much cash and lots of location in the northeast. In addition, the customer service is great. One time I had some fraudulent charges made to my ATM debit card and the customer service reps at TD Bank were very helpful in sorting it all out and making sure that I got my money back and my account was secure. Overall I think it's a good bank and I'm not planning on leaving.

name: Just Peachy
review: I love everything about Target and I especially live their credit card. I am an avid Target shopper and I love that I can save money on purchases by using my card and of course the coupons that I receive from month as an incentive to shop more is a huge perk. Why not save money on purchases I would make anyway. The Target card customer service is always helpful. I needed their help about 6 months ago when my wallet was stolen. I had been a loyal customer for 3 yrs. and I wasn’t held accountable for all the fraudulent charges brought forth by the thief.

name: Sunshine Burch
review: I am a big fan of my Target store card. I love the store anyway, and having a card I can use at the store is great. Target has just about everything my family needs, clothes, shoes, food, you name it. Plus, the stores are usually clean and well stocked, not like the other big name store in my area. There are a couple perks I love about the card. First of all, I get 5% off of my Target purchases. That means less guilt when I buy things I don’t need. Also, there are prescription perks, but I am not on anything at the moment. I get coupons in the mail from Target. That is really nice, too.

name: Hye Mcclellan
review: I’ve always had good experiences using my Target Red Card.  In fact, with the recent expansion to my local Target to include a produce section, it’s become my one stop shop.  The Red Card allows for an instant 5% discount on purchases, and it only takes one swipe at the register to complete a transaction.  The website is easy to use so I can flawlessly manage my Red Card and easily pay my bills on time.  During Christmas season, I do a lot of online shopping and my Red Card gives me free shipping on any purchase made on Target.com.  It really has been a great investment.

name: David Seibert
review: As a customer of TD Bank, and I am very excited to give my feedback.  There were several years that I did not possess a bank account because I did not trust financial institutions.  In 2011 that all changed when I decided to see what TD Bank had to offer.  I decided after hearing their many benefits to open a checking account.  I am excited to say that TD Bank has always resolved all of my concerns; they even send me emails to give me balance information.  In addition to the checking account I opened a savings account and link overdraft protection to my checking.  I would not use any other bank TD is my favorite.

name: Veronica Ruggiero
review: I have been an unhappy TD Bank customer for the past 2 years and I am looking to switch banks. I have had several bad experiences with this bank. First of all, they have put a block on my checking account five times in the 2 years I've been with them. This has been due to suspicious activity on my account. What bothers me is, they don't even let me know! Instead, I had to be embarrassed in a store when I go to make a purchase and get told that my card has declined. Aside from that, they charge ridiculous overcharge fees. For each transaction, they charge $35; it doesn't matter if It's only a penny, you will get charged the $35. Aside from all of that, there are numerous times when their online banking system is down, their ATM's don't work, and their customer service isn't available. As soon as I pay off my overage charges, I will be switching. DON'T USE THIS BANK!

name: Eliza Prescott
review: When I originally got this card, I thought it was pretty simple. It was just a store card, and it gave me a $250 credit line that I could pay off easily and use to build credit. Then it turned into a VISA credit card and the limit was upped to a staggering $4000. In my exuberant youth, I managed to rack up quite a bit of debt on it before I learned The Way Of The Card, and it wasn't until I took a look at the APR that I nearly had a heart attack. It was so high that the monthly minimum payments I could afford to put on it were doing absolutely nothing to chip away at the debt. I ended up opening a much better account with a Citibank card and transferred the debt, which was paid off quite quickly once I got away from Target. I never shop there these days anyway, so the saving money on Target purchases does nothing for me. Out of all my credit lines, the Target card has been deemed "Only To Be Used Upon Penalty Of Death".

name: Liam Bechen-Lyne
review: I have had a TD bank account since 2004, so just about 8 years. I have stayed with TD bank for this length of time primarily out of choice and loyalty because I really appreciate their in-person branch customer service and how easy they made opening and accessing a 401(k) for me, which was like reading a foreign language for me. However, I think TD bank has some unclear disclosure issues - for example, I got a notice recently that my student checking account was about to start getting hit by a $15/month fee if I didn't maintain a daily balance of $100 or more, and they sent this notification with less than two weeks until the date they planned to change my account type! I think their overdraw policies are also pretty unclear in terms of what they charge fees for and it appears to me, sometimes, to be enforced unevenly. The policy, as I understand it, is if you overdraw by less than $5, no big deal - but I’ve gotten the $35 overdraw fee for a less than $5 withdraw and while the customer service representative at my bank was helpful in clearing it up, it necessitated a lot of stress and a trip to the bank that wasn’t necessary.

name: Tiffany Von Trapp
review: I have had an account with this bank for about six or seven years, dating all the way back to when it was Commerce Bank. I got this account over a lunch break at work as the bank had just opened across from my office. I have never had a more convenient account to use. Everything with them was simple, I'm not sure what fees other reviews are mentioning, as I never had any fees with this bank, possibly due to my plan or the promotion I got my account under, but I've had anywhere from a dollar and change to thousands in the account, and never noticed any fees being taken out. Plus, they even have a machine to dump all your change into so you can convert it into dollars, really useful since I always had tons of change sitting in my desk at work. Since I moved from New York city, I haven't been able to use this bank as much since there aren't any locations that are close enough to me, which is really disappointing because it's my favorite bank, but I transfer money over from my credit union account, and use my TD debit card for online purchases every once in a while just to keep it active, that's how much I like this bank.

name: Tabitha Vetre
review: I haven’t been with TD Bank long, but I was pleased with a number of things about them when I signed up. There was no hassle to open an account, even being my first checking account, and the representative I spoke with was very nice and clear about the differences between each account and how to upgrade in the future, should I need to. Later that day, I tried to enrol in online banking and ran into trouble because my account was new, but a quick call to customer service cleared that up really well! Although the monthly fee has been hiked up to $5 a month, I feel as though this account is still worth every penny, and I’ve had no significant issues with them so far! I Would definitely recommend them.

name: Meg J
review: I've been with TD Bank since they purchased and converted People's Heritage Bank to their own brand. I have consistently kept a checking account and a savings account with them and have never had a single problem. I love the convenience of the many locations across the United States, so I never have to worry about ATM fees when I'm traveling. The extended hours, with some branches even being open on Sundays, is very helpful. I work beyond typical banking hours most weeknights and not having to rush to the bank by noon on Saturday cuts out some stress. Any time I've had questions or issues with my accounts, the customer service - whether online, in person at the local branches or on the phone - has been very helpful and pleasant. Overall, I really enjoy banking with TD Bank and don't see myself changing any time soon.

name: Josh St Jean
review: TD Bank is probably the best “big” bank that you'll deal with. I used them for about 5 years, after switching over from Citizens Bank. They have excellent hours and a lot of the branches are open on Sundays, which is a huge plus. The customer service is great and they have always helped me out as much as they could. The biggest downside I would say is their expensive overdraft charges. They charge between 35 and 40 dollars per transaction. On the plus side, I don't get charged any monthly “maintenance” fees which other banks are known to charge you. If a credit union isn't an option for you, I highly recommend TD Bank over any other of the big banks.

name: Donald Kirchner
review: I love saving money on my Target purchases.  It is nice to save 10% on whatever I buy there.  The only complaint I have is that I have the same credit limit I started with 5 years ago.  I had bad credit when I got the credit card but have always paid on time.  If you have a target card it can be great on big purchases with the 10% discount.  I wish you could increase your credit limit easier or at least outline how to do it exactly.  I would recommend this card to anyone who shops at target.

name: Kathy Anne
review: TD Bank was the first bank I opened an account with when I needed a checking and savings account. I was a TD Bank member for 5 years. I liked that in my city there were numerous locations, so it was very convenient if I needed money or needed to deposit. Convenience was one thing I was looking for when I was deciding which bank to open an account in. The other thing that caught my attention was their availability to their customers. They have hours at their branches that I’ve never seen for a bank. They are even open on Sundays! I had no issues with their customer service, I had an issue with a check not getting cashed and obviously lost and they were very kind to stop the missing check and even waived the fee, because it was my first one. I was floored and thanked the service rep numerous times. Even the tellers at the bank cared about you as a person and made sure to greet you with a warm smile and send you on your way with sentiments. The only thing I didn't like with TD Bank is when they started charging fees for keeping my money with them, and switched what type of ATMs we could use without fees. I just don't like when a bank charges me for keeping my money. Other than that issue, I had no problems with TD and if you are looking for a bank that is convenient in the hours and location department, has friendly customer service representatives and tellers, then by all means I do recommend TD Bank!

name: Sin LnStyle
review: TD bank is ok. As far as convenience and locations go they are top notch. They are really everywhere. It seems though that TD enjoys changing their fine print on a regular basis. First we had issues when they charged a bunch of tiny items like gas and burgers onto the account ahead of the deposit check clearing. This resulted in like $300 worth of $35 overcharges over $10 worth of actual purchases, 30 seconds before $1000 worth of deposits were put in. Whatever… they fixed it and made it right and we never let that happen again. Then a new $15 charge if your account ever drops below $150. Now we just got a mail stating the $150 minimum will be changed to $250. On top of that the account we just opened a month ago for my teenage daughter will now require a minimum and that made no mention of it while we were there opening it for her.To many changes, we have had enough. As far as a bank goes, they work, just keep a close eye on the endless nickle and dime changes.

name: Llamar Hannibal
review: TD Bank is a really good one. Their customer service is great. Whenever I had billing problems they would immediately solve the problem and best of all its 24/7. Another good thing is well at least at my location the atm is located inside the building and the only way to get access is to slide your atm card in. I feel secure when I withdraw money. When I was signing up for an account the process was pretty painless just the usual fill out your information and sign here. They were pretty clear with their policies. So overall I would recommend TD Bank

name: Lisa Baer
review: I'm reading a lot of comments here that really like their Target credit card, and I liked it as a baby-credit card, but after seeing what other credit cards give me, I really think that the Target credit card is sub-par. When I signed up for it (years ago) I got 10% off my purchases for 24 hours (cue spending spree) and they would randomly send me 10% coupons/vouchers throughout the year if I spent X amount. I never really got any additional rewards AAAND the APR was high AAAND my credit limit was oddly low. It never made sense. Over the years I've used it less and less and now I just keep it around to show that I've had it for so long and I have X amount more on my credit limit available. It was good to me then, but I think there are better cards now. It's a great card if you always shop at Target, but I wish they would give more than just 10%!

name: Beneeta Dean-Felton
review: I shop at Target at least once a week so I applied for this credit card to receive the discount that day and discounts in the future. I do not use my card very often but I do use it during the holiday or special occasion seasons to receive the cardholder discount which is helpful during those times. The interest on the credit card is high so I am sure to pay it off whenever I use it to avoid a high balance. Target customer service for the card is easy to reach if there is ever an issue, which is always a nice touch. I would recommend this card to anyone who is a frequent Target shopper.

name: mary faulkner
review: I have had my Target credit card since 2008 and I really enjoy it. While it is my most tempting credit card it really comes in handy and seems every time I pay it down I find something else I would like to purchase with it. I like that you get 5% off of everything and this really makes it much easier to rationalize purchases. I also really enjoy receiving free shipping on anything I buy online. I recently made a furniture order and saved over 45.00 just on the 5% and shipping discount alone that I wouldn't have saved if I had used a different card. I highly recommend this card however also recommend really thinking about your purchases before making them as the card is very easy to fill up fast for me as Target is one of my favorite stores.

name: Megan Lynn
review: As a frequent shopper at Target, it occurred to me to get the credit card one day. I had “okay” credit- certainly not good OR bad. I was THRILLED when Target approved my credit and gave me a card. The 5% off was a major selling point for me, since I do all of my shopping at target including groceries, pharmacy stuff, back to school supplies, clothes, and more.  I like that you can pay hassle free at the store.The only drawback is that interest is definitely a bit high, but if you pay your card off as soon as possible, it isn’t much of a problem. I definitely recommend this card to someone seeking the 5% discount benefits.

name: Megan Wentworth
review: Target always wants you to sign up for this when you check out and I finally gave in.  IF you do a lot of shopping at Target you can save a lot with this credit card.  5% off your purchase doesn't seem like a lot but since they have everything from groceries, a pharmacy and electronics you could really save.  I wouldn't recommend carrying a balance because the APR is a little high but if you can pay it off when you use it you will get a bargain. You can also benefit a school of your choice by using the card which is great for parents, teachers, grandparents etc.  No complaints about anything yet!

name: Tad Newcom
review: I've been a member of TD Bank for quite a while now, so it seemed to make sense for me to use this credit card as well. I'm fairly satisfied with it, as I've avoided problems - thankfully, never had identity theft, wrong charges, etc, so that definitely factors into it. TD Bank is always certain to notify their customers of changes in plenty of time, and that's definitely true for this card too. The rewards are great, too. The rate is pretty high, though--although I suppose most rates are--and they once did threaten to raise it on me, but I threatened to close the card and I was able to keep my rate. I suppose this is probably true of most cards; I've heard of friends having similar experiences. Overall, I am pretty happy and intend to have this card for a while more.

name: Mike Dehls
review: Not the perfect bank, but one of the best I've dealt with.First the bad:  TD Bank checking is not the bank for you if you live anywhere close to paycheck to paycheck.  If at any point your balance drops below $100, you will be dinged with a monthly fee.  This is the case even if you have direct deposit set up with them.  Compare to: Bank of America, who have never charged me a fee as long as I've had direct deposits going to my account.The good?  Almost everything else.  Long hours of operation, even on the weekends.  This is the biggest plus for me, because I hate showing up to a bank branch only to find out it is closed.  Their bill pay is also excellent, I don't even have to send a rent check to my landlord anymore, they print one out and mail it for me!  Free coin counting is another plus.  Customer service is always friendly.Overall, I've stuck with TD bank because they are worth the potential fee I eat once in a blue moon when my balance dips too low.  Highly recommended!

name: Jennifer
