review: We're really very, very pleased and happy with TD Bank.  They just opened up a branch that is totally convenient to us here in town and we've been very happy with the service we've received so far.  Usually pretty loyal to our credit union, but we've found that the customer service and amenities offered at TD Bank have been really fantastic and we are pleased to hold a savings account with them.  Some folks might view them as another "big" bank, but in our experience we've found them to be more along the lines of an old fashioned small town bank, where fees are reasonable and well explained and customer satisfaction is their top priority.   I can't speak to all of their other services, but I would totally recommend TD Bank to anyone looking to start a savings account with them.

name: Taylor Kristine
review: I love TD Bank - specifically the TD Banknorth branch because I signed up in Maine. I've been with TD Bank for numerous years and I've had amazing service. Whenever I accidentally over-drafted my account, they were quick to switch money over or reverse the charges that I incurred. They have worked with my family members as well and have always had great customer service skills on their end and I've never had any bad experiences with them, and neither have my family members. I think I'll be with TD Bank for a very long time. I've been very pleased with everything. Especially since I moved to Florida and they have expanded their locations to here.

name: Courtney Boze
review: I recently moved to the east coast and out of necessity, had to open a local bank account.  I primarily use the Main Branch in Asheville, NC.  I have had this account for about four months.    The staff are some of the friendliest people ever!  They really seem to care about you, as a person and not as an account number.  They remember you by name! I also bank online.  The website is easy to use.  It seems to update regularly, unlike some other banks I have used.  Debits can be seen almost instantly online.  Credits and deposits seem to take longer than with other banks.TD Bank itself is, however, not as satisfying.  The systems in place for dispute resolution are not of the same caliber of other banks I have used.  I believe most are automated and it's nearly impossible to resolve issues.    Overall, good banking experience.

name: Maya T
review: TD Bank has been the best bank I've been with, although it has some flaws. I have a student checking account, which has been great, but they recently changed their policy on overdrafts; previously, a student checking account included two overdraft fee reimbursements, and it no longer offers that. I also had some trouble with their phone customer service, but I suppose it's pretty common to spend a lot of time waiting for a representative on the phone. They were, however, very kind and understanding when I overdrafted my account with several small transactions, and refunded most of them for me. Overall, I think TD Bank is one of the better banks around, and I'm glad to be a customer of theirs.

name: John Clark
review: I've been pretty satisfied with TD Bank. I've had accounts there for 12 years, and never had any major problems with them. They were very understanding about my accidental overdrafts, and actually reversed most of them. Once, when I had an issue with my PayPal account and somebody hacked in, using my bank account to buy stuff, TD Bank was very helpful, and even allowed me to open a new bank account right away. I'd highly recommend them since they're so convenient (GREAT hours compared to every other bank I've seen around here) and everyone who I've come in contact with there is very nice.

name: Filipe Lebre
review: I had been with TD Bank during the time when they took the place of the local Commerce bank in my town. I couldn't be happier with the service I've received. I have never had any problems, and when I go to the bank to deposit paychecks or withdraw money from my account, I always have good service. They even helped me to set up my online banking account on their website, walking me through all of the steps while I was in the bank. I have to have another bank account with another bank to ensure that when I travel far I have access to my money. I am not willing to pay the ATM fees at other banks to get my money. If they were bigger they would be perfect!

name: Roger
review: Alright, 2 months ago I walked into a local TD Bank in NYC and asked to open an account.  I was drawn to them due to the fact that they are open for full business hours on Saturday AND Sunday.  I walked in with my ID and some cash, and no more than 10 minutes later, I walked out with a new checking and savings account, with almost non existent minimum balance requirements, and my official bank issued ATM/debit card.  I cannot say enough good things about TD Bank.  I have converted all my direct debits/deposits to them.  Their customer service is top notch and they have the feel and attitude of a local credit union, but with a big bank presence.

name: Sam Michaels
review: I've been a customer of TD Bank for a long time, and I'm very satisfied with them as my bank. In all of the time they've been my bank, I have never had a single problem. I not only use them as my bank for my personal account, but my family's business also has a business account with TD Bank. Any time I've needed a replacement ATM card I've gotten it really quickly. Whenever I do have to pay a visit to a branch, everyone I've dealt with has been really nice, friendly, professional, and efficient.If I had to come up with one negative, it would be a small one. A few years ago my password for their online banking stopped working. I had to call twice instead of once to get it reset correctly. Frankly, I don't consider that to be a major problem, and once it was fixed I never had a repeat of the problem.

name: Patty Macho
review: I've been with TD Bank since they acquired Commerce bank, where I had a checking account to begin with since turning 18. 8 years later, my experiences have been mostly good, but only because I qualified for their student checking account, which has no minimum balance requirement. Once I no longer qualify for that, I'll most likely be closing the account. Perks that accounts used to have have been lost one by one over time. I received a letter just a few days ago saying that student accounts, which used to refund one overdraft per year, will no longer do so. I've only over drafted once, by less than $1 and I put money in the same day, and I appreciated the break on the $35 fee for them having to "loan" me 20 cents for the hour it took me to notice the balance and drive to the bank.For a big bank, TD is OK, so long as you qualify for a fee free account. They're not worth paying any fees for though. The extended hours are nice, as is the free coin counting machine for account holders (used to be for anyone), but I wouldn't open an account here now if I didn't already have one.

name: Vinny
review: I have been with TD Bank since they took the place of the local Commerce bank near me. It has been about 6 years now and I am very happy with their services. I have had a savings account with them since the beginning and applied for a student checking account about 3 years ago, which is great as I do not have a minimum balance. I love the longer hours at each branch allowing me to get my deposits in on time to pay my bills. The ease of use of their website allows me to transfer money from one account to the other with ease. On top of that their customer service at each branch I have visited has been wonderful making me trust them with my checking account.

name: Stacey
review: I have been with TD bank since it was Commerce bank.  My favorite part is the coin counter to exchange coins for cash at TD bank locations because they do not take out a percentage of your money compared to other machines (ie Coinstar).  TD is very convenient because they have multiple locations and ATMs.  I give them three stars because there are many fees associated with my checking accout. I did have a single incident where I lost money due to a machine malfunctioning when withdrawing money at their drive thru, and I never got the money back, but the employees were very nice and polite when trying to help me.

name: Robert
review: When I original signed up with TD Bank I was new to the area and needed a new bank. They had free ATM withdrawals and even reimbursed me when another bank charged me for withdrawing money from my account. This was a huge bonus and was the main reason I signed up with the bank since I hardly ever went to a bank in person and was always traveling. I asked the branch manager if I would always retain the 0 ATM fees even if the bank made changes. He promised me that I would be grandfathered in with any program changes. Fast-forward 5 years later and they remove the reimbursement and the 0 fees for ATM withdrawals. I talked to the bank and told them what we were told when we signed up. They basically said too bad and that wasn’t the policy. I have since left the bank.

name: James
review: TD is the only bank I have ever had the pleasure of being involved with. I created a checking account with them 7 or so years ago on the recommendation of a friend and the promise of $25 free for opening an account. Since then I've had no problems with the bank so far and they have always been prompt with notifying me of any policy changes and any sort of event that impacts my checking account. I can't comment on their savings accounts and my only minute gripe is that my local branch never seems to have $2 bills. Not that serious!

name: noel obermeyer
review: I had TD bank when i lived in Nashua, NH.  They had reasonable rates and have very convenient hours! It was also awesome that when i would go down to Florida I could go TD bank down there, so when I got my paycheck sent to me it was very easy to cash, not to mention not having to pay ATM fees!! The customer service is always OUTSTANDING! I really loved this bank !!

name: Audrey Fox
review: I switched to TD from Bank of America about a year ago, because I was really annoyed at all the extra fees they had been charging me.  TD has been such a breath of fresh air since then, I know exactly what I'm paying for my account and it's very reasonable.  Every time I go in the bank they're always very friendly and helpful.  For me it's a perfect mix, because it has the personal attention that large banks like Chase and Bank of America can't afford, but it's still a thriving business that has tons of convenient locations (especially in CT and NYC, where I live).

name: Ora Bittman
review: I shop at Target a lot, for groceries, clothing and home items. Two years ago I decided to apply for a Target card so I could save 5% on all of my purchases. This was the first credit card that I have ever had, so I was worried about being approved. Thankfully Target approved me and I have used this card on and off over the past few years. I have a large credit limit on this card, so I have used it in emergency situations while I was in college. Paying your bill online is very easy and quick. I've found the statements to be easily understood. Overall, I would say my experience with the Target card is very positive.

name: Heather Griffin
review: I've had the Target Visa card for many years, & I think it is very good. I like that you can choose a school to support through their "Take Charge of Education" program, & they will donate 1% of your purchases toward that school. They also give you 5% off your purchases at Target when you use the card, so that is helpful. You can also get free shipping when you shop their site online if you use this card. The interest rate is fairly high, which translates into quite a bit of money if your balance gets big, but if you pay off your purchases each month you don't have to worry about that, which makes this a great deal! I have never had any problems with the company over this card & have no complaints.

name: Karla Rhodes
review: I have been banking with TD Bank for a many years.  I love their hours and convenient locations.  They have always been extremely help to offer solutions for any banking needs.  My daughter was going away to school, they help set up ATM, Visa and checking accounts.  I was going out of the country.  They help me exchange dollars to Euros.  I needed a gift, they helped with Visa Gift card.  I cannot say enough nice things about  TD Bank. They are definitely a large town bank with a small town service.  I have recommended many of my family to use TD Bank.  They care about their customers.

name: Jessica Gameron
review: While I cannot say that I willingly became a member of TD Bank (I was an account holder at Commerce Bank before they switched names), I must admit that Commerce Bank did a better job for what I needed. Everything from lost deposit tickets, to wrong overdraft fees have been a problem for me with TD Bank. When asked about the deposit that THEY lost, I was told it was my fault and I should have kept the small piece of paper they gave me, needless to say it was not the best customer service. While I do have a student account, as long as I just do things myself online I tend to not have a problem. As for getting overdraft fees, it was due to the lost deposit.  I still use TD bank due to location, and it has been a while since I've had an issue, but it was definitely a start off on the wrong foot.  However, as stated I have not recently had an issue, and while the people who work at the desk might not be able to immediately help me with my issues they have always been polite to me.

name: Vishwa Abhilash
review: I have been banking with TD bank since the last 3 Years. I have moved to Cherry Hill, New Jersey recently and have visited the local branch.I am usually very happy with the customer service that the representatives provide and the staff is so customer friendly .Their tellers and customer services representatives are always polite and efficient.The best part is that you don't have to wait for hours in the queue , so that is why I usually come in my lunch time and believe me that time is more than enough to come to the bank, complete my transactions and then get back to the office and then have my lunch. Banking has never been so easy for me.  Even we get regular account statements for the bank. I have decided to continue with the same bank as long as i stay in America. TD bank -- The most customer friendly bank.

name: Lyman Boey
review: After several years of using a bank-issued credit card at Target, I was pleased when I was pre-approved for my Target store card. My husband and I had been in the process of rebuilding our credit for a while at the time and it was great seeing that some of that work was finally paying off. Now that we have moved to an area where Target is one of the few department stores around, I use the card with a good deal of regularity and enjoy a 5% discount on all of my purchases. Combine that with specials and coupons and Target is hard to beat on many household staples and items from Target typically show up on wedding and baby shower gift registries making it super easy to get the perfect gifts sent all over the country with free shipping!I'm thankful Target was willing to take a chance on us with our credit record and keeping our account perfect over the years has given us regular credit line increases which came in handy when I found some gorgeous linens for my new home there along with some new small appliances, kitchen gear and furniture.  Target customer service is great and the clerks are always willing to take the time to help customers make payments and explain any issues without having to sit on hold for hours. I like that I am also able to make payments at any Target store and the service desk personnel are able to handle any questions I have about my account.

name: Melissa Cooper
review: I want to start and say I been with TD Bank for over 7 years! That has to show how much I really value their services. My husband is also a value TD Bank user. I am from the PA area and go to a local branch that is conveniently located about a mile from my house. There are so many locations, which is a plus for me as a customer. The one reason I have stuck with this bank is their hours! What bank do you know has awesome hours on a SUNDAY? Plus, even on some holidays they have short hours, which is another convenience if you need to get money our. Every time I went into my local branch everyone is so friendly and ready to help with anything you need help with. The employees wear a smile on their face and make you feel welcomed. I had a problem where I accidentally over drafted my account and I admitted my issue and they out of their kindness waived my first overdraft fee! Also, I never seem to have to wait long when I am in there. My TD Bank is fully staffed and assisting to everyone in a timely matter. TD Bank really shows how a bank should be ran! I highly recommend TD Bank if you are looking for a bank that cares about their customers and has very convenient hour.

name: Nikki Scott
review: When I got the Target store card I only got it for emergency uses due to the fact that I had a new born baby and wanted to have a plan “B” in case something came up and I was not able to pay with cash for diapers, wipes and other things a newborn baby has to have.  I used it a few times and was especially satisfied with the benefits that it gave to the customers and users of this card. They are a really good company that gives the customer great deals when they use their store cards.  I am a very satisfied customer with their customer service.

name: Cort Widlowski
review: I use this card all the time.  Target uses Visa for their Credit Card provider.  When shopping at Target, I get 5% off my entire purchase.  Unfortunately, I use to get 10% off. Still, a discount is a discount.  When shopping online I get the 5% off as well,  plus free shipping to anywhere in the United States.  This is my primary credit card that I use for personal expenses and occasionally for business expenses.  When I am ready to pay my bill I can transfer money via my bank account or I can go to any target store and pay with cash or debit.  I usually pay at the store because it is only a block away. I highly recommend this card!

name: Nicole
review: I have been with TD Bank for approximately four years. I have a Student checking account and a Christmas savings account with them. I live in MA and go to their Auburn, Sturbridge and Worcester branches within the state. TD Bank has great, very convenient hours. They are open 7 days a week, opening early and staying open late. Their tellers and customer services representatives are always polite, efficient, and friendly. I recently had an incident where I overdrew my account four times in the same time period. It was an honest mistake on my part. I went to their Auburn branch and immediately was able to sit with a customer service representative. Within five minutes, I was leaving the bank with the fees reversed, and I was very happy and impressed. I would recommend TD Bank to anyone looking for a convenient, caring bank.

name: Alex Weis
review: I normally visit the TD Bank branch just north of Bryant Park in Manhattan on 42nd Street and I am usually very happy with the customer service that the representatives provide. I usually go during lunch and, when there is a line, it usually moves very quickly. What also makes them unique is that some of their branches are open on Sundays. I would note that the bank seems to be growing its presence in the New York region, so even though Chase and Citibank dominate the scene, I imagine that several years from now TD Bank will have enough branches and ATM locations to make themselves even more convenient.

name: Tim
review: I recently relocated to South Carolina from New Jersey where I was a customer of USAA. While I was big fan of the great customer service USAA provided, there weren't enough branches locally so I began doing my research. Friend after friend suggested TD Bank so I decided to take the leap and I'm glad I did. From the second I signed up I appreciated the genuine positive attitude of the bankers and have already used their online customer service module. Some banks are still behind the times when it comes to online banking but TD seems to be one step ahead which is important with me. Not only that but I recently got a smart phone and downloaded their online banking app. It allows you to basically do anything revolving around your account except for taking money out of the atm machine. If you're looking to change banks or just looking for your first I would strongly encourage you to try out TD Bank. From the service you get online to the service inside a branch, it's all there.

name: Jennifer Zarichnyj
review: I have never had any issues with TD Bank; from the get-go, I was given a student checking account. At the time, I was an undergrad. It took me a few months to realize that my Savings account was not also a student account; as soon as I met with a representative at TD bank, it took a total of five minutes for the situation to be sorted out. TD has one of the best online banking sites I've come across. It's rarely ever down, and is updated quickly after I make a purchase. I have alerts sent to my phone to tell me when I'm getting low, which is truly a life saver. I also have the iPhone app installed, which is great for on the go balance updates, as well as money transfers with the touch of a button.My only complaint about TD bank is the non TD-ATM fees. I can spend $5 upwards in ATM fees alone unless I feel like walking to the bank. Luckily, it is not too much of a problem, since there is one close to my job.Overall, TD is great. I am even able to get direct deposit from my job. I love that the TD Banks in NYC offer dog treats as well as lollipops - both me and a friend are given a nice treat in addition to the excellent customer service.

name: Mika
review: I've been with TD Bank since 2008, and out of all of the banks I have done checking with, TD Bank takes the cake. First and foremost, visiting their locations is always a pleasant experience; tellers are ALWAYS friendly and to the point, and usually I'm in and out in under 5 minutes. I almost never have to wait in line. Their hours are the big selling point; the branches in my area are open until 8 PM some nights! When I originally signed up before leaving for university, my father also opened an account. We discovered that it's very easy to transfer funds between accounts, which makes this a fantastic option for new college students and their parents. Additionally, most of their checking options have no annual fees or minimum balance requirements.My only complaint about TD Bank is that they have changed their fee policies a few times in the last couple years. Originally, all ATM transactions at non-TD ATMs was free (not including fees charged by the other bank), but a year or two ago, they started to charge a $2-3 fee for every transaction at a different ATM--this is in addition to any charges the operator of the other ATM charges. So, occasionally, if I need cash immediately and there isn't a TD ATM nearby, I end up paying $6 in fees to both banks. However, this is rarely an issue, as they do have a lot of locations. (I've also gotten around this by doing cash back at grocery stores/drugstores... No fees assessed for doing it that way!)Overall, fantastic bank choice for your average college student/young adult.

name: Reese
review: I just opened this account about a month ago, and so far I am a very satisfied customer. It is always very easy to access information about my account, and any time that anything occurs with my money they always notify me. I like for my money to be safe, and I feel that it is very safe with this bank. I have called customer service quite a few times, and they were very courteous and helpful. I am happy that I decided to open an account here, and I will keep it open for a very long time. I would recommend TD Bank to my friends and family, and they know how picky I am about where my money goes.

name: tom
review: I have been with TD Bank ever since they were Commerce bank and I would never change to any other bank. I currently have a checking account and savings account with them and have never had any problems with them whatsoever. Their customer service in the branches I have been to locally and also the online support have always been top notch. What I really enjoy most though it their no hassle checking. I only need to keep a balance of $100 in my checking account which is normally not an issue at all. I can log online each day and check my balance very easily and see each individual transaction. TD Bank is definitely 5/5 stars and I honestly mean that. They have great business hours and atm's all over the place!

name: Joshua Hrisko
review: TD Bank has been my bank now for almost five years. I love it. TD Bank has helped me through hard times and high times. One of the up sides to this bank would have to be its forgiveness toward ATM charges and overdraft. I inquired about an ATM charge a few months ago, and they gave me all of it back. It was stunning! Another great positive toward TD Bank would have to be its rapid transaction rate. I was in Canada for a spring break a few years ago, and I called them in order to have money available in the country, and they had no difficulties helping me have fun in another country. Overall, TD Bank is very professional and a great place to bank.

name: Matthew Mano
review: TD Bank has not always been my bank, but I switched over to them after I heard nothing but good things about them. Their store hours are phenomenal. They are open on Saturdays and Sundays, unlike my old bank. Whenever I ran into a problem with my debit card, they were able to find a solution quickly. On top of all this, they have a ton of locations where I live and banking with them is very convenient. Their checking program is free and their online banking system is very well done. I have never had any problems with their online banking and you can even set up text message alerts when your account balance reaches a certain amount that you set.

name: Sara Gates
review: TD Bank has been wonderful!!  I run my own business and sell at a lot of craft fairs. So most of my money comes in on weekends, or I get checks from other banks. The other local choices (Citizens who charges $7 to cash a check and the employees are down right rude, or Bank of America who is only open 5 days a week 9-4) just did not meet my needs at all. I can go to TD bank any day of the week and they are open nice and late every day of the week. They gave me an account with no questions asked and even issued an ATM card instantly in the store! I later lost my ATM card and cancelling it was super easy over the phone and another card was given within minutes of getting to my local branch. They offer nice kid’s savers account and give them $10 each for reading books over the summer. They also have a change counting machine without fees which is much better then the coin star machine I used to use. I have yet to had a bad experience about them and talk highly enough of the employees at the Epping, NH branch who remember my children’s names even though I have only been a customer for less then 1 month. Wonderful company!

name: Naomi Kovar
review: I had an excellent experience with TD Bank. The minimum balance required to avoid monthly fees is very low. When a dispute arises, they give you credit right away. I had made an online purchase, and my account got charged by an identity theft company who got my account number at the time I made the purchase. TD Bank provided me the phone number of the merchant who had debited my account, and refunded the money to my account right away before beginning to investigate it.  Their customer service phone line is open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, so you can resolve a problem as soon as you notice it. If your debit card gets lost or stolen, they replace it on the spot at a branch. You don't have to wait to get a new one in the mail. Overall, TD Bank provided the best checking account services I've experienced with any bank.

name: Lindsey
review: TD Bank is as fantastic as they come!  Their customer service is top notch.  Their entire staff is incredibly friendly, genuinely personable, and extremely helpful.  They are open every day of the week, even Sunday, and are so motivated to help you find solutions and optimal approaches to any situation.  I can't say enough about how much their employees go out of their ways to help.     They also not only allow dogs in the bank with you, but give them treats and little TD bandannas.  Sometimes the employees even bring their own dogs to work with them all day.  I love that.    I'd also like to present an aspect of TD Bank that no one has mentioned yet.  TD Bank treats its employees very well and that, to me, is a true sign of a caring, organized, ethically run business.  Their employee benefits package is phenomenal.  They also pay a third party company to provide a free and confidential "complaint hotline" service to all employees.  Basically, an employee can call and rant to someone about his boss- or anything else stressing him out- for as long as he wants, and the call stays confidential.  What a fantastic investment in the health and happiness of their employees!Two thumbs up for TD Bank!

name: Kaylania Chapman
review: I bank with TD Bank, and I must say that they are a great bank. The customer service is phenomenal and their products and services far exceed my expectations. TD Bank is an exceptional bank and I'm satisfied.

name: Sarah
review: I have been with TD Bank for about 3 years now and I am absolutely satisfied with my experience.  It was so simple to sign up, and the employees were so accommodating and friendly, especially when I did not understand certain parts of my banking information.  The people at TD are always keen and willing to help explain something to me to ensure that I'm fully aware of all of the aspects and benefits of my account. Every time I enter my local TD branch, I am greeted with smiles by people who seem genuinely interested in how I am doing.  My online banking is simple and easily accessible from wherever I have an internet connection.  The customer service is excellent and I find that there is rarely if ever a wait for me to speak with a bank employee.  Another excellent feature of TD Bank is the hours.  My local TD is open nearly every day, and is open past 'regular business hours', which, as somebody who works during the day, is an extremely helpful feature.  These amazing hours allow me to go to the bank after work and not have to worry that it will be closed when I get there.  Overall, TD Bank has given me an experience far beyond my expectations.

name: Mary Emory
review: I can only say good things about the customer service and products offered by TD Bank. I opened my accounts and my kids accounts in a New Hampshire office, and they made the process so easy. They gave me a full overview of all the services and products, and helped me decide which would be best for me, while saving me money on fees and services that I may not necessarily use. Every time I had a question or had to call, my call was answered quickly or if someone had to return my call, that was done promptly.

name: Adam
review: Throughout my time at TD Bank, I have been satisfied with the service I have received more-so than when I used Bank of America, and previously before that, Fleet Bank, which no longer exists.  The tellers at the branch I go to are always friendly, and despite the fact that I only go there about once every two weeks, they always seem to remember my name even before I hand them the bank slip with my name on it.  To me, that makes every visit a little more personal and is part of what keeps me coming back.  I have not encountered any problems with this bank and I have been faithfully keeping my money with them since 2008.  When I first signed up, I was told that ATM fees would be paid for by the bank, but since then, that policy has changed. Also, sometimes when you call them things can go slow and take a while, so I prefer to do all of my banking online (their site is easy to use, even on mobile devices) or in person at the bank.  Besides that I have no gripes with the service I have received and will continue to keep my money with them as well as have them handle any other monetary needs I may need. TD Bank easily earns 4.5 stars, but I can't give a half of a star so 4 will have to do.  I hope this review helps anyone living in the North-East who is deciding if they want to use TD Bank.

name: James Stewart
review: I first decided on TD Bank because the University I was attending had their ATMs on campus. I have a student checking account and have had no complaints thus far. The customer service is great and their online banking is easy to navigate and use. There's also an app that I downloaded for my phone so I always know my current balance. About a year ago, my debit card number was stolen while I was on vacation - after talking to them on the phone, they took care of everything and took a lot of the stress out of the situation. I would highly recommend TD Bank just based on customer service alone.

name: Tasha Stackhouse
review: TD Bank is the absolute best bank that I have ever done business with. The fact that it is the only major bank that is open until nine o clock and open seven days a week should tell you how much they care about their customers. It took me less than fifteen minutes to walk into a branch and start up my first account with them. The customer service is amazing and it is always a pleasure to talk to them. I'm a huge fan of the coin machine that is located in every branch. TD Bank knows how hard its customers work for their money and they make sure that every single red cent is held with the highest regard.

name: Wendy Edwards
review: I have a personal checking account at TD and have never been anything but thrilled with the customer service I've received. When I opened the account, the employee sat with me and thoroughly explained all of my options along with the fees and things associated with each.  Every time I go, I am helped immediately and they're always very nice to my toddler. She always gets a lollipop and last time we went they also gave me a flyer and some info on a summer reading program for her.

name: Amy Berger
review: I am a customer of TD Bank and I think they are fantastic. They always help me whenever I need help. For example, I like to deposit my paychecks as cash, so they are available right away and the customer services representatives always assist me with this. Also, when I applied for a mortgage with a different bank, the TD Bank staff were incredibly helpful with getting me the bank records I needed and even faxing them over to the other bank. Additionally, they have banking hours on both Saturday and Sunday, which is also a huge plus. Finally, they give away those green pens and lollipops, which is great!

name: Deshea Crumbley
review: I have been using TD Bank for two years now. Its one of the best decisions I have made in my early adult life. I opened a checking account with them right after I got out of the military and relocated to Florida for school and work. The account is great as it has a low monthly maintenace fee and you are able to get your first set of checks free of charge or at a discounted rate. TD Bank also offers a lot of other features that some banks dont have or if they do, they charge for it. One of the features I love the most is the free online baking and bill pay. In todays world it seems like we handle most of our business online so this is very convenient for me. They also offered a debit card rewards program which gives me points for purchases that I make using my card. Finally, one of the most important features to me when it comes to banks is their customer service. TD Bank easily has the best one I have had the pleasure of dealing with so far. They are 24/7 and they have a very small hold time if any at all. If I have encountered any problems, they were able to solve them in a very quick manner. So, if youre looking for a new bank or starting your first account, you should check out TD Bank. Its going to be an investement that you wont regret. They will take care of you and your money in a professional and efficient way.

name: Max
review: I've been banking with TD Bank for a number of years and have nothing but good things to say about this bank.  First of all the hours are as convenient as you could ask for.  They are open seven days a week for my convenience, so I never have a problem getting there to conduct my banking needs.  I'm always treated well there.  I'm on a first name basis with my local branch and am greeted with a courteous hello and a smile when I walk in the door.  I travel all over the Northeast for work and I've never had a problem finding a branch when I need one.  I keep a minimum balance on my account, therefore I have no fees on my account every month.  I get to keep my money!  I like being able to know exactly what my balance is at any time, without having to decipher eight pages on a website to figure it out, and with TD Bank's website I can log on and know exactly where I stand in a matter of a few seconds.  I'm overall very satisfied and very impressed with this bank, and recommend it to anyone and everyone I know!
